Pros and cons are down below) If you want to see a (spoiler free) video review, this game is the 3d (out of 3) that I discuss:
https://youtu.be/zMQY_676fFM

Pros:
1. One of the best games ever, on god. A literal gem. I played through the 1st part when I was much younger and that game still lives rent free in my mind to this day. Story is absolutely brilliant, you can't even imagine how many times it made me feel the feels, cry and celebrate with the characters. My fav part is that every unit that you have and can use in a fight is a person with their own personality traits and friends who they feel more comfortable to fight alongside with. Moreover, if you use a character enough, they reach rank "corporal" which unlocks their respective squad story that makes them grow and develop new character traits or change their previous flaws into something positive. So, every single unit goes through their own little adventure (if you use them often enough to promote to corporal). Absolutely amazing. It's ultimately a game about war but for me it's a game about friendship, love, sacrifices, bravery and what people mean to each other. It also has magic just so you know). Story length is about my playthrough time ~ 60h long but there are also reasons to replay fights and there's plenty of post game content as well.
2. Style. I loved the anime vintag-y style, I think it works perfectly for such game. It doesn't take away from the heavy topics but overall keeps the experience light-hearted, wonderful stylistic choice inmho. Every single character looks great, some models are absolutely amazing. It's just a joy to play as them and to look at the cutscenes and story fragments. Complete edition also has an obligatory anime beach episode if you wanted to know XD
3. Combat. SO MUCH FUN! It's a turn based game. Each unit can move and attack during their action and you have limited amount of actions during your turn. The less actions it takes you to beat the level, the higher the grade and rewards that you get. IF you wanna see more, I showcase stuff a little in my vid, so you can get a better idea. It's a strategy game but it doesn't require you to be a strategic mastermind to have fun and be able to beat the game. It's perfectly balanced, hard enough to be challenging to get a rank A and easy enough to make it possible to enjoy the story without try harding the fights (most of them at least).
4. Pacing. The game managed to keep introducing something new throughout my 60h of playtime to keep fights interesting. It never got boring.

Cons:
1. Main villains of the story are poorly written. (2 of them have the weirdest motivations ever, the rest are great). I get that "they're just crazy" is a good explanation but is a very weak motivation for a good story. Made the ending very anticlimactic imho. I feel like the game should have ended 1-2 fights sooner than it did. But it's just my personal opinion.
2. 2 boss fights (not the same one that I talked about in the previous point) felt very puzzl-y. This game is supposed to be a strategy yet 2 particular boss fights that are happening back to back and were meant to be fun and fresh and unique are actually just puzzles that you have to solve by doing a specific thing in a specific order in a specific amount of turns or you gonna start losing units and will lose. These fights were so annoying, they deserve a place in a "cons" list. On a positive note, you can always look up a playthrough of the fights on YouTube and repeat those specific step to get rank A without any issue. 
3. If you dislike standart anime overreacting overacting overgasping etc, then there's plenty of that in this game. I don't mind it that much but sometimes it just made my eyes roll. Still, I don't think it's such a big deal. I'm not an anime fan and it didn't take away from the story a bit. It's still SUCH A BRILLIANT STORY!!! imho of course

Overall we got 8.5 Crymarias out of 10 (to be fair) but it's a 10 out of 10 in my heart!

Thank you for reading my review <3 Hope you have a nice day and fun gaming! | i have been looking at the reviews for a little bit now some of them shock me. Like to me everything about this game is great. I love everything from the main cast and the side characters to the story and art direction. People are saying the story/characters are garbage, I would have to completely disagree. I would say you get pretty close to the characters and even the side characters. The story is amazing, your pretty much watching friends from when there were kids slowly growing up because of how war changes people. I do got to say though, since it is a anime style game it will have those anime cliche moments but it doesn't ruin the game what so ever as some reviews claim it does, they do it well and gets some laughs from the scenes when necessary. Overall i would have to give the game a solid like 8.5/10 maybe a 9/10. I hope my review makes you give the game a solid chance. | This game has way too many problems. One of the clunkiest UI/UX you can find without coming back to games made in the 90s (and even then, most weren't that bad, from memory) where "looking good" is more important than being practical (and you use the UI A TON during your playtime); badly written main characters, terribly written antagonists (for most of them), nonsensical lore breaking events in the main story, and game rules that encourage not playing strategically but instead abusing the strong component/The Ai's stupidity.

Speaking of the AI, it's way too passive for that type of game, often unable to use most of its move points each turn because it simply doesn't know what it should do, and therefore ends up doing nothing; and you know what? That's actually not the worse the AI does, suiciding several troops into your interception fire without achieving anything is basically one of the most frequent stuff you'll see from the AI outside of "doing nothing".

Luck based attacks are also a terrible implementation in a game that heavily rewards the player for winning in as few moves as possible, since this also heavily encourages reloading fest (and remember what I said about the UI/UX? Yes, that's making the reloading worse as well, of course).

The fact that many of the missions' goal is simply to take a specific camp is a terrible idea when it's coupled with "taking the camp" simply meaning clicking on a flag in a 3 m x 3 m zone without any enemy standing in the zone, since it means that you can win the battle by bringing ONE soldier even with 1 hp left to the destination, without bothering to kill the dozens of enemies in between, and not even bothering to kill all of those that were guarding the camp since if an explosion blows them outside of the 3mx3m radius they're not counted as contesting anymore. This leads to double scout rush/APC rushes with battles ending in your first turn with the enemy never having a chance to play any move. 

Would be fine if that was a sport, but tell me why is the enemy routed just because there's a half dead scout standing in the middle of your tanks and troopers that managed to put the enemy flag there instead of theirs? And remember, the game rewards you for taking less turns. Taking the time to win convincingly by wiping out the enemy with no casualty, or at the very least strongly locking the objective zone with defenders if you don't kill everything, should be a logical way to play that kind of game outside of "we need to reach this fast enough before something bad happen" kind of limited situations, yet it is NOT the rewarded way to play 95% of the time, rushing to the objective with barely killing anything is.

The game at its best moment is nice and compelling to play, but there are way too many problems to call it anything else than a mediocre sequel to the original. It had a few good ideas compared to the first one in the series, like the addition of the direct Command feature and the addition of the APC in particular, but due to the overwhelming amount of problems, using these features regularly feels more like just cheesing the AI with them rather than actually enjoying their tactical potential. At least the first game of the series had a good main cast and a better main story. This one doesn't even have that. Also the bosses in the main story are just stupid to play against.

These things makes the end game gameplay, once you're finished with the story, a way better experience than the main story is.

All of this, and more (I could do a few pages of rants, as well as a few pages of how I would change things to correct those problems, like changing the way a camp is captured, for ex), makes me not recommend the game. I went through it fully and got all the achievements yes, but that was because I already bought it and already invested lots of time going through the story anyway (remember what I said about the post game content being better than the main story phase? that was simmilar in game 1 so I was kind of expecting it). If I knew from the start that it would be that bad, I would have simply never bought that game, and never started playing it. 

It's sad because I think that the idea of directing directly the soldiers is a nice idea that is almost unique to this series, and having tanks -and even better an APC- really adds potential to strategies that can be used, but it all fall flat due to the vast amount of problems the game has otherwise. 

Also,I had to disable the music entirely because the port is bugged with the BGM and it keeps bugging out (well known bug, never fixed in t he port because SE never bother to patch their PC ports).
And I hate that attitude of bare minimum effort for PC port that you see in several console centric publishers. It's crap and there are no excuse when some small publishers manage to have excellent PC port with tons of added value and quick bug patching simply outsourcing the work to peoples that know what they're doing (like PH3 for ex). 
If at least the game had a good port I may have been willing to be more lenient and give a green thumb conditioned to buying the game during sales. But if they're not going to do any efforts for PC players, why should I be forgiving? | Despite being a 2018 game with visual novel elements, VC4 still lacks an auto button.

[h1]HEARTHSTONE 2.0[/h1]

As a veteran of collectible card games I was really positively surprised by Fable Fortune. I find most card games available on Steam, if not all of them, to be dreadfully derivative and boring. They lack creativity for someone who has been playing Magic the Gathering (and other excellent games such as Android Netrunner) for a decade and has already seen the best the genre has to offer. I also wasn't able, despite many attempts, to enjoy Hearthstone, which I will grant is, objectively speaking, incredibly well designed and polished, but has just a couple of quirks that make it a very frustrating experience for me.

And on the surface Fable Fortune isn't that much different. Heroes are also classes with class-specific cards. Each has their own 2 mana power. 30 card decks. 2 cards per deck limit. Units can attack anything on the board. No main- or attack-phases. Crafting. Salvaging.

You can count all the ways in which it deviates from the Hearthstone formula on one hand, but those changes proved to be crucial and make in my opinion for a much more enjoyable and fair game. In fact those little differences seemed to be aimed at removing the most glaring issues that I, and many others, had with Hearthstone.

Let's preface this by saying that as an Early Access game, it has a number of technical issues, disconnects and bugs, and missing important features, however even in this unfinished state I find it madly enjoyable and well worth my time.

[h1]Now for the list of selling points and why you should give this game a chance.[/h1]

I write this assuming you have some knowledge of how Hearthstone or similar games work.

[b]1. Everybody starts with 3 mana.[/b]

The biggest and probably the most significant change is that each player starts with 3 points of a resource used as mana (here knowns as "coins"), instead of 1. What it does is nearly completely eliminates the early-game phase and throws players right into the mid-game and puts them that much closer to the late-game. Coupled with the other points below it minimises the hit you take by bad draws, makes the game less reliant on tempo and getting perfect mana curve draws.

[b]2. Start with 4/5 cards instead of 3/4.[/b]

The thing I could never quite understand in Hearthstone as a game with this much combo and tempo potential (or even a tempo requirement at higher ranks) were small starting hands. By all accounts, the game is in the same ballpark mechanically as MtG, Game of Thrones, Android Netrunner, or even WoW TCG which Hearthstone was based on, but instead of 5 or 7 cards, the players are given starting hands of 3 and have to mulligan/reshuffle that. This makes bad draws feel suffocating and not hitting the tempo or opting for a different strategy wasn't really a choice a player could make.

Now I understand that deck sizes were slashed by half and the game was intended to have a casual appeal, but if mechanics are basically the same, this design decision always felt like a rookie mistake to me and a painful side effect of Blizzard's love for simplicity.

Now in Fable Fortune you start with one more card and coupled with your hero ability, the guard and the quest system, it opens up a variety of options right away. Even as a seasoned player I have to think twice about my opening whereas in Hearthstone most of the time the choices during the first 3-4 turns were rather obvious and choosing to deviate from that could have bad consequences.

[b]3. The aggro is non-existent. Tempo is much less relevant.[/b]

Despite the existence of creatures ("units") with haste ("rush"), they can never make for a MtG Red Colour or HS Hunter-style aggressive deck and are either very low HP and easy to remove or expensive so delegated to the late game. Thanks to the ability of your hero to grant a guard ability to any unit each turn for 1 mana and the starting mana of 3, the aggro strategy... well... would struggle to take hold at any stage of the match. Even when I aggressively hit my tempo and combo well from the start, my opponent can slow it down and defend efficiently if they play something decent and give it guard.

[b]4. Combos are potent but kept within very resonable limits.[/b]

One worry I had was that an increased starting mana pools and hand sizes would make combos easier to execute than in Hearthstone but somehow they made it actually harder while still making them a viable option to pursue. Combo generating units are usually not ones that would also destroy your opponent's defences so they still have an option to attack them next turn. The combos also require some time for the effects to take place, usually at the end of your turn by which time it's your opponent's opportunity to respond.

[b]5. Cooperative events.[/b]

Now this is pretty fresh. A two players vs AI mode. Every two weeks you are presented with a new AI boss, each with distinct mechanics and their own versions of player cards. Quite thematic. Pretty challenging at higher difficulties. If you beat the boss at Hard with all 6 classes you get two rare cards on top of the card pack and stack of silver you got along the way. Once I get my butt kicked by Hard Mode I go back to tweak the decks specifically for this. Very satisfying. I think this could be, with some improvements, much better than Hearthstone expansions, and is already a great way for people who don't feel like playing vs other people to spend time, earn silver and cards.


[h1]ENDING THOUGHTS[/h1]

There are also many minor features I haven't mentioned but definitely add to the experience and make it richer. Heroes can complete quests and turn Good or Evil which changes their powers (and the portraits!). Some cards turn Good or Evil according with your hero's alignment which changes their art and abilities as well. Illustrations have much more space on the cards instead of being forced into a small frame so the whole visual experience is nicer. In general I find the art style to be great and because it is based on an established game series with its own lore, it doesn't feel as generic as almost every other card game on Steam.

But this is pretty much it. The developers still have a long way to go to make the game ready for the release day, but I feel like in those couple of days I already got my money worth and have a hard time keeping myself away from the game, despite the issues and missing features.

I was looking for a beautiful and polished online card game with familiar mechanics so I can feel at home but different enough to inject some excitement into the formula and tweaks to make it less frustrating than other big games in this space and that is what Fable Fortune already has nailed down without a doubt. A suberb foundation for what can with some technical tuning easily turn into many years of enjoyable content. An adventure, even. | Très bon jeux mais il faut quelque améliorations pour le rendre plus agréable a jouer , pourvoir mettre le jeux en français serait une bonne chosse pour ceux qui ne parle pas anglais | Если честно, цена у игры завышенная) Рублей 300-400 для неё было бы в самый раз...

Genres: Action, Free To Play, Early Access
Reviews:
Like any BR, this one has its issues too. However, if the new DEV team sticks with it, it will continue to grow. It's just a matter of continuing to push updates out and improving the engine (eventually at least to Unreal 4). The fact that people mistake this for Fortnite, constantly, because they would have looked the same in a year long past now, means it's popular enough to even be referenced against. Hitboxes are HUGE. The game allows you to be 'bad' but still be an okay player.

Crossplay is the only way to go right now as if you don't, you may not find a lobby to play in. Peak hours of filled lobbies seem to be between Noon CST till around 7pm. That's way better than how it was where it seemed 'dead' all the time.

IMO there's a LOT that still needs to be done. The former 'pros' still destroy people and if they continue to campy camp newer or just plain NEW players to this game, they'll not want to come back. Only way to really fix that is SBMM or add different modes like specifically ranked for the pros that want to fight others on their level and/or public type lobbies (like many other BR's have). I know that's probably way down the road, but it's going to have to happen to draw the players that can only play a couple hours a night because of their busy lives (aka casuals).

They've put some work into the new skins. New Battle Pass with this last update in November. New class, or rather a class brought back from Alpha. Rumors of another new class down the line. Ultimately people just have to have an interest in this game and there are a few creators that play this game that are IN FACT promoting the crap out of it. All in all, it's a fun little BR to get away from the others that are more 'serious' IMO. If you're just wanting a 'getaway' BR, then this one might hook you in once you learn the classes and get to know the small community that comes with this game. | Removeram os servidores da América do Sul.... 
não estão nem ai com os jogadores BR. espero que esse jogo morra de vez!! | J'ai testé pas mal de battleroyal, c'est très fun, bon concept, la nécessité de craft oblige le pvp et empêche la camp pour finir top 1. Par contre, tomber à chaque partie sur au moins un joueur qui a un cheat et qui touche à 100 %, c'est très génant ! | If you do not like getting Beaten up in Hord-Core Fortnite or Call Of Duty.
This is one simpler game to even play with family or play against your family/friends.

12/10 Game | [h2] Eh, it's not bad. [/h2]

Turbo Pug DX is a cute endless runner featuring a pug and many other cute animals.

It's pretty simple, jump over the gaps or to avoid obstacles like walls, spikes or saws. Whilst doing so, there are some coins to collect too, signified by the pug icon, which can be used later to purchase the other animals.

The animals aren't all too different gameplay-wise, some have small double jumps whilst others have the standard jump, it's all about preference.

There are two minigames which can be played by collecting collectible letters that will show up randomly to spell the word "TURBOPUGDX" (much like something you'd see in Subway Surfers). These minigames are a nice escape from the otherwise monotonous gameplay loop.

The game can be especially grindy when going for the achievements, like reaching a certain number of deaths or travelling a super long distance, across all your runs. Personally, would've made it a much lower requirement but that's just me.

There's a pretty cool feature where you can create your own skins (maps). This doesn't change anything about the gameplay or anything, but it's pretty nice visually as the default maps can get boring pretty fast.

The music's pretty good too.

Otherwise, I'll probably recommend this one, it's cheap, simple and I enjoy the art style.

Viking Brothers 2 — это захватывающая стратегическая игра, которая погружает игроков в мир викингов, полных приключений и интересных задач. Вот несколько причин, почему я рекомендую эту игру:

1. Увлекательный сюжет: Игра предлагает интересную историю о двух братьях-викингах, которые отправляются в путешествие, полное испытаний и загадок. Сюжет разворачивается постепенно, что удерживает внимание на протяжении всей игры.

2. Красочная графика: Визуальный стиль игры яркий и детализированный. Каждая локация выполнена с любовью, что создает атмосферу настоящего викингского мира.

3. Разнообразие уровней: Игра предлагает множество уровней с различными задачами, что делает процесс прохождения увлекательным и разнообразным. Игрокам предстоит строить, собирать ресурсы и решать головоломки.

4. Доступный геймплей: Управление интуитивно понятное, что позволяет легко освоиться даже новичкам. При этом игра предлагает достаточно сложностей для опытных игроков.

5. Мультиплеерные элементы: Возможность соревноваться с друзьями добавляет дополнительный уровень увлечения и мотивации.

Viking Brothers 2 — это отличный выбор для любителей стратегий и приключений. Игра сочетает в себе интересный сюжет, красивые графические элементы и увлекательный геймплей, что делает её настоящим хитом среди игр этого жанра. Рекомендую всем попробовать!

(with translator helps)
[h1]Negative:[/h1]
Controls and how the character responds to my inputs suck. Sometimes he can't start running on the first try or does it with a delay if he's close to an interactive object. Why? I don't know.
During battles, it literally kills me (but just in the game). The target-assist system always sucks, but if you get punished for targeting the wrong enemy, it makes you suffer because you might not even do it, but you still get punished just because that's how the game works.
The time stop after every hit is... I don't find this a good idea, but okay. The worst part is that you get a longer time stop if you land a "perfect" hit. And that just breaks the whole process. I wanna f**king SCREAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAM how bad it is. Sometimes my character just stands still, literally, while I spam my buttons, even when not in time stop. Maybe it's some "interesting mechanic," I don't know, but it makes everything worse. I wanna cry in that moment, literally.
And I have a problem with grabs, the most powerful action in this game. Just when I want to grab, my character goes into this "AFK" state. Maybe I just can't get used to it, and it's my skill issue, but it's still not intuitive and not friendly.
Narrator is boring.

[b]Spoiler:[/b]
[spoiler]In one scenario, the protagonist was kissed by a cat, but after he was killed, before he died completely, he realized that she loves him. So, okay, what truth did I get? I got the truth that the bunny is a traitor, of course he is, but why did they add the part where she kisses him and confesses her feelings? Just for what? I still need to figure out the truth about her feelings. That's frustrating. This sucks.[/spoiler]
[h1]General things / Neutral:[/h1]
Choices without choices: the problem with every game that claims to have "choices." They never give you real freedom, not even within the "game borders." Thankfully, we have fixed 4 choices for each ending (I don't know about the "truth"), because I don't need to predict my last choice. But still, I can't relate to what it is MY choice and not the protagonist's, because sometimes he does something I don't want him to do. That gives such a frustrating experience. But this is a story about someone else, not me, right? It's up to you, but I don't like it. Honestly, when he does what I want without additional choices, it feels really good. Thanks that this exists, not too often, but still.
Battles aren't hard; they made them similar to a beat 'em up, with the main focus on crowd control.
I didn't find this story is interesting. Like. So-so or even a little worse.
[h1]Positive:[/h1]
Thanks that I don't need to find every chest in the game to get my max-level swords and stones. Thanks that I don't need to grind for them. Thanks that I don't need to grind through every ending to get the "truth," just 4 specific scenarios. Thanks that I don't need any levels for my character or items to beat the enemy. Thanks that the game still encourages me to be proactive and reactive enough in battle, and there is a reward for it (not a great one, but... still something). Interesting implementation of mouse controls where you need to click on the enemy. Lol, it's like playing a point-and-click action game, ha-ha.
And it's so cool that they even added a feature where, if you drop an enemy's shield while flying, it can stagger other enemies. That's awesome! And you can grab an enemy and use them as a live shield. | Não diria que eu aprovo nem reprovo esse jogo. Monótono demais, sem sal. Pra um jogo de escolhas ele é extremamente linear e o fator replay é quase nulo. No entanto, a história é bem feita, os personagens tem carisma e é uma experiência casual divertida. Minha principal reclamação é que não exista um botão de pular diálogos. Eu me apliquei a pegar todos os achievements, mas pra fazer isso é um grind desgraçado, você tem que fazer todos os finais e ver os mesmos diálogos de novo e de novo toda vez, além de matar uma quantidade interminável de inimigos em batalhas exatamente iguais toda vez. [h1] Quake Champions – Быстрые бои, классический экшен [/h1]

Quake Champions — это яркий и динамичный шутер, который возвращает нас к корням классических многопользовательских боевых игр. С привычной для серии невероятной скоростью, арсеналом мощного оружия и уникальными персонажами, игра идеально подходит для поклонников старой школы, но с современными улучшениями. Вся суть в том, чтобы постоянно быть на шаг впереди противника, и Quake Champions прекрасно передает этот дух.

[h2] Что привносит игра [/h2]

Уникальные чемпионы с особыми способностями. В отличие от классических частей игры, здесь каждый чемпион имеет свои способности, что придает игре глубину и тактический элемент.
Простота управления, но глубокая механика. Несмотря на достаточно простое управление, достижение мастерства требует времени, так как тут важно каждое движение, и каждый выстрел может стать решающим.
Невероятная скорость. Здесь все очень быстро — от передвижений до сражений. Для тех, кто любит сумасшедшую скорость и беспрерывный экшен, это прямо в точку.
Большое количество карт и режимов. Игра предлагает разнообразные карты и многопользовательские режимы, так что всегда есть куда пойти и с кем сразиться.
[h2] Плюсы и минусы [/h2]

✅ Скорость и динамика. Никакой задержки — ты постоянно в движении, а каждый бой заставляет ощущать настоящий экшен.
✅ Интересные чемпионы с уникальными способностями. Каждый чемпион добавляет свой стиль в игру, что позволяет найти своего фаворита и адаптировать стратегию.
✅ Простота, но сложность в мастерстве. Легко начать, но достичь высот мастерства можно только с опытом и тренировками.
✅ Классная аркадная атмосфера. Возвращение к классическому геймплею Quake — смешивание ностальгии с современными элементами.

❌ Невозможно играть на низких настройках без потери качества. При плохой оптимизации на слабых ПК могут возникнуть проблемы с фреймрейтом.
❌ Микротранзакции. Хоть они и не влияют на геймплей, но влияют на внешний вид персонажей, что может раздражать игроков, не желающих тратить деньги.
❌ Некоторые карты могут быть перегружены. Некоторые уровни могут показаться чересчур запутанными, что иногда затрудняет ориентацию в бою.

[h2] Вердикт: 8 из 10 рокетных лаунчей | It's a fun game with a lot of stuff from older Quake games.

This game has all the movement types of the previous Quake Games. Bunny hopping from Quake, strafe jumping from Quake 2 and Quake 3 and crouch sliding from Quake 4.

It has most of the old weapons except the Grenade Launcher and instead got the Tribolt.

The big difference between this Quake and previous Quakes is that you have Champions.

There are 16 champions, and they all have one passive and one active ability. The passive abilities could be different movement other than strafe jumping (two have bunny hopping, two have crouch sliding, everyone has strafe jumping) to regenerating some health, get extra armor at kills, having double jump and many other things.Active abilities is what you activate when you need it, like fire strike, rage and plasma trail, to mention a few.

I recommend checking out the learning section in the game, or the [url=https://quakechampions.fandom.com/wiki/Quake_Champions_Wiki]Quake Champions Wiki[/url] to read things outside of the game.


It's not a game for sneaking really, that won't win many matches, an no matches outside of duels. It's about map knowledge, reading your opponent, strategy, aim and movement, not about trying to spot your enemy (which is why you have a colored outline of your opponents and team mates to easily differentiate between them).

If you're new to the game, you will have a very hard time vs. "everybody" else, cause most have played Quake games for many years, so even barely average players seem like they are very good at the game when you face them, which makes for a very steep learning curve, and there isn't really any training courses or anything like that.

[quote=Fatal1ty]Practice, practice, practice[/quote]

I recommend checking [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=95spyl1LRTc]rapha's movement guide[/url] to get an insight into movement.

It has some issues, and not a lot of funding, and the battle passes are full of the same things except for 1-3 new weapon models each time. Hopefully the next Quake, if there is one, will take a different course and have more not so intense, or hardcore, modes to keep players playing, something more chill, while also having the "hardcore" standard Quake modes as well for those that want the old Quake type of gameplay.

I recommend it cause if you do take the time to learn the game, you can have a lot of fun with gameplay there isn't much of anymore.

It's not very advanced, or even varied, but fast and hard to pull off, which makes it very satisfying to play. | Quake lovers know what this. You need to be dedicated to learn the movements and also the lay of the maps to succeed. | Хорошая игра. Отлично развивает моторику,реакцию и память. | Донатная помойка, никому не рекомендую, преимущество у тех у кого донат.

[b]Such a good game. I remember when this game was first released in 2019, I had it pirated and it would run so bad on my old PC. 40 FPS on low/medium. It looked so bad, but I had so much fun playing it. Finished it 3 times actually back then, and promised myself the next one I'll play it, it will be on a better PC.
 Few years later, I bought it on Steam, and actually played it on Max settings at 100 FPS haha. And damn, it is as fun as it first was.
One of my favourite Horror games of all time. Though the game is quite old, it still looks so good. The rain, the textures, the characters, the reflections, the gore, it is an amazing game. So far my favourite Resident Evil game. Maybe Resident Evil 4 Remake will change that. 
And not gonna lie, as I grew older, horror games and movies stopped getting a reaction out of me. This damn game, and its subtle jumpscares which are so damn predictible, got me so many times. I still remember this one time, recently, since I forgot most of the game. There was a zombie sitting on the bench in the women's bathroom. I was so expecting him to attack me, but he simply collpased as I got nearer. I literally stood still for like one minute trying to process what the Hell happend. I was so expecting him to jump me, but he didn't. And then there is MR X. He is not scary. But I remember playing as Claire, I was sitting in the Clock Tower room, and it was so quiet, the only thing you could hear was MR X's foot steps. Actually terrifying. lol 
Overally, great game. Would recommended it to anyone who loves Zombie games, survival Horror, or just third person games. Looks great, runs great, only had a bug the entire game, and that was because I was playing on DX11. It's cheap too. And you'll get lots of content out of it, so I think it's worth buying even in 2025. 
Also, small rant. I was close to finishing the game on S+ rank on Hardcore in 2 hours. I go killed right at the end. I uninstalled the game. Nope. Never gonna attempt this again. For at least the next 24 hours.[/b]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2954484065 | 如果你没有玩过老一辈的生化危机，不知道这个游戏的解密是什么样的，那么请先用几分钟听我给你举个例子。 假如你去朋友家，朋友在做饭，但是炒菜时花生油不够了，让你拿着瓶子去储藏室装一点来。 你到了储藏室，发现那装花生油的桶上贴了两片胶带，所以你必须去找一个切开胶带的工具，不要问为什么不上手直接撕开，因为这里是生化危机。 你回到客厅，在茶几上拿了一把裁纸刀，回去切开了胶带，打开了花生油桶的盖子，这时候你发现用来捞油的水舀子的把手不见了，你必须去找回来。不要问为什么不直接用瓶子去装油，因为这里是生化危机。 你回厨房问你的朋友水舀子的把手哪去了？他说在地下室的保险箱里，但是地下室的钥匙不见了，保险箱密码他也忘了。他父母可能有线索。这时候不要问他谁这么无聊一个破水舀子的把手还藏这么深。因为这里是生化危机。 于是你把他家整个翻了个底朝天，终于在他老妈的日记里找到了保险箱密码，并且知道了地下室钥匙被他老爸埋在楼上从北往南数第七盆君子兰的花盆里了。不要吐槽为什么这些东西藏的地方这么奇葩，因为这里是生化危机。 终于你在地下室的保险箱里拿回来水舀子的把手，回去装油，结果提示你需要一个漏斗，不然会撒出来。这时候不要说“我就不能小心点倒油吗？”，不能，因为这里是生化危机。 你需要去门口垃圾桶捡一个矿泉水瓶子，再和你的裁纸刀道具组合，切成一个简易的漏斗，终于装好了油。这时候不要吐槽花了半天劲就干了这么点事儿，因为这里是生化危机。 如果你能接受上面的流程，在一个游戏里会反复出现，占据游戏内容的70%的话。那么就可以购买生化危机2re。否则请你三思。 | More than twenty five years after the original Resident Evil 2, Capcom have surpassed themselves and shown how a remake is done right. RE2 Remake is a reimagining of the original yet expands on gameplay and visuals, all the while trying to maintain the core elements and stay true to its predecessor. Players return to the haunting Raccoon City, and can control either Leon or Claire in separate, yet converging, campaigns. The T-virus has spread throughout the city and once normal people are turning to zombies or even worse creatures. Both protagonists arrive in the city on the same day and are trying to piece together what is transpiring and how the evil Umbrella Corporation fits into it all. The game is filled with action and a lot of tense moments. One of the main antagonists is Mr. X, a towering and terrifying creature who will relentlessly pursue us throughout many parts of the game. He can be slowed down but not stopped, and hearing his thunderous footsteps as he approaches truly adds a level of tension and dread. 

While the original had fixed camera angles, RE2 Remake has an over-the-shoulder view, modernizing the gameplay. The combat is engaging, and the game also focuses on survival and puzzle elements. Players need to explore their surroundings and find ammo and equipment to survive. Visually this game has been completely overhauled and improved thanks to the RE Engine. Player and zombie models are superb and highly detailed. The lighting and shadows create a quintessential survival horror atmosphere. Notable environmental highlights are the police station, sewers and lab. The voice acting is solid and compelling. Sound work such as the moans and groans of zombies as well as the aforementioned Mr. X's footsteps truly make this a harrowing experience. The game also ships with DLC that adds more content with different scenarios and challenges. 

Resident Evil 2 Remake is one of the most impressive remakes I have ever played and Capcom has provided a prime example on how to modernize and improve on a classic while not losing its main essense. The Resident Evil series pioneered the survival horror genre and if this, and future remakes, are anything to go by, it will remain one of the best. | Oyunun asıl sonunu görmek için oyunu ikinci kez bitirilmesi fikrini kim düşündüyse onun korpus kallosum'unu s... ama çok sağlam bir remake ve oynanışı ciddi anlamda çok iyi, zaten öyle olmasa ikinci kez bitirmeye zerre uğraşmazdım, alın, oynayın ama bu durumun bilinciyle başlayın. | Resident Evil 2 é com todos os méritos, o remake que os entusiastas e os mais radicais fãs da franquia esperavam. Um showcase de como a RE Engine viria a funcionar com perfeição. Inovando em mecânicas de jogabilidade como o descarte de itens do inventário, arremessáveis que como a faca, também podem ser usados como itens de defesa, além da expansão do inventário ao longo da progressão da história, esta que em relação ao título original, não deve absolutamente nada. Em fato, ouso dizer que esse remake específico é melhor do que o original. 

Na pele de Leon Scott Kennedy, você incorpora um policial em seu primeiro dia de trabalho em Raccoon City. A expectativa é grande para apresentar-se formalmente, conhecer seus colegas de trabalho e entender as normas, o regimento, enfim, como tudo funciona na Delegacia. Uma parada no caminho, eventualmente, transformaria o primeiro dia de trabalho de Leon em um dos testes mais duros de sua carreira. 

Na pele de Claire Redfield, você incorpora uma civil na busca por seu irmão Chris, um dos agentes de elite, parte da equipe Alpha dos S.T.A.R.S. E com um irmão como esse, é claro que Claire seria bem instruída para sobreviver. Talvez até mais do que Leon. Vale ressaltar que a campanha de Claire traz também ao jogador a perspectiva de Sherry Birkin, filha dos pesquisadores Annette e William Birkin, sendo o último, antagonista subestimado mas nunca esquecido, parceiro de Albert Wesker e criador do G-Virus. 
Na pele de Sherry, você precisa fugir das garras do corrupto Brian Irons. Chefe de Polícia de Raccoon City, o que confere alguns momentos de tensão. 

A parte de todas essas inovações, o remake também conta com a exclusividade das segundas jornadas, ou "lado B" para Claire e Leon. 
Neste lado B temos uma introdução, acontecimentos, localizações de itens e resolução de puzzles diferentes, tudo entretanto, sem perder a essência ou destoar exacerbadamente do que foi apresentado no lado A.

Os comandos são extremamente fáceis de assimilar, de forma que desde o primeiro momento o jogador possa aprimorar o uso das armas e munições, formulando estratégias de combate eficiente para os variados níveis de dificuldade, adequando-se também aos estilos de jogabilidade individuais. 
E por falar em armas, as recompensas bônus por zerar o jogo nas dificuldades Padrão e Intenso com rank S em nada deixam a desejar, embora exista a opção de desbloquear tudo via DLC, nada se compara à satisfação de cumprir o desafio de zerar ambas as campanhas com rank S+ e colher as gratificantes recompensas de um trabalho bem feito. Iniciar novas runs com a serenidade de poder metralhar ou explodir o que vier na sua direção. Especialmente o Mr. X que tanto encheu o seu saco ou aqueles G-Adults nos esgotos que levaram quase toda a sua munição para serem mortos.

Dentre os modos extras, alguns merecem destaque. O primeiro chama-se "Sobreviventes Perdidos". Esse modo conta uma mini-história de alguns residentes da cidade, todos com um objetivo, o qual você precisará guia-los em uma única run com itens limitados e dezenas de inimigos pelo caminho. Nada muito difícil, no entanto. 
O próximo chama-se "O 4° Sobrevivente". Neste assumimos o controle de HUNK, Agente da U.S.S.
A missão aqui é avançar por todo o caminho dos esgotos até a delegacia, sendo um verdadeiro teste à capacidade estratégica do jogador.

Por último e não menos importante, temos os trajes desbloqueáveis para Claire e Leon. Todos, sem exceção, de muito bom gosto. Especialmente o conjunto Noir, motivo pelo qual optei por adquirir a edição Deluxe em promoção. O melhor de tudo é a possibilidade de trocar os trajes a cada momento, bastando acessar o menu de pausa.

Depois desta extensa análise, pense em Resident Evil 3 Remake e tudo que ele poderia ter sido. Sentiu um aperto no coração? É, eu também. Resident Evil 2 merece o sucesso que fez, ainda faz e continuará fazendo. Na data desta análise, está próximo de superar o título mais vendido da franquia na forma do Resident Evil 5 e talvez, quando você estiver lendo, já o tenha superado. Isso por si só já diz tudo o que é necessário saber. É claro que vale a pena comprar.

Layers of Fear ist ein atmosphärisch dichtes Horrorspiel, das mit psychologischem Grusel und einer packenden Erzählweise beeindruckt. Die verstörende, sich ständig verändernde Umgebung spiegelt perfekt den geistigen Verfall des Protagonisten wider und sorgt für ein intensives Spielerlebnis. Die detailreiche Grafik und die unheimliche Soundkulisse ziehen einen tief in die düstere Welt hinein. Ein Muss für Fans von psychologischem Horror! | 眼前一亮一亮又一亮，对于我来说是很新鲜的体验，每一个转场都令人惊喜，设计精妙，不落俗套，虽然jump scare并没有吓到我，但视觉体验还是很顶级的。关卡设计很有趣，一些循环，重复，不使人厌烦，恰到好处，中间也有很好的叙事方式，印象深刻的是那间婴儿房，从温馨到恐怖，惊悚之余有一些伤感。另外，解密简单，很好操作。一层层剥落故事抵达真相。目前还没有打到结局，但我很期待即将解锁的第一个结局。 | This is a really good horror game. It may not be for everyone because of its focus on the plot rather than focusing on gameplay. I personally like playing these types of games from time to time, so for the most part, story driven games boil down to your preference. I think this is a really good game, and it is worth while!

The only cons I have for the game is that some of the sound effects were taken straight out of Amnesia: A Machine for Pigs. Some sounds will loop in the background and can get annoying to listen to. And finally, the monster in the game is not very threatening, and is easily avoided by simply not going near her. But, that won't be an issue since you can literally out-walk them.

For the most part, it's a decent little horror game. It's very short! You can easily beat the game in under two hours on a first play-through, so it's a good game to pass some time if your in the horror mood.

I'd give this game a solid 7/10. | [h2] 步步惊险的步行模拟器 [/h2]
层层恐惧其游戏本身其实并不算恐怖，尤其是对于不怎么玩恐怖游戏的人，但对于玩过不少恐怖游戏的人来说，这种慢节奏无时无刻不在攻击人的心理防线。因为恐游爱好者对恐怖点的设置通常有了一定认知与预测，但层层恐惧偏偏反其道而行，并未设置太多惊吓点，造成自己吓自己的场面。 | another ok short horror experience, mostly walk sim with an engaging story and cheap jumpscares left and right. Still kinda worth trying out.
Juego sencillo, entretenido, con 3 facciones muy distintas(tanto en aspecto, tropas y hechizos) y con toque de humor que le da un buen toque. | e

This games leveling system is simply a prolonged tutorial. You fight your way up to black belt over the course of your first week, and once youve unlocked all of the moves, the game actually starts. Messing around in your own training dojo and having that thrill of going "What if I use hold on this wall, dash a few times and then punch it with a charge stone equipped?" and realizing that yes, this combo already exists and has been discovered, but that you discovered it yourself. I have only just unlocked all of the moves mere hours before this review, but I can't wait for that little number next to 'Total Playtime:' to be hundreds of hundreds of hours, months after this review. If you want to get this game, scroll up, and buy it. NOW. | Definitely download if you have a vr, Sure it may be expensive but the fun can be endless, to have fun you need patience, time, skill and Practise, a WHOLE LOTTA practice The queue times can be quite long but the community is amazing, 10/10 wish i got it months ago | I got this game when it came out and played it for a little while, then got bored. Back then there was only a handful of actually 'good' players, so you were almost always fighting someone around your skill level, which was perfect. 

I replayed it today after years of leaving it and of course I had completely forgotten most of what I learned, not much of an issue I will just go into multiplayer to re-learn it all...

The problem is that there is pretty much no skill-based matchmaking, you just get paired up with whoever since there are so few players. This presents a HUGE issue because you will often go up against someone 10 or even 50 times better at the game than you. You will stand NO chance against them, and you learn nothing for it since they - no joke - beat you in a matter of seconds. 

I ran into someone today that just made me quit right after. Match starts, he zips towards me faster than I have seen anyone move in the game and does some Naruto Earth-Style Jutsu type beat to fling rocks and discs and walls and pillars at me, and in 5-10 seconds, the fight was over. I could not even get ONE move off before I was beaten. It was a horrible experience, and it made me realize that this game is just not worth it get in to as a new or inexperienced player.

Also, the casting style is still extremely restrictive like it was back when I first played. You need to do the EXACT hand gestures to pull something off, and sometimes you will just be doing the same gesture over and over until you finally get it right.
If you have limited or slow arm mobility like I do, it is difficult to do many of the moves.

Bottom line is: It's a fun game if you have someone to play with at your skill level and get better with, otherwise it's a horrendous experience that makes you want to stop playing. | this game is great i love the fighting style . if your on quest 2 i would not worry just lower the settings and it will run great. | Great game, great community, great workout, small dev team. Come see what its all about and eat rocks.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, RPG, Early Access
Reviews:
Valheim has become a cherished part of our family time since its release, and we often find ourselves diving into new adventures during the holidays. Each of my three boys brings a unique flair to our gameplay: one loves to explore the seas with our trusty boats, another dives headfirst into danger, pushing us to gather resources in the most perilous biomes, while the youngest shines as our master base builder. We all contribute to the game in our own ways, but it’s clear to see each of our preferences. For me, Valheim truly checks all the boxes for an engaging and immersive experience. | 傻逼体力条，傻逼传送门禁止传矿，傻逼地形，傻逼斜坡滑步，傻逼怪物索敌追出去两里地。傻逼设计师，尼玛的你玩了吗。 | 어떤 두 남자가 발헤임 플레이 하는걸 보고 관심이 생겼다.
이 무슨 파상풍 걸릴 것 같은 게임이지 싶었지만 착각했다.
듀오로 시작한지 150시간째, 왜 몬스터를 마주할 때마다 한 남자가 그렇게 지맨이를 찾았나 싶다.
누군가와 함께 할 게임이 필요하십니까?
발헤임으로 오십시오. | Отличный симулятор смерти. 
Каждый раз себе обещаешь, что удалишь эту игру, а потом ревешь в подушку и бежишь за лутом.
10 катапультированых друзей из 10 | [h1] Valheim: отличные идеи, зажатые в рамках искусственных ограничений. [/h1]

Valheim — это замечательный сурвайвал, в котором идеально сочетаются исследование и строительство. Игра впечатляет своим графическим стилем и атмосферным саунд-дизайном, погружая в мир викингов. Казалось бы, всё для идеальной игры на месте. Но чем дольше играешь, тем больше замечаешь, что разработчики будто намеренно вставляют тебе палки в колёса. Тут почти каждая механика не просто усложняет тебе жизнь, а делает это максимально раздражающе.

[h2] Инвентарь и грузоподъемность: гениальные решения.[/h2]
В игре у персонажа 32 слота инвентаря. Казалось бы, что этого достаточно. Но 10-12 из них заняты экипировкой (броня, оружие, инструменты и стрелы). Выходишь из дома, а треть инвентаря [b]уже забита[/b], а в оставшиеся слоты моментально попадает случайный хлам: семена, смола, ягоды, шкуры, мясо, камни, дерево. Никаких рюкзаков/сумок или отдельных слотов под броню и оружие в игре нет. То есть получить дополнительные ячейки инвентаря мы никак не можем (без модов). Далее, вы ограничены по весу предметов. Да, это логично, но весовые ограничения смехотворно маленькие, а металлы (в том числе руда) [b]ВЕСЯТ ДОХРЕНА.[/b]
Единственный способ увеличить переносимый вес — это пояс, который можно купить у торговца. Конечно найдите его сперва, а потом накопите золота на покупку. А теперь внимание: пояс занимает слот [b]аксессуара.[/b] А что еще вешается в этот слот? О, всего-лишь важные предметы, которые помогут вам в других поздних биомах! Например, душка с болот, без которой трудно искать серебро, или светлячок, без которого туманные земли — сплошное бельмо на экране. И как вишенка на торте: металлы и руды (а так же ядра суртлинга и некоторые другие ВАЖНЫЕ предметы) нельзя переносить через порталы! Вы любите гринд? Вам придется переть руду на телеге по ужасным дорогам или плавать на корабле, рискуя утонуть с грузом. Причём разработчики ввели возможность перебрасывать металлы через порталы... но только в самом конце игры, когда это уже не нужно! Ну класс, спасибо!

[h2]Сундуки: вам их понадобится слишком много.[/h2]
10 слотов в стандартном деревянном сундуке — это смех. При этом нормальные сундуки открываются на более поздних стадиях игры, но требуют ресурсы, которые нужны для крафта оружия и снаряжения (армированный сундук 24 слота, сундук из черного металла 32). А сундуков нужно просто [b]ТОННЫ,[/b] потому что инвентарь маленький, переносимый вес крошечный, а ресурсов требуется очень много. В итоге на базе ты чувствуешь себя не викингом, а скорее кладовщиком.

[h2]Крафт и грейды: готовьтесь гриндить.[/h2]
Создание оружия и брони — это нормально, я это даже приветствую. Но вот их улучшение превращается в ад. Например, чтобы прокачать железный меч до максимального уровня, нужно 80 железа. Для этого вам нужно перенести около 800 единиц веса на собственном горбу до плавильни. Это в 2,5 раза больше, чем может носить персонаж!. Давайте возьмем другой пример — меч грейдом пониже, бронзовый. Для его крафта и полного грейда нужно 32 бронзы. Вроде бы не много, да? Но бронза производится из меди и олова по соотношению 2 к 1. То есть нам нужно 64 меди и 32 олова, а это почти 900 единиц веса нужно будет перенести у себя в кармашке до плавильни! При максимальной грузоподъемности персонажа в 300!!! А ведь железо потом нужно будет добывать в болотах, таскать его пешком или на корабле... и всё это ради каких-то +7 к урону?
Представляете сколько беготни туда-сюда вам предстоит? И так абсолютно со всеми металлами. Любой грейд требует чудовищного количества ресурсов, растягивая игровой процесс до абсурда. Разработчики явно решили, что игроки не должны получать удовольствие, а должны страдать.
[b]Разбор предметов? Да не, сжигайте их к чертям.[/b] Вам больше не нужна старая дубинка, топор или кирка? Разберите их на ресурсы. А, стоп, нельзя? Можно только уничтожить? Да и то, только если вы скрафтите специальную постройку. Окей... логично... наверное.

[h2]Выравнивание земли — настоящее испытание.[/h2]
Хотите построить красивую базу? Будьте готовы к тому, что выравнивание земли — худшая механика в игре. Оно работает ужасно криво, требует кучу времени и [strike]нервов[/strike] стамины, а идеальной ровности добиться очень сложно. Каждый раз, когда ты пытаешься сделать ровную поверхность, игра будто издевается над тобой. А так же, как по мне, генерация ландшафта в игре через чур холмистая, что тоже наваливает проблем. Если бы механика выравнивания работала лучше или хотя бы была возможность проще находить более ровные участки для строительства, это сильно упростило бы процесс и сделало бы игру менее раздражающей в этом аспекте. Особенно учитывая, сколько времени и ресурсов уходит на выравнивание. Особенно сильно в этом плане напрягает постоянная нехватка стамины. О, кстати о ней.

[h2]Стамина, которая кончается моментально, восстанавливается вечность.[/h2]
Стамина в игре расходуется на всё: бег, прыжки, плавание, перекаты, атаки, стрельбу из лука, блок, строительство, выравнивание земли, работу в огороде и много еще на что.
Идея классная, но баланс — тихий ужас. Стамина тратится [b]КАТАСТРОФИЧЕСКИ[/b] быстро и восстанавливается очень медленно. Да, в игре есть бафф бодрости, который ускоряет её реген, но максимальная длительность этого баффа около 30 минут. Если комфорт минимальный, то он длится... [b]ВОСЕМЬ[/b] минут. При чём есть куча дебаффов, которые режут реген (например холод и сырость). В итоге ты постоянно выдыхаешься, что замедляет твоё развитие. Любая активность превращается в мучение.

[h2]Еда: вечный голод — вечная проблема.[/h2]
Да, в игре из-за голода вы не умрете, но еда дает временные бонусы к ХП и стамине. Мне нравится эта механика, но проблема в том, что эффект быстро ослабевает. Вот ты наготовил себе стак мяса, покушал, пошел делать дела. Спустя 10 минут эффект от мяса ослабевает на столько, что ты вынужден съесть еще. А потом еще и еще. В итоге ты вечно голоден, вечно жрешь и постоянно добываешь новые продукты, потому что старые кончаются быстрее, чем ты успеваешь вздохнуть. Да продлите вы эффект от еды, ей богу, 20 минут это катастрофически мало.

[h2]Кузницы, верстаки и плавильни: зачем их столько?[/h2]
Ты доходишь до нового биома, у тебя появляется новая кузница/верстак/плавильня... но старые по прежнему нужны!
Новая плавильня выглядит круто, но не может переплавлять медь, олово и железо, только черный металл и огнеметалл. Почему? Какого черта? Новая кузница не заменяет старую, а просто становится дополнительной. Почему бы не сделать один универсальный плавильный агрегат? Новый верстак? Да, но старый тоже остается, потому что без него старые рецепты недоступны. В итоге у тебя база превращается в какой-то завод, заставленный разными станками и печками.

[h2]Итог.[/h2]
Valheim — это игра с потрясающей атмосферой, но чудовищно неудобными геймплейными решениями. У игры огромный потенциал, но вместо того чтобы сделать её сложной, разработчики сделали её попросту неудобной. Здесь слишком много лишних ограничений и искусственного усложнения: маленький инвентарь, ограниченный переносимый вес, невозможность переносить руду через порталы, бесконечный гринд, неудобные сундуки... Всё это не делает игру интереснее, это просто раздражает. Да, можно отключить рейды мобов, можно включить перенос руды через порталы, но почему я должен вручную исправлять неудобства, которые были добавлены в игру намеренно?
Если вам нравится страдать, эта игра для вас. Если нет — готовьтесь терпеть жесточайший гринд или ищите моды, которые исправят глупые ограничения. Игра предлагает вам стать викингом, но вместо боёв и приключений ты большую часть времени проводишь, таская руду, копаясь в сундуках и страдая от перегруза.

说来也巧，这游戏我刚玩没多久，自家的服务器3306端口还真被黑了，还贴心的给我留下了一个邮箱地址，当然，我也像着游戏里面一样给这个邮箱来了一个经典回复 | Fun little hacking game. 

It has a few flaws: Firstly, notes taking up RAM, let alone a lot of RAM. I sort of get what the devs were going for here, but all it does is encourage the player to pull  up a notepad on their second monitor, especially in the endgame when you need to juggle passwords and IP addresses for upwards of a dozen machines. Secondly, the node map. It's a cool concept but its insanely cluttered and unusable, to the point where the DLC gives you a way to sort it, so the devs know its a problem. but you just have to deal with it until you beat the dlc (intended to be played late in the main story)

Beyond those flaws though, it's a very good little hacking game. The terminal setup is cool, the story is surprisingly compelling, and it's got a neat series of puzzles that are very intuitive, even for me as someone without a background in cyber security. Recommended, just, take your own notes. | 黑客模拟器（x）
脚本小子模拟器（√）
游戏的骇入行为不需要了解计算机网络安全相关知识，只需要运行脚本即可，简化了黑客行为；
内存占用机制和追踪机制仍为游戏提供了一些乐趣。
————
游戏设计了一个简单的命令行系统，支持了简单的linux指令，但是一部分常用的linux指令没有支持（比如rm -rf *，乐）
推荐一口气通关，因为隔一段时间玩的话，游戏机制会忘光…… | Challenging puzzles, fun mechanics, engaging stories, and a great soundtrack. If you're a patient gamer that enjoys being presented with detailed tasks in narrative form and taking the time to work through enigmatic webs of mystery this is the game for you. Sure, it has its high stress moments where you have to work quickly, but Hacknet does not overuse the mechanic and allows you to think your way though complicated scenarios. The game over mechanics are forgiving as most of the enjoyment comes from the well written storyline and satisfaction you feel when you finally solve the mystery. There is the added bonus of workshop content and being able to create your own campaigns as well. | Fun text-based adventure game that emulates old-school hacking in a very movie-like way. There's a few adrenaline rushing moments and surprising events. It's not for everyone, but I enjoyed it greatly.

[h1] Reventure [/h1]

[h2] Introducción[/h2]
[b]Reventure[/b] es un juego donde nos surmergé en una larga aventura donde eres Tim el protagonista, un simple y pixeleado Link en busca de la princesa... Pero ¿qué pasaría si nos desviamos del camino? ahí es donde empieza [b]Reventure[/b] en búsqueda de los 100 finales llenos de humor uno seguido del otro desde el más evidente hasta el menos inesperado, uno que otro con referencias como lo pueden ser series, animes y otros videojuegos.

[h3] Puntos Positivos [/h3]
Aunque puede llegar a ser medio agotador el simple hecho de pensar en hacer 100 finales, no llega a ser aburrido... O al menos hasta el final, ya que conforme avances en los finales se írá actualizando el mapa haciendo que otros finales sean más rápidos de lo que serían sin esto, incluso contiene pistas. Por otra parte este juego cuenta con unos diálogos ingeniosamente cómicos incluso donde uno menos se los espera. Contando con un buen [b]Soundtrack[/b] y un [b]Pixel Art[/b] el cual le conviene bastante.

[h3] Puntos Negativos [/h3]
Puede llegar a sentirse pesado ciertos finales pero en verdad son muy contados, en mi experiencia Platinando los finales [spoiler]92, 86, 75, 87, 88, 91, 93, 101 (su proceso)[/spoiler] fueron un algo frustrante el saber como conseguirlos, ya fuera de eso no logré encontrar ningún Bug que llegara a perjurdicar mi partida el único punto negativo es la propia experiencia que uno puede llegar a tener con ciertos finales.

[h2] Conclusión [/h2]
Un buen juego para pasar el rato sin necesidad de una historia la cual deba respetar, si tienes la oportunidad juégalo siempre existe el reembolso en [b]Steam[/b]. | На первый взгляд игра может показаться страшной и скучной, но это далеко не так. В игре присутствует аж 101 концовка, каждая из которых наполнена юмором и оставляет после себя изменения на карте или персонаже. Концовки есть как очевидные и лёгкие, так и те, для получения которых можно поломать голову и залезть в интернет за подсказками. В общем игра на любителя, но лично я не капельки не пожалел потраченных денег и прошёл её от и до. | La verdad, con su cantidad de finales tan graciosos, este juego me encanto, pero si no se apetece buscar todos los finales creo que seria un desperdicio, si te lo compras consiguelos TODOS! | [i]"Após jogar por horas tentando pegar todos os finais de [b]Reventure[/b], Tim teve um mal súbito e morreu faltando um final para completar o jogo."[/i]

Definitivamente é um dos jogos mais criativos que eu já joguei. As possibilidades que o jogo te apresenta são inúmeras e você se diverte demais a cada final realizado [i](infelizemente o Tim não teve a mesma sorte)[/i]. A construção do mundo é muito bem feita e encaixa perfeitamente com os itens que você encontra pelo jogo.

Além disso, vale a pena descobrir a revelação do último final...

Genres: Action, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Strategy, Free To Play
Reviews:
Well lets be honest here this game could have been amazing but of course the community doesn't help with things, we will get into all that later in the review.

For now lets go over the Pros and Cons.

Pros:
- Gameplay is very addicting and fun
- Lots of units, even with most being worthless
- Open world, even with it too being worthless
- Quite a few classes, of course most must be nerfed to the ground

Cons:
- The community
- Competitive aspect played through discord
- Pay to win has been involved for many years now, even with people thinking it hasn't
- Meta units and classes, if everyone uses the same units and classes whats the point?
- They glitched the glamour system for many, including me that removes your beards on your glamours, causing you to look far different with your glamours you invested thousands in

So lets get into the community first, everyone knows with these games theres always people that know best, or want people to play how they want you to play, example if they rush in and die in a simple casual mode they will rage, cry and whine the entire match, they can have seven to eight deaths and sit there spending literally half the game time on respawn timer crying about their team, this becomes personal and people will hold grudges, just from simple casual matches.. so then it goes into the next and if they get on a team they will always cause further issues, to the point they violate the rules over and over. 

Now put this into play with competitive, people can ruin peoples entire seasons just with being babies or accepting toxic groups of players into their guilds, as the community is so small you simply cannot escape these issues and its repeated literally every season.

Casual is fun at times, just block things out, but overall if you play competitive, the game is literally hand in hand with Discord, I would honestly go as far to say serious guilds spend more time on discord dictating who gets whats, how things will go, what will happen and so on each season, ruining the entire aspect of competitive gaming. You can try to play a season but guilds will merge, hop skip jump around, toxic people accepted, toxic groups accepted, they cause issues, jump to the next and rinse and repeat each season forming this disgusting pattern that literally ruins the desire. Why people would want to reward this system is beyond my understanding.

Glamour system is amazing - well use to be until they caused glitches within their own system by adding a "New tab and Old tab" for customizing your charc, You want to mix and match attires to look your best most times, so you equip stuff and boom over 90% of your attires helmet no longer work because they change your face to some androgynous looking disgusting model. This system of course is to much for them to care about just keep spending money okay? They will add new models with crappy beards and other junk, spend more and more it will be fine. 

Overall this game was one of my favorites for years, we've been here since the start but now days its not even fun in the slightest, I would recommend it to people if they wanted to just play it every now and again, not getting involved with anyone or any guild. Other than that, stay away. Far away.

3/10 | muy buen juego el balanceo entre las clases es buena y aun mejores graficos se ve estupendo y sobre la nueva temporada no hay palabras un 10.
saludos | Игра катится в пропасть, нет развития, только вонючие сезоны и задания | 啥东西啊大叔大婶 | .

Genres: Action, Massively Multiplayer, Strategy, Free To Play
Reviews: Хубава игра

I don't want to assert this too soon, but this is possibly the most awesome game ever made.

One of the only flaws this game has really, is that it has the most annoying trope that keeps popping up, that is so cliche, played out, and passe: "Yakuza 0 is awesome" trope. The most tiring part of wasting so much time having lots of fun was that everything was immersive and engaging in gameplay and presentation. 

It was also extremely repetitive. It just wouldn't stop blowing my mind and I was getting so tired of it. Does this game just feel the need to be really cool all the time? It's a lil extra, but if that's your thing, go for it.

One of my favorite games for sure. It's not without it's flaws, but I definitely enjoy it a lot. | I’ve been gifting this game to randos in my friend list cause it deserves to be played. Just make sure u do the Side Stories for each character, those upgrades are essential | Yakuza 0 é um jogo que eu já havia zerado anteriormente e indiscutivelmente é um jogo muito bom. A quantidade de coisas que tu tem pra fazer no jogo são imensas e mesmo com quase 100 horas de jogo ainda não consegui completar tudo o que tem pra fazer no game. Vale muito a experiência e recomendo como primeiro contato para quem nunca jogou nenhum jogo da série. (a única coisa que me incomoda um pouco seria o fato de que você vai ter que aprender a jogar Mahjong para poder platinar, mas ai vai de quem querer platinar esse jogo mesmo) | 其实早就打完剧情部分了，不过感觉很难找到足够丰富的词汇描述这部游戏所以一直没写评价，因为它实在是太出色了！
作为我的如龙入坑作，它真的太精彩了，它肯定是我玩到现在剧情最好以及主角性格刻画最出彩的JRPG。而且很难得的是，作为一部群像剧，它在主角形象塑造得很棒的同时还创造了大量形象鲜明的配角，某些只出现几次的角色也能做到让人记住性格特点；同时，支线任务里也有相当一部分内含不错的短剧情。
所以我要开始接着玩了！我已经迫不及待去看桐生和真岛在接下来的时代里到底发生了怎样的故事（ | I tried writing a short review and kept making it too long. I tried playing a short game about organized crime in Japan and ended it with 60+ hours.

Surprising is the word I would use to summarize this game, in a good way. I am surprised that they charged me 8 fucking dollars for this. I am shocked it ended up being one of the most serious and also stupidest games I've ever played. I am gob smacked that this game managed to make me cry while also making me laugh.

I am stunned that you might be reading this review instead of just experiencing the game for yourself.

Final thoughts, I can't wait to see the rest of the games. I also can't believe I've had this game sitting on a figurative shelf for nearly 4 years before playing it. It's not a deep game in the slightest but that works to its advantage I'd say.

[h1]A [spoiler]8[/spoiler] out of 10 game.[/h1]

[h2][spoiler]Easy and fun to play through like [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/2379780/Balatro]Balatro[/url] in many ways, at less than 20% of the price. The sound-effects are also cute and equally pleasing in that same vein[/spoiler].[/h2]

Upgrades at the shop, along with re-rolls happen after every round, and any/every round/level lasts no longer than 30 seconds, thus turn-arounds and pivots at the shop happen in pretty quick succession, multiple times a minute from the get-go, allowing you to quickly build/draft your set of fighters from something or nothing at any point during a run. After about every 5 levels or so you also get to choose 1 global enhancement for all the respective fighters you've collected. It's that simple along with boss encounters and minimalistic controls, with practically no learning curve.

[h2]There's no b***s***'n with tutorials or any story line before you start. It takes less than a minute to directly jump into the game after purchasing.[/h2]

Everything is there in front of you, short and sweetly after that; ready for your 'full attention' & low-friction neuron-activating enjoyment with a steady, unbroken stream of combat and rogue-like choice-making gameplay. | bought because i said in a discord server "say, what if there was a game like slither.io but with roguelike mechanics and you could build your snake out of synergizing segments?" and was recommended this.
a truly underdeveloped, unbalanced and all around flawed game. all luck, no skill. unclear UI that i only started to understand almost 7 hours in. the core gameplay of fighting enemies is unsatisfying and unfair due to controls that do not facilitate the game design. or perhaps the other way round? who bloody knows.
Please do not buy this game, there are other games similar to it that are more worth your time IMO, the closest thing is Brotato and despite not having the snake gimmick thats practically a benefit since the snake gimmick is this games biggest fumble | Minimal instructions were initially befuddling, but it was actually fun to figure out the subtleties of control and snake design. Very satisfying to build a nice overpowered snake with stacking abilities and items. | It's a fun little game and for the price of a mobile game? Absolutely the sufficient content to match. Solid replay-ability through testing different builds and strategies. | A simple game where you build your snake from segments that all have their own "class." Activate powerful class bonuses by having enough of the same type. It's a neat little game with tank controls which feels kinda weird at first but you get used to it.

Genres: Action, Free To Play, Early Access
Reviews: No Reviews

De longe um dos jogos com o sistema mais complexo que já joguei, não é nada amigável para novatos na franquia, tutorial é praticamente inexistente, algumas mecânicas são similares a outros jogos de mesmo gênero aí da pra levar, mas não recomendaria este aqui ser o primeiro RPG a se jogar. O jogo é complicado do início ao fim, porém a imersão é muito boa, possui um plot interessante, personagens bem escritos que participam ativamente da sua jornada. É um jogo tático baseado em RPG de mesa e sua progressão é toda feita em escolhas e rolagens de dados, e sobre as escolhas, são bem impactantes e possuam consequências reais no desenrolar da história. Elas são baseadas no sistema clássico de tendências em RPG, ou seja, além de você poder ser bom, mau ou neutro, existem escolhas mais específicas como Lawful Good, Chaotic Good, Lawful Evil, etc. quanto mais escolhas boas ou ruins você faz, isso desbloqueia diálogos com interações diferentes.

Logo de início o jogo já te pede pra criar seu personagem em uma ficha enorme de algumas páginas com muita coisa pra escolher, da pra ficar perdido ali. São dezenas de classes, as possibilidades de builds são imensas, da pra misturar classes, tem centenas de habilidades, magias e efeitos diferentes. Infinidade de itens e armas e tudo mais que se espera em um RPG deste tipo.

O combate é tempo real com pausas, porém da pra colocar em turnos e jogar de forma praticamente idêntica a jogos como Baldur's Gate 3. Sendo bem sincero o modo em tempo real é ruim, as batalhas viram uma bagunça, você precisa pausar o tempo todo senão fica difícil coordenar os personagens e aí vai tomar infinitos debuffs roubadíssimos e vai morrer sem ver nada, por isso recomendo jogar em turno mesmo. Ao longo do game existem encontros aleatórios no mapa, contra bandidos e inimigos mais fracos e repetidos, neste caso é tranquilo de fazer em tempo real pois normalmente são batalhas bem mais fáceis e rápidas.

Pathfinder Kingmaker é um jogo indie e o primeiro do estúdio, então muita coisa é mais limitada, mas algumas delas me incomodaram bastante, como por exemplo a câmera que não gira, a navegação do jogo é através de um mapa onde você escolhe um destino e entra na área, por conta disso exploração é muito fraca, estas áreas normalmente são bem pequenas. A iluminação do jogo é muito ruim, o seu personagem emana uma luz ao redor dele e todo o resto é escuro, é uma fog que é presente até durante o dia, me incomodou bastante.

Dentro do jogo tem um minigame de gerenciamento de reinos, onde você simula a evolução do seu reino, afinal um dos plots do jogo é você evoluir desde um mercenário até virar um Barão e se tornar Rei daquela região. Você cria e evolui sua cidade, conquista territórios, coloca seus companions para serem seus conselheiros e ministros e delega missões a eles, é basicamente um simulador de cidade medieval. É um sistema legal, em diversos momentos viciei legal em ficar gerenciando as cidades. Porém o time-lapse disto acelera o jogo e te força a executar algumas missões e te coloca tempo pra resolver, isso também é um pouco frustrante..

Pra finalizar, a otimização do jogo também deixa a desejar, alguns mapas tem quedas de frames, e por ser um jogo que não tão recente deveria rodar bem melhor, mas não chega a atrapalhar a experiência. 

É um game extremamente complexo, mas pra quem busca uma aventura que simule a experiência de se jogar um RPG de mesa tá aí uma opção bem fiel. | I wish this game wasn't impossible to play with non-perfect builds on normal mode. Really wanted to like it but the encounters are FUCKED | If you have played the tabletop, dive in and enjoy. If not, know there is a lot to learn and its not friendly to those who don't know at least some of the game's setting, weapons, feats, or magic types. | 好玩又耐玩的游戏。

构筑种类丰富，一步一步变强的体验很好。100多职业任选，装备同样眼花缭乱看不过来。但是引导不如二代，专长没写前置与升级项。

剧情很好，‘时不时会回忆一些深刻剧情。队友剧情也很真实，能看到现实中自己或别人的影子，感慨良多。

即时制清图，回合制打精英以上战斗。我一周目纯回合制打了130h，之后周目有经验了就快了50h就能速杀。

选项很多，一周目非常容易漏道具和支线剧情，然后多周目选不一样的选项真是不一样的体验，有很多不起眼的选择会影响后期剧情发展。真是阵营九宫格的对话选择，让我有种新维加斯的感觉，现代游戏少有这么细节。 | combat drags, story lags. its great in the middle portion but once your party gets going its basically a bunch of chores until the main quest kicks in. the story is great at the beginning and middle and then gets boring. trying to drag myself through the last section of the game right now. i love the characters.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, RPG, Free To Play
Reviews:
[h3]《可以體驗身障人士戰鬥的清版Rogue遊戲》[/h3]
這是最讓我感到印象深刻的Rogue清版動作遊戲，不光是他的血腥演出驚人，他的可選擇角色設計上也讓人具有深刻的印象。
且作為一款Rogue遊戲，他在很短的期間就帶給我不同的快樂，這是大部分Rogue遊戲都做不到的。


[b]●優點[/b]

+血腥演出相當優秀
+人物設計具有特色且在遊戲界獨樹一格
+Rogue掉落道具種類多元
+強化素材獲得體驗有感，不會讓人感覺很農
+具有簡易連招機制，輕攻擊與強攻擊搭配具有不同奇效
+武器種類豐富，每一種武器都有不同的體驗
+場景物件可破壞並能獲得道具與資源
+可以多人遊玩，體驗不同的快樂


[b]●缺點[/b]

-時常一大坨的怪物塞在後面噁心你
-怪物反打機率極高
-時常掉落神秘藥瓶，神秘藥瓶有些具有副作用，新手時期體驗不是很好
-多人遊玩容易場面混亂


[b]■總結[/b]

雖然是一款可以主打多人遊玩的Rogue遊戲，但不得不說還是一個人遊玩體驗下來會更好，第三階段開始會有太多的怪物以及各種反打，導致保守派玩家就是只能打一下翻滾一下無限LOOP，體驗下來還以為在玩類魂。
在這裡給這款遊戲來個好評，而且還居然是免費的，這間開發商實在是太佛心了。 | love this friggin game. So addicting to do reruns, since you are very op!

Quand j’ai commencé à jouer à The Tiny Bang Story, je ne savais pas que ce petit jeu allait m’accompagner dans l’un des pires moments de ma vie. À l’époque, ma grand-mère, qui était comme une deuxième mère pour moi, venait de nous quitter. Sa mort a laissé un vide immense dans notre famille. J’avais l’impression que tout s’était arrêté. Je n’arrivais plus à avancer, ni dans mes études, ni dans ma vie quotidienne.

Un soir, en cherchant quelque chose pour me changer les idées, je suis tombé sur The Tiny Bang Story. J’ai été attiré par ses graphismes doux, comme tirés d’un rêve. En lançant le jeu, je me suis plongé dans ce petit monde coloré et brisé, où tout était à reconstruire. Ce n’était pas juste un puzzle, c’était une métaphore parfaite de ce que je vivais.

Chaque énigme que je résolvais, chaque pièce que je remettais en place, me donnait une sensation de calme et de réconfort. Le jeu n’avait pas de texte ou de dialogue, juste une musique apaisante et un univers silencieux, comme si c’était fait pour m’aider à retrouver un peu de paix dans ce chaos.

Je me souviens d’un soir où, après avoir passé des heures sur une énigme, j’ai fini par éclater en sanglots. Ce n’était même pas à cause du jeu, mais parce qu’il m’avait donné l’espace dont j’avais besoin pour ressentir, pour laisser sortir tout ce que j’avais gardé en moi depuis la perte de ma grand-mère.

The Tiny Bang Story n’est pas juste un jeu pour moi, c’est une expérience. Il m’a aidé à me reconstruire, tout doucement, comme je reconstruisais son petit monde. Et même si la vie n’est pas aussi simple qu’un puzzle, il m’a montré que, parfois, assembler les petites pièces, une à la fois, suffit pour commencer à avancer. | 目前个人评分（8/10）点点点，考验眼力，找不着了就点小蜜蜂，懒得点小蜜蜂就直接查攻略，拼图还挺有意思的 | Beating it in 3 hours, not too hard puzzles with help if one feel that is necessary. A relaxing layed back game. | What I look for in puzzle games is relaxation, not fanaticism over stupid puzzles and searching for a hidden piece.

[h1]Innovative multiplayer space shooter, sadly no one plays it[/h1]

I'm sorry I can't recommend this title. The game has nothing wrong with it, it actually is a hard to learn, innovative space shooter, a refreshing change from the usual mouse pointer controlled space games. Sadly, it's a multiplayer based game with no one playing it. The learning curve is not worthy for just killing bots.

Otherwise, the graphics are good, the gameplay is hard, the controls are tight.

[b]I appreciate the Linux support[/b] | I played the closed beta, so my review might be subjective. But I still bought the game.
I’m most excited about the schip buiding, you can keep upgrading. It’s really nice to look forward buying a second ship too and you can feel the difference really good. I just bought a Support ship which fits my play style (better control, but more survivability). 
I did have to get used to the controls, took me a solid 30 minutes. I changed some controls too (I’m left handed). I never really played a space game like this so moving around without having a fixed horizon made it hard to navigate. Later I got the know some arena’s and got used to the play style. Now I’m in full control B-) 
Great game! Looking forward to anything new! The ship designs are awesome! | Great game! Graphics are astonishing. Espeicaly for a two man team. It keeps surprising me that the game like this is made only with two friends. If you can create this, i wonder that you could make with more support...

The controls are kind of hard at the beginning. But once I got used to them I became quite good. Class based multiplayer is a nice touch, the class abilities supply the game with a cool dynamic.  

If you like spacegames, action and flight. This is your game!

Sure, there are not many players. But I think this is a great game to support. One day, this game will be played by a lot of people. You have my support. | Buen juego.
