Любопытная игра в которой разработчики попытались довести до ума тактический режим из This Is Police 2.
Проблема в том что главное достоинство игры не лишено недостатков, а из-за ограниченности ресурсов и сохранений это ощущается особенно критично. Иногда очень сложно понять в какой ситуации противник может заметить вашего подчиненного а в какой нет, бывали случаи когда заметив моего копа преступник с невероятной целеустремленности бежал узнавать что же там это за силуэт и более того даже поднимал тревогу за этот же ход, а иногда они не видят копов в упор. В общем, казусов тут хватает, что иногда заставляет загружаться с последнего сохранения по несколько раз и огромные карты на некоторых миссиях  ситуацию легче не делают. Самих миссий немного, да и сама игра небольшая, но тем не менее способна иногда удивлять разного рода сюрпризами. Сюжет звезд с неба не хватает, но хорошо играет на саму атмосферу борьбы матерых подпольных копов против могущественной мафии где-то в американской глубинке и тоже может временами удивить. Отдельно хочется отметить очень неплохой саундтрек.

В общем достаточно любопытный продукт на пару вечеров. Мне он даже смог моментами потрепать нервишки. Если любите подобные стратегии или хотите почувствовать себя подпольным борцом с преступностью то смело берите. А в остальных случаях боюсь эта игра станет тем пополнением в вашей библиотеке к которому вы никогда не притронетесь | I shelved this game long ago and recently decided to jump back in and give it a go. I got to work off some of the backlog. If you like the style of this game but want more management of the officers and to have more to do in the campaign, then I have two games that I would like to recommend that are better than this. This is the Police 1 and 2. It's the same developer, but way better games. The campaign is super short, and there are barely any side missions to do. The third mission is WAYYY out of place in the progression of your characters through the game. It comes out of nowhere. That's not to say it's impossible, but with having limited saves, GOOD LUCK getting through it without being seen and setting off the alarms. That is to say, if you like this art style and you like the gameplay, play the other games in this series; better writing, better gameplay, MORE TO DO, and the game progression makes sense. | 没什么诚意，整个游戏就一直是这个十个人，然后一点剧情没有，每个人之间也完全一样，无论男女老少都是一模一样的，关卡设计也非常随意。2代喂食的剧情在这里得到了延续，最后无比草率的结局更是让人无语，[spoiler] 杰克就这么突然出现把主角团都突突了，啊？ [/spoiler]。 | Внимание!
Мы играем не за бывших копов, а за челиков, которые первый раз в жизни взяли оружие в руки, постреляли в тире и пошли на преступников охотиться.
0 метких копов из 0 метких копов | Normal 难度首通的，整体挺好玩的。8.5 / 10。
（8.5 是因为只有战斗，没有别的玩法，有点枯燥。各有千秋吧。《这就是警察 2 (This is the police 2)》 的那种办任务刷地图的，虽然算是“别的玩法”，但也不是非常有意思。不过总比纯战斗好）

Цікава та легенька головоломка з елементами жахів, але так, лайтових. Максимум гра займає дві години вашого часу, тому брати її за повну ціну не бачу сенсу. Основний мотив гри: "Завжди залишайтеся людиною по відношенню до інших, не зважаючи на ваш статус, професію, можливості". | DISTRAINT: Deluxe Edition — это не просто обновлённая версия, это настоящее возрождение мрачной и атмосферной истории. Графика, хоть и пиксельная, но обладает невероятным шармом и отлично передаёт гнетущую атмосферу игры. Улучшения в визуале и звуке действительно ощутимы, делая погружение в мир DISTRAINT ещё более глубоким.

Главное же достоинство игры — её история. Это не просто инди-хоррор, а целая философская притча о моральном выборе и цене успеха. DISTRAINT заставляет задуматься о своих поступках и их последствиях, вызывая неоднозначные эмоции и оставляя глубокий след после прохождения. Несмотря на короткий игровой процесс, игра насыщена событиями и персонажами, каждый из которых играет свою роль в развитии сюжета.

DISTRAINT: Deluxe Edition — это must-have для любителей инди-игр с глубоким сюжетом, мрачной атмосферой и сложными моральными дилеммами. Она стоит каждой потраченной копейки и оставит в вашей памяти неизгладимое впечатление. Рекомендую всем, кто ищет что-то необычное и запоминающееся. 10/10! | This game delivers a chilling psychological horror experience with a touching narrative. It's short but leaves a lasting impression. Perfect for fans of story/puzzle indie horror games! | A arte desse jogo é o primeiro ponto a chamar atenção, tenta conectar com o terror que é a proposta da estória, bem simples, mas muito boa. Esse jogo é um daqueles jogos entraria na categoria da Steam "Feitos com amor". | 为了全成就去打了第二遍，才发现一开始的尸体就是主角自己，很有恐怖游戏的氛围。

This is just one of many benchmarks you can use to see the power and stability of your computers hardware. 
There is nothing extremely special about this benchmark. Do not use only this benchmark to test your computers hardware. I would suggest using multiple that test/stress your computer in different ways. This benchmark can run a few times on unstable overclock before crashing, giving you false security. So again, use multiple benchmark programs.

The visual aspect of the benchmarks are always a nice delight to see.
Leader boards and achievements are a fun bonus to showing what your computer can do. 

TLDR; get this if you enjoy/want/need this for testing computer hardware, but wait for a sale. | Thorough set of benchmarks for CPU, GPU, storage, mobile, and specific graphics features. | It's nice to have an app that allows you to compare your rig to others. And able to test my rog ally with the cooling case mod, pretty cool. I wish there was a way to compare your test results in app. Or maybe I just don't understand the website... Hello everyone! I am an old player who has been playing this game for a long time. I rarely go to the Sky Ladder PK and usually use drones for retirement. The game is indeed a good game, but I have witnessed the inexplicable account suspension!!! I would like to say to customer service or developers:
Firstly, I have been playing this game for so long and have never used any cheating tools to enter the battle platform, not even the human-machine interface!
Secondly, I did use third-party tools when playing this game, but they were also used to clear the storyline mode. But this game has never mentioned that using third-party tools to complete the storyline mode will also result in account suspension, right??? And it's also something I used a long time ago.
Today, I want to talk to the developers of the Minesweeper Society through STEAM's recommendation system! This is the second account I have worked hard to raise, but it has been banned again! I hope to be granted online access to unban, and I will continue to appeal on the community platform and the official message board of the Minesweeper Society!! Until the lockdown is lifted! | One of the greatest RTS games ever made and significantly better than 3 which is an absolute pos game. My recommendation if you want the dlc for this game is to go online and find a cheap steam key for the "all out war edition" usually around 8$. Gives you every single dlc in the game including all playable factions, so don't waste your money on individual dlc which will cost you a fortune. | I don't even know where to start. The gameplay can be satisfying at times but almost every other aspect of the game is downright frustrating and/or pathetic. Had I known that the campaign was strictly Russia vs Germany, I wouldn't have bought it. Had I known how greedy the game is with all the microtransactions and extra dlc you have to buy for a complete game, I wouldn't have bothered. 

You cannot play as either British or American forces unless you pay extra. Furthermore, you cannot play as any army except for Russia in any of the one-off skirmish maps, unless you pay extra. Also, there are campaign missions that it shows you in-game where you play as the allies, but to play them you have to pay extra. Showing you the other half of what the game should have been with price tags and store page links inside the damn game is so insulting. 

I got it relatively cheap on the winter sale, otherwise I would've refunded it. Odds are, you won't have a good time with this game. I hear Coh3 is even worse, so there you go. Another dead franchise swallowed up by corporate greed. | This game is timeless. not sure what is it that brings me back to it. it is not perfect especially the campaign, but the multiplayer comes so close to perfection. | Game no longer loads, tried every solution possible, nothing. Game Name: I am not a Monster: First Contact
Reviews:
This game is defunct. The server no longer runs :(

DONT BUY THIS GAME! It doesn't work!
Bored

This is probably the best VR game out right now. This game takes all the things I liked about DayZ and pushes it into one of the most immersive VR experiences I've ever had. 

Gunplay is gritty, but very fun. The combat and level design rewards skill, knowledge, and proper preparation really well. The atmosphere and sound design are a little bit intense, but can be toned down with mods easily, and this game kept me on my toes constantly.

Main complaints are the more obnoxious points of sound design (weak VA for the setting, some over-the-top SFX, repetitive enemy voice lines), some lack of QoL for base organization, and a bit of bugs getting me stuck here and there. Additionally, I wish there were more dynamic challenges, such as greater variety of enemies and how their AI interact with each other, or random/semi-random events and challenges would be neat.

I played most of my game with the scavenger mod with the shop disabled, and I really enjoyed the resource management experience, it made it a lot more immersive when I can't just buy infinite ammo.
A couple other mods I would recommend
- Distortion sound rework
- Quieter gas mask
- additional base storage (once you get to later missions/levels)

Overall a great experience though, very excited for ITR2's full release.
 | Privet Stalker! This game is goated with the sauce. 

Excellent gunplay, excellent story, and immaculate vibes. Going out at night in this game might be one of the most intense experiences I've had in VR. If you have played STALKER (if you haven't , please go play it) then you are going to feel right at home here. Artifact hunting, camp raiding, stash management, and limited resources. It is the whole package, and it does it very well. | An interesting concept, but the general jank with the controls is just too much for it to be really enjoyable.

Quick list of annoyances because I can't be arsed to make a full review :

- Virtual body rotates, following headset orientation. This means the stuff you want to grab (gun, items in your pouch, map...) will routinely be in random locations, forcing you to visually check where, for instance, your goddamn *hip* is so you can grab your gun. Unreliability for basic controls like this is a massive no-no for any type of game

- Game gaslights you with stealth : meaning it does not actually exist. Armed enemies will spot you from half-way across the map, in total darkness, while you're crouching, unless you're literally behind solid cover (no, bushes and stuff don't count). Meaning as long as there's an unobstructed line of sight, they'll see you, they'll shoot you, and they won't miss unless you keep running

- Items you put in your backpack and pouch will routinely just... move around. Like they sprouted a pair of little legs while you weren't looking to go say hi to their pal on the other side of your backpack. Grabbing stuff from your backpack is already a pain as it is when it starts filling up, but this makes it straight up unbearable

- Saves sometimes just... break. Like I'll die, load the latest autosave, and it'll turn out that it somehow saved AFTER I died, kept my full loadout, and teleported me to a completely random spot on the map. So I'll have to load whatever save was before that one.

- Blink movement doesn't know what to do with slopes most of the time. Meaning you can walk up them just fine with normal movement, but you'll just remain stuck in place if you try to blink up them. Normal movement makes me nauseous so I *have* to rely on blink movement. | I love this game, the buzz of extraction shooters without just as much risk, keeping all the benefits of fear and amazing gameplay, this game is just something many years later | Even with my specs this game is horribly optimised, that also includes jumping through 7-8 optimisation hoops.

Ignore this game completely & just enjoy fully modded S.T.A.L.K.E.R instead. Has to be a definite memory leak in this game.

This is the best game that I can't recommend. The shooting, the art, the sound—everything about it is the industry's best, held back by draconian progression systems and temporary-by-design story content. I imagine this game is comparable to something like heroin: it feels [i]so good[/i]... until it doesn't. And then you're stuck chasing the dragon. No other developer exhibits such frustrating inconsistency of quality and consideration for its players. The future of this live service game is uncertain, and that's a real shame because I'm pretty sure nothing will ever be as good as this game can be, could have been, should have been. | I... Just can't anymore.
When Bungie actually puts in effort into their game (Aka, major DLC's minus lightfall) the game is amazing, but the amount of times they have dropped the ball, especially with this last episode/season has finally done it for me. I've followed Destiny since the original on the xbox 360, became a fan of the story, and continued on into Destiny 2 back when they were still part of activision on battlenet. I've always attempted to keep good faith and put in a good word even when the game was at a low point, but now after having the saint-14 and osiris gay love story interjected and shoved down my throat multiple times, the last season "echos" big bad guy get one shot in a cutscene and escape by floating down a vex "milk" river, and now the current episode which started by reusing a game mode that they butchered and made worse than the original which was still in the game and the other gamemode that came later which was decent but had loot that you could get just by running around in the standard maps made it not at all worth doing. Compound that with the tonic system that relied on Strict RNG to get new tonics which were necessary to get further in the reputation system and played a minimal part in the over arching story and took forever just to get three tonics out of DOZENS WHICH BARELY WORKED AND WAS ON A TIMER THAT YOU HAD TO MICRO MANAGE ON TOP OF OTHER MICRO MANAGING SYSTEMS.... yeah it was just TOO MUCH.  The final nail in the coffin was the fact that we found out just how much work they put into the seasonal / episodic content which normally is spread out when they gave it all at one time. By the way you could do all 3 parts of revenant in less than 3 hours which for something that you pay for is absolutely Pathetic. For comparison Warframe Is completely 100% FREE and has proven to have a better player experience, impactful story, developers that actually care, better visuals, smaller file size, did not take paid content away forever (yes that happened in destiny), and more. 

I loved this game because it's story at one point was amazing and now... it's a chore.  Combine all that with the current state of the company's choices and behaviors, it's just not worth trying to keep the rose tinted glasses on and support it anymore.  I loved this game.... and I just feel betrayed and disappointed.  Call me a Schill, say I'm coping, or a hater I no longer care. Like many said Destiny was the only thing that could Kill Destiny, and well they did it.  I'm done supporting Bungie until they get their collective heads out of their ass.

Edit as to Toasty's comments, I don't care if Osiris and Saint are gay, I care that the fact that they are gay is more of a Slap to the face and is way too frequent as a main story beat, it's not subtle like other characters and kept in the background as an aspect of the character which would have made the first Episode much more impactful story wise. As Toasty mentioned Warframe has these notions and explores it but it's subtle and not in  your face and distracting from the overall story which is why I exemplify it's story over This one. Take that as you will but I stand with my choice and opinion, don't be assholes just because you disagree and have a different opinion. | 10 year veteran of the franchise. this new season brings to me the unfortunate realization its over. the game had the most amazing expansion in its history, just to turn around and fire loads of staff. bungie vets who made this series what it is (was practically) are gone, and you can feel it. new season with no exotic armor at all, mediocre activity that is just the same recycled event, with recycled modifiers from older content that is extremely tiring, just cus it worked once doesnt mean they need to do it 3 or so times. the sandbox is in a pretty great state, but the creativity of the team is dying out, and the lack of employees and budget is extremely obvious. Pete Parsons is directly responsible for cutting hundreds of devs and bringing this ship crashing into the ground. Destiny is genuinely unenjoyable and within the hour i was bored. this is genuinely depressing as i have thousands of hours, and thousands on psn and have loved the game through some of its lowest points. but the mediocrity of this season is killing me. i genuinely am worried this game will actually die for real within this act. | I think this is the best game ever made and it's not very close. I started playing around the time it went free to play and I'd do it again in a heartbeat. No other game does what this one does. I think everyone should get to experience what Destiny offers. This rating is positive because of what this game has meant to me, not because of what it has become.

[i]Currently:[/i]
[list]
	[*]This game is so unfairly priced that I can't genuinely recommend any of my non-Destiny friends or new players to pick it up to try it out.
	[*]The community is toxic as hell.
	[*]The game is dying, fewer and fewer people get on to play every single day.
	[*]There are cheaters in 1/3 of Crucible games (might just be caused by the dwindling player count making the concentration of cheaters higher).
	[*]Every new update is bugged (sometimes to the point of unplayability) and results in either server downtime, another update to address it (takes a month for this to get released), or Bungie just giving up and auto-completing quest steps.
	[*]The new player onboarding experience is abysmal. You're given a 5 minute cutscene to explain the story (since they completely removed the real campaign), a couple of introductory quests, and then you're kicked out of the bird's nest to do whatever your heart desires with minimal direction or suggestion on where to go. So bad, in fact, that Bungie has given up and now provides players with an option to skip it entirely since they know that if a new player is playing this game, it MUST be at the direction of another existing player telling them what to do anyway.
	[*]The game is riddled with power creep. Guardian kits are the strongest they have ever been and new aspirational content has gotten easier and easier.
[/list]

Realistically, the game needs a reset like Destiny 1 got with the release of Destiny 2, but Bungie's insistence on this being a forever game post-Final Shape has led to Destiny 3 being nothing but a pipe dream while this game wanes in its final days after the equivalent of an Avenger: Endgame story beat. Bungie just doesn't know when to let it go.

Some of my best memories are playing this game, but I just can't in good conscience say that you should start playing this game if you haven't already. You just had to be there, I guess. | 傻逼棒鸡越来越会圈钱了，年四刚出直接弃坑果然是我最聪明的一次，可惜那些没玩过年四之前的朋友们了，没去过１２１５，没见过满网都是土命２的视频，到处都是开坑教学，各种教学，生怕你不会玩，现在一问你玩什么，命运２，没听过小游戏吧，一手好牌打得稀烂，年四更新一百多G删到九十G，以前死命肝的枪年四买季票直接领东西换，删称号，删地图，删成就，现在补回来了又怎么样呢，有不少人都记得有个傻逼鸡一手好牌打稀烂，可惜年四刚玩年五刚玩的新玩家都不知道这事情，那我亲爱的朋友，现在你知道了吗，知道为什么感觉现在这么好个游戏不温不火了吗。

本作流程非常短，第一遍只需一个半小时就能打通，即使要全成就也不过三个多小时。为了看更多分支，需要多次重复游玩。为此游戏提供了重复片段跳过选项，虽稍有变动就得重看一遍，但后期可以在5分钟以内通一遍。很多FMV游戏不提供跳过功能，在此对本作提出表扬，否则定会大大影响玩家的体验。本作肉眼可见的贫穷，所有的枪击场面全都是劣质特效，没有真正的枪火，无人机和真空区也能很容易看出是特效。故事里的演员相对较少，场景并不复杂，多数情况都是在密闭空间中。 在这么有限的情况下，游戏的故事还算过得去，主要讲的还是[spoiler]大公司为了利益不顾人死活，仇人复仇间接导致生化危机事件。[/spoiler]作为互动游戏，游戏的最后两个选项会直接影响结局。不过，每个人物有好感度系统，会对后续产生影响，最终分出九种结局。

[h2]关于故事【有剧透】[/h2]
对故事要求高的观众必定嫌弃本作，堂堂一个大公司让人渗透成筛子，面对间谍入侵竟然束手无策，都不能派人去清除敌人，可知对方只有2把枪啊！纳米细胞应该是救命的啊，也应该有中控系统啊，结果完全变成了失控的病毒。为了剧情，强行给男主超级黑客般的骇客能力，队友中二五仔的计划烂到没边。作为标题的The Complex/建筑群基本没发挥啥作用，看起来总共就十几个人的样子，还是太贫穷了。不过，玩这种游戏就应该放低预期，横向对比起来整个故事还是有可取之处的。比如男女分开期间五年发生什么大致可以拼凑出来、女主还有个神秘身份、感染者自身的计划，以及几个潜伏者与背后操控者等等。本作标签中有色情内容，实际没有，尺度最大的地方就是女主换衣服时露个胸罩。不过，游戏内有Jumpscare，一段温馨场景伴随一段数秒的血脸镜头，各位玩家要注意流程中的《野餐》那段。

[h2]游戏之外[/h2]
在演员方面，我最为熟悉的是凯特·迪基（Kate Dickie），她在《权力的游戏》中饰演了鹰巢城的莱莎·艾林。男主角阿尔·韦弗（Al Weaver）曾出现在其他FMV游戏中，而女主角米歇尔·麦莱特（Michelle Mylett）则相当迷人。90年出生于加拿大的她主要活跃于电视剧圈，最为出名的《莱特肯尼》电视剧在国内没有多少观众，希望以后能火。发行商是英国专做FMV游戏的Wales Interactive，三个制作商中最主要应该是Good Gate Media。他家的作品还不算少，我玩过《五个约会》觉得还不错，但是糟糕的《谁把马库斯叔叔静音了》败光了我对他们家的好感，就用这款《复体》作为告别之作吧。 | it was fine. the plot was fine, the acting was fine, the CGI was fine. but it is in dire need of QoL features like chapter select, fast-forward/skip, and a (working) option to disable timers for decisions | Wales Interactive knocks it out of the park again. Paul Raschid directed this game phenomenally and it features Michelle Mylett who is known for her role in Letterkenney and Al Weaver; Who has quickly become one of my favorite actors and was also featured in Who Pressed Mute on Uncle Marcus.

If you enjoy mystery suspense movies and choose your own adventure games, then you won't be disappointed by this game. The characters are likeable, the writing is intelligent and there is some comedy sprinkled in that will give you a chuckle which adds some zest to the narrative.

This FMV is almost Black Mirror-esq but that is a good thing in my opinion. I highly recommend if you enjoy FMV's or have any other Wales Interactive games because it's worth adding to your collection. | So Michelle Mylet is the main role. Is there anything else I have to say ? 

If so, greate story, ok cgi, okish plot, good characters. 
Overalls 75 out of 100 if you like fmvs . It is missing features l, but the moust features are there.

I think personally a chapter selection would be great . Also a rewind function would've be great . | I don't know what was happening for most of this game. ON GOD VAPORIZE REESE IT IS WORTH YOUR TIME. BEST PART OF THE GAME BY FAR ALMOST MADE IT WORTH IT.

Genres: Action, Free To Play, Indie, Massively Multiplayer
Reviews: Love this crazy, fun, not so serious BR!!! If you are looking to laugh and relax while fraggin out pick this game up NOW!!! <3 <3 | This is a fun, light hearted top down battle royale game. If you enjoyed The Darwin Project you'll enjoy the 'Watcher' components of this, as it allows you to alter or modify the game and earn XP after your death for doing so.

Una historia muy guapa, muy inmersiva.

Con PSVR2 mejor aun, menudos negros, menudo contraste | Terrible controls, sometimes high latency (decent vr config here so not related :)), have to reload the game to unlock mechanisms that bugs | Overall, a good experience. And one I think others should take the time to enjoy if you like Westworld, and don't mind some stealth/ thriller gameplay. 

I very quickly realised that the default "swing arms to walk" was not for me, and found that it can easily be changed to joystick movement in the settings. Gameplay was flawless for me following that change. 

Graphics in the game assume you have HTC vive controllers, whereas I was playing with index controllers. It a minor thing and didnt directly affect gameplay. However, the HTC vive controller have a grip button that is just that, a button. Attempting to grab objects was kind of clunky with the "sensor-like" grips of the index knuckles. I had to squeeze quite firmly. I was quick to get used to it though. 

I enjoyed the story, while on the shorter side (like most VR games), it didn't feel rushed. Overall pacing was good once I got  a hand of the controls.  
The sound design was spot on, and very immersive. It brought the technology of the world to life. I feel like a lot of scifi will fill the background with generic blips and beeps, but the presence of sound in this game came with intention as you interacted with the world, and never felt out of place.

One might feel as though the graphics and character models might feel a bit dated, I feel like that might be largely a restriction of VR, not necessarily the game. The facial animation, and eyes definitely stand out though.

The "tablet" functionality was very interesting and offered a unique way to interact with the world, It reminded me of early 3D Metroid games, in scanning environments to solve puzzles and the likes. Had the game been longer, I think It would have been interesting to see further implementations and ways to utilise it. 

I was excited to see that there was a Westworld game, and while this tells an interesting story in that world, I hope that maybe we can see other games, VR or not, set in the world of Westworld. Where one can experience the park as an actual guest, or host. 

I understand that VR is computationally taxing, but I hope the technology can improve enough maybe we can see even more lifelike games. As properties like this that already have breathtaking environments can only benefit from it. 

I think your average gamer that chases the newest thing might find that this game feels a bit dated graphically in 2024, however, considering that this is a VR game from about 5 years ago, I consider it a pleasing piece of work considering the limitations of the time. 



 | The story is unique. There are some dull moments here and there, but overall I found it very enjoyable | The story is decent and draws you in but all in all is far too short.    It's more a short romance thriller story than an epic drama like the original series it's based on.    The game itself is essential a puzzle maze game with virtual not offensive violence save for the occasional shove.    I got this on sale for 90% off and I'd recommend one wait for such a sale before buying.   Yes it's worth getting but no it's not worth $34     It has little if any replay value once one plays through the story once or twice as the mechanics are quite linear.    I really wish I could give this a higher rating as it had a lot of potential and for the duration of play it really sucked me in but after it was done there was little point starting over.    May replay at some point just like reading a book.

Anfangs fand ich Not for Broadcast spannend, aber schnell wurde es nur noch frustrierend. 
Die Story-Sequenzen bestehen aus unglaublich viel Text, der Aufbau dessen hat mich so gelangweilt, dass ich keine Lust hatte, den Text überhaupt richtig zu lesen.
Das Gameplay im Studio war anfangs spaßig, wurde aber durch ständige Sabotage (div. unrealistische Szenarios) einfach nur lästig.
Man konnte der Story kaum folgen, weil man zu sehr mit Kameras, Frequenzen und Zensur beschäftigt ist. 
Mit dem Humor konnte ich persönlich auch nichts anfangen (aber das ist ja Geschmackssache).
Vielleicht ist der Story-Modus entspannter, aber dann fehlt für mich persönlich die Herausforderung.
Für mich hat es einfach nicht funktioniert... | 在玩法设计和内容制作上都很有趣，无论是电视节目还是其中一些音乐的成分都能看出有意去模仿真正的电视频道，导播的工作模拟的很好，以至于现在看一些节目会开始关注镜头的切换。不足之处则是有时操作太过手忙脚乱以至于无法专注电视节目和游戏剧情，有些无关紧要的剧情反而又没什么需要操作的东西，以及主角的家人线纯粹是选择题，没有什么提示，也无法给人留下太过深入的印象，主角各种操作对自己的职业未曾造成影响，也给人一种为故事发展而刻意安排的观感。但总体来说和国家晚间新闻度过的几个小时已经能够将主要角色的形象，以及两个政党的荒诞塑造的都还不错，结局时再一次听到熟悉的报幕，居然也感到了一些感动……虽然大概率不会多周目，对我来说这种构思有趣设定新颖的游戏，无论如何很有体验的价值。 | I was inspired to play this after watching Jacksepticeye play the first couple of levels. It was both hilarious and intriguing, and I really loved the gameplay. I would restart chapters over and over just to get perfect scores. Honestly, I can't really think of any negatives. It's very unique and interesting.

[h1] あまりにもヌルすぎて自分から首を締めた残念作[/h1]

まあ最初からはっきり言うと
[h3] 良質なアクション目当でこんなの買うくらいならデッドセルズってゲーム買ったほうが何倍も面白いぞ、だってこのゲーム全てがデッドセルズの劣化だもん [/h3]
です。

・このゲームの数少ない良い所
女の子が可愛い
女の子がロボットに乗って戦うシチュが好きならこのゲームピッタリではある

・悪い点
[b] 実質無敵、射撃における弾薬無限化などアシストモード実装したせいで物凄くぬるいゲーム
アシストモード自体は実はデッドセルズにも存在していますが、あっちにも実装されてるからこそ全てが劣化品なのが際立つ [/b]
そしてそもそも、アシストモード有り無しに関わらず敵を全滅させないと次に進めない以上道中の戦闘が段々ダルくなる。
男の仲間が割と序盤で出てくるがこいつがクソムカつく。何にも活躍しない上に主人公を見下してくる。いらねぇ！

[b]なんとエンディングが実質バッドエンド固定 [/b]（以下ネタバレ）
[spoiler] 物凄くざっくり言うと、主人公の犠牲によって世界は救われた....がそもそも主人公の死が避けられない上に
ゲーム中一切活躍らしい活躍しない男性NPCがなんか家庭を作って子どもも作ってなんかこいつらだけ幸せになるという超意味不明エンド。[/spoiler]

ぶっちゃけ、[b] このゲーム可愛い女の子がウリのようなものなんだからエロ要素追加して差別化を図れ
あとついでにエンディングも追加しろ！！[/b]と思うのですがもうこのゲームにはアップデートらしいアップデートが来てないので
完成度はずっと劣化デッドセルズのままで終わることでしょう。故にオススメしないとさせていただきます。
[spoiler] 後このレビュー書いてる途中で気がついたけど主人公の設定あのICEYの主人公設定パクってない？まあ何もかも劣化品だから良いか...[/spoiler] | Positive:

I enjoyed the game a lot and mastering all the equipment was fun for the most part. Though the game is very short with only 3 proper zones but I spent a lot of time in each zone so I still got a lot of mileage out of the game.

My only real issue is that the story is an absolute mess. It's like if you take a book and cut out chunks and then stitched those chunks together. It treats things as if they were already established, things are introduced but then seemingly dropped, plot points happen that don't go anywhere, and one of the most confusing ending I have seen. It's about humanity barely surviving a war with these subterranian beasts but there are also aliens involved I guess, and these aliens helped the humans? And the beasts are not actually at war with humans but the aliens because the aliens are actually the bad guys? But then things just continue as if that revelation never dropped, and I don't even think the aliens are mentioned ever again... I think? I don't know, I got lost, and the ending is like a fever dream. | 像素肉鸽横板战斗，有一定内容但是不多，挑战模式合成挺有意思的。就是不好玩，
缺乏瑟晴要素

Feels like an early access game because there are so many parts that needs to be improved. 

Bad parts:
- The UI is horrible
- The game auto-saves so it's pretty much mandatory ironman mode
- You cannot change difficulty during a game and have to restart
- Many things are never explained nor displayed so you don't know what you are choosing
- Limited Air does not make the game more fun, it only makes you rush the main objective right away
- You didn't rush the main objective? Now you are out of air and everyone dies. IRONMAN MODE. Have fun restarting from the beginning
- Power tree is hidden, so is unit leveling so you have no idea what to plan for. 
- Controls feels janky, easy to press the wrong key
- Chaos system. Not sure what happens if it's maxed out, Game Over? Limits exploring
- Rolling the dice for skill checks felt very random

Meh parts:
- Story
- Gameplay
- Upgrading the submarine
- Not that many enemies
- Crafting

Good parts:

Where do I begin?
I have tried this game first time in an arcade. It was fun! But that’s pretty much it. When it came out on steam I thought why not? Price was half of what I paid for 90 minutes in the arcade and expected pretty much of the same chill shooter with random people. After 50 hours into this game, and 1 Official Tournament I cannot believe how wrong I was. 
First let me tell you that this game is not just about jumping between towers and shooting other players. NO! This is one of the most intense and exciting e-sports game I have ever played! And definitely #1 for VR. This game requires tactic and teamwork that can put games like Onward to shame, combined with a faced paced game style that won’t let you take a breath till the end of the round.
Second, and in my opinion the most important part is the way this game spans outside of the boundaries of VR.
Apart from the great community that is building up in the official discord from all around the world (Game is even popular in Japan!), the attentive Devs who can set an example to other studios out there and are keeping constant communication with the player base. I was able to make 3 new friends who live locally and we chat on a daily basis and play together a lot! Mind you that I am not a kid and making friends at my age especially in VR is hard! Finding 1 friend, let alone 3 in my age group is next to impossible. This game did in a month what no MP VR game did since I got my 1st headset couple years back! 
All in all, if the game would be twice the price, I would still say it is worth every penny for the experience it delivers. Score 12/10!!! GET IT NOW!! AND DON’T FORGET TO JOIN THE DISCORD! | Tower Tag ist ein Mehrspieler-Arcadeshooter (getestet mit der Valve Index)

Nach einem sehr kurzem Tutorial in dem uns die Steuerung erklärt wird geht es auch gleich los. Wir haben die Möglichkeit ein Spiel gegen Bots zu starten um zu üben oder uns direkt in den Mehrspieler zu stürzen. Dabei sei gleich angemerkt, dass das Spiel auf Multiplayer ausgerichtet ist, die Übungsrunden sind weder fordernd noch machen sie spaß. Nach einer Übungsrunde gegen Bots war ich erstmal enttäuscht und war schon kurz davor das Spiel in der Bibliothek vergammeln zu lassen, aber das wäre ein großer Fehler gewesen.

Denn dann haben wir uns zu ein paar Runden verabredet und uns im Mehrspieler in die Schlacht gestürzt. Man kann sowohl einfach anderen Matches beitreten als auch selbst eine Lobby eröffnen. Hier haben wir auch die Möglichkeit einen Pin vorzugeben um "geschlossene" Runden zu zocken.
Hat sich eine Gruppe gefunden haben wir die Wahl zwischen zur Zeit 3 Spielmodi in denen wir von 1 vs 1 bis zu 4 vs 4 Spieler gegeneinander antreten.
Hier zeigt das Spiel jetzt seine Stärke, denn im Mehrspieler kommt plötzlich jede Menge Hektik auf und es ist sogar sinnvoll strategisch vorzugehen.

Wir stehen auf einer 2x2 Meter Plattform, in der Mitte ein Pylon hinter dem wir in Deckung gehen können. Am anderen Ende der Karte startet das gegnerische Team, dazwischen befinden sich noch massig anderer Plattformen. Diese müssen allerdings erst erobert werden. Dazu richten wir eine Art "Lassostrahl" auf die Plattform und drücken die "A-Taste" des Controllers. Nach einigen Augenblicken haben wir die Plattform übernommen und können uns nun mit eben diesem Lasso auch auf die Plattform "ziehen". Bereits eingenommene Pylone können auch zurück erobert werden, das dauert aber ein wenig länger.
Auf diese Weise braucht es schon ein wenig taktisches Vorgehen um sich z.B. in den Rücken der Gegner zu schleichen oder auch von mehreren Seiten gleichzeitig anzugreifen. 
Die Art der Fortbewegung funktioniert erstaunlich gut und dürfte auch Einsteigern keine Probleme bereiten. Hier hat man sich wirklich Gedanken gemacht wie man Motion Sickness umgehen kann. 

Als Waffe steht uns lediglich eine Laserpistole zur Verfügung die sich automatisch mit der Zeit aufläd. Gleichzeitig können wir die Pistole auch nutzen um Teamkameraden zu heilen und auch unser "Lasso" auf Pylonen zu schießen. Die Multifunktionsweise ist auch nötig, denn wir spielen die ganze Zeit mit nur einem Controller. Das mag jetzt erst einmal ungewohnt klingen funktioniert aber sehr gut. Mit der "A-Taste" erobern wir Pylonen und heilen Mitspieler, mit dem Trigger wird wie gewohnt gefeuert.
Als Besonderheit sei noch erwähnt, dass das Spiel haptische Westen unterstützt, das konnte ich aber aufgrund mangelnder Hardware nicht testen.

Die Grafik macht einen ganz guten Eindruck, die einzelnen Maps sind recht dunkel und einfach gehalten erfüllen aber ihren Zweck. Insgesamt wirkt das Setting sehr stimmig, hier gibt es nichts auszusetzen. Das Spiel lief auch durchgehend flüssig und ohne Abbrüche. Auch der Sound ist passend, Alles in Allem eine runde Erfahrung.
Lediglich beim erstellen der Spielegruppe hatten wir ein Problem. Ein Steamfremder Mitspieler (Viveport) konnte unsere erstellen Lobby´s nicht finden und musste  sich das Spiel erst auf Steam besorgen. Ich hoffe da wird noch Abhilfe geschaffen.

Am Ende jeder Runde erhalten wir eine Übersicht über unsere Leistung und es werden noch Titel wie "bester Spieler" und andere verliehen. Zusätzlich steigen oder fallen wir im Rang, je nach Leistung. "Ranked Matches" sollen in Zukunft noch eingeführt werden wenn ich das richtig verstehe,,,

Alles in Allem macht das Spiel schon sehr vieles richtig, es ist schnell erlernt aber schwer zu meistern. Anfänger finden sich aufgrund der einfachen Steuerung schnell zurecht, allerdings bringen Taktik und Absprache mit dem Team viele Vorteile und eingespielte Gruppen werden sich hier schweißtreibende Gefechte liefern.

Insgesamt eine runde Spielerfahrung, von mir gibt es einen Daumen rauf, besonders wenn noch weitere Maps und Spielmodi hinzukommen.
Wenn das Review geholfen hat könnt ihr auch gerne einen Daumen rauf hinterlassen und natürlich freue ich mich über jeden weiteren Follower auf meiner Steam-Kuratoren-Seite: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/5837414/

Their bots adapt to your skill to give you consistently balanced games - I do wish I knew how to fill out a 4v4 with bots so I could experience that chaos ^^. Looking forward to seeing where this game goes! | Tower Tag von den VR-Nerds aus Hamburg, bekannt aus einschlägigen VR-Arcadehallen, hat nun endlich auch den Weg ins heimische Wohnzimmer geschafft.

Die beste Art und Weise Tower Tag zu beschreiben, ist es mit Laser-Tag in VR zu vergleichen. Plus ein bisschen Spiderman. 
 Das Spiel funktioniert so, dass man zwei Teams hat und das Ziel ist, den Highscore im Team-Deathmatch zu erreichen oder in  „Enter the Flag“ sozusagen zu erobern, hier muss man einen bestimmten Turm vom anderen Team einehmen. Es klingt einfach, und das ist es auch, aber genau da kommt die Strategie ins Spiel. Um auf dem Spielfeld vorwärts zu kommen, muß man die Türme erobern, die sich überall auf dem Spiefeld befinden.  Dazu zielt man auf einen dieser Türme, bis dieser erobert ist, oder falls der Turm schon zum Team gehört, zielt man auf die Turmspitze und zieht sich über eine Seilschnur aus der Pistole zu dem gewünschten Turm. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2153372639
Eine weitere Besonderheit in Tower Tag, ist  dass wir auf nur eine Waffe beschränkt sind (wir benutzen im Spiel tatsächlich auch nur einen Controller). Die  Laserpistole ist die einzige Angriffswaffe, die uns zur Verfügung steht, die aber auch gleichzeitig zum herumschwingen zwischen den Türmen benutzt wird.
Munition ist begrenzt und läd sich nach kurzer 
Zeit wieder auf, also muss man sich schon öfter mal in Deckung begben. Kopffschüsse richten tonnenweise Schaden an und lassen die Gegner in der Regel nach ein oder zwei Treffern fallen, während Schüsse auf den Körper mehr Treffer benötigen, um einen Mitspieler zu Fall zu bringen. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2153373984
In einem Team können bis zu 4 gegen 4 spielen, mittlerweile findet man auch immer öfter Mitspieler. Zudem gibt es einen Discordkanal auf dem man sich verabreden kann.

 Mehr Unterschiedliche Arenen könnten Tower Tag noch etwas aufpeppen. Es ist ein interessantes Spiel, denn obwohl man sich nicht viel im Raum an sich bewegen muss, braucht man doch ein bisschen Platz, um Tower Tag zu spielen. Eine Spielfläche von 2x2m sollte aber genügen.

In Tower Tag wächst die Mitspielerzahl täglich, sodass man nicht immer nur auf die Bots angewiesen ist, das ist sehr schön und nicht nur deswegen eine Empfehlung von mir.

[u]English:[/u]
--------------------------------------------->
Tower Tag by the VR nerds from Hamburg, known from relevant VR arcades, has finally made its way into the living room at home.

The best way to describe Tower Tag is to compare it to laser tag in VR. Plus a little bit of Spiderman. 
 The way the game works is that you have two teams and the goal is to reach the high score in team deathmatch or conquer in "Enter the Flag" so to speak, here you have to capture a certain tower from the other team. It sounds simple, and it is, but that's where the strategy comes in. In order to advance on the playing field, you have to capture the towers that are located all over the spit field.  To do this, you aim at one of these towers until it is conquered, or if the tower is already part of the team, you aim at the top of the tower and pull yourself to the desired tower using a rope string from the gun. 

Another peculiarity in Tower Tag, is that we are limited to only one weapon (we actually use only one controller in the game as well). The laser pistol is the only offensive weapon at our disposal, but it is also used to swing around between towers at the same time.
Ammunition is limited and recharges after a short 
time, so you'll have to take cover from time to time. Head shots do tons of damage and usually drop enemies after one or two hits, while shots to the body require more hits to take down a teammate. 

Up to 4 against 4 can play in a team, meanwhile you can find teammates more and more often. In addition, there is a discord channel on which you can arrange.

 More different arenas could spice up Tower Tag a bit. It's an interesting game, because although you don't have to move around much in the room itself, you do need a bit of space to play Tower Tag. However, a playing area of 2x2m should suffice.

In Tower Tag the number of players grows daily, so you don't always have to rely on the bots, which is very nice and not only because of that a recommendation from me.

[h1] [Dracula: The Resurrection]: «Кол В Классику?» [/h1]

Сразу скажу, что с оригиналом 2000 года я не знаком…

Моё погружение в тёмные уголки мрачной Трансильвании начались именно с её переделки под Android 2014 года. 

К добру ли это или к худу? Кто знает... Но честно говоря, это не столь важно, так как приключение мне всё равно понравилось, даже и без манящей глубины оригинала!

Запуская игру, я не знал, чего именно стоит ждать, поэтому первые полчаса пребывал в лёгком раздражённом недоумении…

Что это за фигня? Статичные картинки? В 2000-м году то, серьёзно? Значит, перемещаемся мы только между заранее заготовленными сценами? Но ведь даже в далёкой «Eye of the Beholder» 1991 года мы могли бодренько скакать себе по квадратом, используя привычное всем управление! А тут, стало быть, это не вариант? Тыкай мышкой по указанному направлению и взлетай? Мдаааа... И правда тёмные силы не на шутку разбушевались… 

Сюжет, надо полагать, отталкивается больше от фильма Копполы нежели от книги Стокера? Нуууу…ладно, пускай. Хотя стоящая ли это идея, тоже не очень понятно…

Более того, игра не особенно то стремилась мне хоть что=либо объяснить! Греби как говорится. Вперёд! Вот те мышка, вот те крест! х)))

Короче, собирался я уже вырубить игру и махнуть на всю франшизу ногой как вдруг умудрился найти какого-то ушлого бандита и…грохнуть его?! Серьёзно?! Вот это было неожиданно, честное Бельмонтское! Отлично! А то это уже начинало напоминать какой-то детский утренник, где-нибудь за полярным кругом, где ночь по 30 дней длится, а тут такая радость! Воооот… Это разговор… Погодите-погодите ка, дайте ещё полчасика поиграю в это наследие нулевых… =))) 

Так дело у меня и пошло! 😉

Оказалось, игра то просто отличная. Нужно было только пообвыкнуться с её непривычной дубовостью и всё! Скажу даже больше, ко второй части мне эта её неповоротливость настолько понравилась, что я не хотел даже, чтобы этот стиль менялся. Нет, это отличный медитативный поход против зла, с кучей замысловатой машинерии, так горячо любимой ребятами из Microids! (привет, Syberia и Amerzone ^-^)

Дракула тут тоже самобытный вышел и с характером. А ещё у него тут хейтеры завелись! Красота то какая! Кол в графа хочу вбить не я один? Интригующе =))) 

В общем с удовольствием я прошёл путём Носферату и стырил всё стыренное им обратно! (кто прошёл игру – знают о чём я говорю) 😉

Если есть желание душевно отдохнуть в атмосфере олдскульой мистики и вампирщины – Вы пришли по адресу! 

Игра прямо-таки создана, чтобы выдернуть Вас из бешеного ритма современной жизни и гейминга, и втянуть в свой неторопливый уютный поток тёмного повествования, увлекая на пару тройку часов. Как раз то что порой нужно! 

Когда запускал вторую часть уже ждал этого медленного slow-life геймплэя и не обманулся в своих ожиданиях!

[i] Игра расцветает на контрасте с бешеным экшеном современного игростроя…и, чем Влад не шутит, самой Жизни… =))) [/i]

Genres: Action, Casual, Massively Multiplayer, Free To Play, Early Access
Reviews: No Reviews

Геймплей оказался весьма бодрым и увлекательным — нужно буквально рисовать линии на экране, чтобы персонаж атаковал врагов. Такая механика даёт ощущение участия в каждом бою. Враги появляются волнами, и порой экран превращается в хаос линий и вспышек.

Но довольно быстро стало заметно однообразие игры. Задания и враги практически не меняются, и спустя час игры начинаешь чувствовать усталость от повторяющихся движений.

Управление
Основная механика жестов на экране местами работает отлично, но иногда происходят ошибки. Бывает, что игра неправильно воспринимает движение, что особенно раздражает в напряжённые моменты. Это может привести к потере здоровья или даже поражению.

Графика и звук
Стиль рисовки довольно симпатичный и напоминает комикс. Анимации плавные и приятные, но окружение быстро приедается из-за однотипных локаций. Музыкальное сопровождение бодрое, но тоже начинает надоедать после длительного времени игры.

Плюсы
✅ Необычная механика:
Рисование линий для атак приносит свежий глоток воздуха среди экшенов.

✅ Хороший визуальный стиль:
Красочная и мрачноватая рисовка создаёт приятную атмосферу.

✅ Динамичный геймплей:
Бои проходят быстро и требуют реакции.

Минусы
❌ Однообразие:
Задания и враги быстро начинают повторяться.

❌ Ошибки в управлении:
Игра иногда неправильно воспринимает жесты.

❌ Сюжет слабый:
История не цепляет и кажется вторичной.

❌ Мало контента:
Проект можно пройти за несколько часов, после чего делать в нём просто нечего.

Итоговая оценка: ⭐ 4 из 10

Podkręć trochę industrialu, thrash/speedu lub black/death metalu. Nadal świetnie się gra. I hej, jeśli jesteś modderem/koderem, ta gra jest teraz dostępna publicznie. Propsy dla twórców za udostępnienie kodu źródłowego. 8/10

While I appreciate the character DLCs, I don't really like the direction this game has taken for replayability. Having seasonal mechanics tacked on seems like the easy approach but doesn't add much to the overall game. They really should take the Dead Cells model with the stage scheming and add more branching zones and tilesets to make things feel fresh. Add more variety to the rooms per stage, like with the recent anxi desert change. Stick to one overarching mechanic that players can keep grinding on instead of adding seasonal ones that shift character useability and run approach every 4 months.

Subsequent updates also seem to be introducing some lag to the game. Tabbing out, even in singleplayer makes the game hang for a split second. Entering one room in multiplayer after someone else causes the game to hang at times. If the devs really do want to stick to the seasonal plan, then expand the skins to include the characters as well and make them limited to events! Soul essence is already a persistent currency that players can acquire with a grind. | I've sunk a few hundred hours into this game; once you grasp the connections between guns, abilities, and scrolls, it becomes  seriously addicting. I've played every season variation, and the way star link expands upon your character build is the most fun yet. I can easily justify $20 due to the amount of content it offers. | I didn't give this game much thought until I started playing it. The game is a well-made rogue-lite that's fun to play. The experience is even better with friends, up to three people, or you can find online matches.
I've highlighted 3 points that I think are important to mention:

Seasons
The season system is well-made. I've only played the last 2 seasons. At first, it's hard to understand the mechanics, but you get the hang of it over time. You just have to pay close attention to the readings, but they're very fun and varied. The season pass is free, easy and quick to get, and gives you beautiful and well-made cosmetics, which is a very positive point.

Replayability
I particularly enjoyed replaying the game. Putting on a playlist to listen to while playing is a pleasant experience. The game has many achievements and some of them require time and effort to complete, a huge variety of weapons to unlock, which gives a great feeling when you get a new weapon, in days when in any game you have to keep paying to get new things in the game (the game has 3 DLC with weapons, but the game also adds free weapons in each season).

Game modes
The game has few modes, only three, being the conventional mode, the main game mode where you have the stages and their difficulty to choose and challenge yourself and it is in this mode that you unlock most of the weapons and achievements in the game. The daily challenge mode, nothing special, the name already says what it is, a mode with a modifier that changes daily, just to get some achievements and challenge yourself. And the last mode, the horde mode, is a mode where you can equip some improvements to your characters and fight against large hordes of enemies that get harder and harder over time, but it has a final boss, so the hordes end. It's fun, but it only has two maps so far, and it ends up being repetitive.

My final thoughts are that the game is worth it for those who like games of this style, it's very different and diverse from the others. For the base game I think the price is worth it, but for the DLC I think it's worth waiting for a sale.

E rapaziada... de longe foi a melhor coisa que eu ja fiz!!! ^^ 

Gunfire Reborn é um game Roguelike/Roguelite, FPS, com leves elementos de RPG. Existem 12 personagens jogavéis que são bicinhos bem fofinhos (não sei se chega a ser furry), em que todos possuem 2 habilidades unicas e especiais, dando uma pegada de que cada run seja realmente diferenciada e unica. 6 são free, onde você desbloqueia apenas jogando, e os outros 6 são de dlc's. 

O jogo possui bastante coisa legal, como uma variedade boa de armas, inimigos, pergaminhos para buildar e uma arvore de talentos bacana até.
Durante a play, você vai se deparar com 3 steps até o final. É como se fosse o começo, meio e fim, bem padrão!! E em cada stage diferente, existe a possibilidade de vir 2 tipos de chefes. É sempre sortido, nunca da pra saber ao certo quem vai vir. 

Agora, como eu disse la em cima, no começo era realmente f0da de jogar sozinho. Eu até tive a cara de pau de sair chamando usuarios aqui da Steam pra jogar junto a mim, mas foi tudo em vão, infelizmente kkkkkkkk. Masssss, acabei descobrindo que da pra colocar bots [IA] pra ajudar e facilitar a gameplay!!! E isso foi extremamente util. *-* 
Eles até atacam, mas no geral são bem ignorantes KKKKKKKKKK, o que de fato eles são bons é em te levantar quando você é derrubado por algum monstro, assim evitando que sua jornada seja finalizada precocemente!!!!! 

Os graficos até que são decentes. Os mapas e cenarios são bem variados! Alguns são curtos e outros extensos. A arte do jogo é legal e a trilha sonora é meio chatinha mas da pra se acostumar.
Uma coisa que eu não curti muito foi que pra jogar no controle é meio ruimzinho. Eu sugiro muito que se você puder, jogue com um mouse & teclado. No joystick da pra brinca de boa, mas vai por mim e confia no que eu to falando!!!!!!!!!! Outro ponto também é a fisica e movimentação dos bonecos. É tudo muito duro, meio travado! Parece que os bichos tão com 500kg de concreto nas roupas huehuehuehuehue. 
Mas enfim... creio eu que isso seja proposital do jogo mesmo. Até porque tem itens que te dão um pouqinho a mais de velocidade. 

E pra encerrar, se você quer muito jogar sofrendo o minimo possivel eu recomendo duas coisas: a primeira é que jogue com amigos e conhecidos!!!! Vai ser bemmmmmmm mais "suave" a caminhada de todos até ficarem full broken. E a segunda é, caso for jogatinar sozinho, compre a DLC chamada Artisan and Magician. Vai por mim, de longe este conteudo adicional é DISPARADO o melhor de todos. Ela possui uma personagem bem OP que vai melhorar bastante o seu early game. 

E é isso aew galera. Sem sombra de duvidas recomendo simmmmmmmmmm Gunfire Reborn a todo mundo!!!!!!!!!!! Muito obrigado a você que chegou até aqui, um forte abraço e nos vemos nas proximas analises. Até la, bjbjbjbj e fuyyyyyyyyyyyy :* õ/

Game Name: Go! Go! Nippon! ~My First Trip to Japan~
Reviews:
This is a very cute and heartwarming game. It is actually consisting of two important aspects. First one is the overview of cultural and sightseeing aspects of Tokyo and nearby areas. The second is a simple romantic VN story. Even though the story and relationships are simplified and teenager oriented the whole game was great even for old guy like me. I like games from which I can learn new things and this game does deliver. Even though I have been to Japan and knew many of the sights presented I also noticed how many things I missed and I how many things I still would love to see or experience in the future. The fact that the game is old did not bother me at all (I focused mostly on 2016 version anyway). I would love to have a newer and even more expanded version of course. 

The thing which could be difficult is finding all routes and scenes. Some may need consulting a guide. | とても美しい日本です | i thought it was cute | A classic by now.

[h3]Что понравилось:[/h3]

 - [b]Атмосфера.[/b] Игра прекрасно передаёт дух XVIII века: локации, одежда персонажей и декоры вызывают восхищение.
 - [b]Стилизация.[/b] Художественное оформление добавляет шарма, а анимации персонажей запоминаются.
 - [b]Загадки.[/b] Они интересны и заставляют расширять кругозор.
 - [b]Сюжет.[/b] История сама по себе завораживает и держит напряжение до конца.
 - [b]Последствия принимаемых решений.[/b] Ваши действия влияют на развитие сюжета и окончание игры.
 - [b]Исторические референсы.[/b] Ссылки на реальных личностей и события добавляют глубины.

[h3]Что не понравилось:[/h3]

 - [b]Затянутость и нудность некоторых эпизодов.[/b] Середина игры сильно тянется, что может утомить.
 - [b]Загадки.[/b] Да, они же и понравились, но некоторые были слишком сложными (привет, письмо и шифр).
 - [b]Музыка.[/b] Она постоянно одинаковая, я понимаю, что это основной узнаваемый мотив, мне он нравился по началу, но потом начал раздражать.
 - [b]Скомканный сюжетный поворот и концовка.[/b] Они могли быть более проработанными.

[h3]Резюме:[/h3]
The Council — это детективный квест от Big Bad Wolf, разделённый на эпизоды. Во многом он похож на интерактивные сериалы.

Затянутость игры в середине очень утомляет и даже было желание дропнуть, но сюжет меня очень затянул, и мне было интересно узнать, чем закончится. 

Первый эпизод производит вау-эффект (он очень кинематографичен), но к середине игра затягивается. Концовка показалась скомканной. 

Если вы любите интерактивные детективы или сильные атмосферные истории, то The Council стоит внимания. Несмотря на свои недочёты, это очень уникальный проект. | An imaginative tale of two British super spies infiltrating a mysterious secret society controlling the world.  While the subtext of the characters relationships to each other, and the significance of the characters intercommunication can get complicated, The Council has no problem providing an engaging political thriller steeped in the occult. The story is captivating.  The characterization is meticulous.  The gameplay is fluid.  And the action is exciting.  I really enjoyed this game.  Rated 9 out of 10. | technical quality issssss okay 
great story and quests
a lot of interactions based on skills

У игры есть один большой минус. Серьезный. Который обесценивает все плюсы. И это не безумно кривая анимация персонажей в диалогах (включая лицевую). Это кульминационный момент. Сценарист всю игру к "этому" подводит заставляя сомневаться, что именно к "этому" все и приведет. А потом говорит "я же сказал что так и будет. кроме того все что ты до этого делал не имеет смысла". После чего я начинаю искать кнопку пропуска диалогов а ее нет. А могла ведь хорошая игра получиться. | Абсолютно выдающаяся игра с потрясающей эстетикой, невероятной атмосферой, превосходным дизайном!.. 
Классные геймплейные механики, в виде загадок и постоянного изучения окружения. 
Великолепно прописанные диалоги (которые больше напоминают словесную дуэль), с возможностью влияния на оппонентов или же не способностью воздействия на этих самых оппонентов. 
Отличный сюжет, вопросы к которому могут возникнуть лишь в самом конце (а меня финал нисколько не смутил и минусом его я не посчитал). Да, и если даже, кого-то концовка смущает, то она не перечеркивает все предыдущие часы игры.
По-моему личному мнению, эта видеоигра - однозначно отвечает на вопрос: являются ли игры искусством? Да, безусловно являются. И этот шедевр (на мой взгляд) - тому подтверждение.

As a long-time fan of the original Tomb Raider games, I found the 2013 reboot deeply disappointing. While the game excels in visuals and technical execution, it sacrifices the series' core identity: exploration and puzzles, in favor of relentless combat and excessive action sequences. The "Shantytown" section epitomizes this shift, forcing players into repetitive, nonsensical battles with hordes of enemies, completely sidelining the essence of discovery that defined the classic games.

The narrative also falls apart under basic scrutiny. For instance, the sheer number of fresh corpses, mummified remains, and skeletons scattered across the island suggests that it must have been the unfortunate destination of dozens—if not hundreds—of fully loaded cruise ships over decades! And let’s not forget the absurd logistics: how do you even feed and sustain an army of enemies that large on an isolated island? To top it off, aside from the mummified queen, there are no women in the cult that occupies the island, just an endless parade of men. It’s not only implausible but also a glaring failure in representation. Laughable.

For those seeking the intelligent exploration and challenging puzzles of the original series, this game may leave you frustrated and exhausted. If you're looking for an action-heavy adventure, it might suit your tastes, but fans of the classic Tomb Raider should approach with caution! | Juegazo al principio no le tenia mucha fe pero despues de jugar un rato descubri que es un juegazo el combate y la exploracion es buenisimo y todos los coleccionables y  mejoras son espectaculares. 10/10 | Гарна та дуже драйвова гра. Шкода, що в онлайн вже ніхто не грає, тому спробувати його нормально майже неможливо. | Rating: 8.5/10

Overview: Tomb Raider (2013) is a reboot of the classic action-adventure franchise, offering a fresh origin story for the legendary adventurer Lara Croft. Developed by Crystal Dynamics, the game takes a more grounded and gritty approach to Lara's character, portraying her transformation from a vulnerable young woman into the hardened explorer she's known for. Combining exploration, puzzle-solving, and intense combat, the 2013 iteration offers a blend of action and survival mechanics set on the mysterious island of Yamatai.

Story: The story follows Lara Croft, who, along with her crew, becomes stranded on the island of Yamatai while searching for the lost kingdom of Himiko. The island, however, is home to many dark secrets, including a dangerous cult and other perils that put Lara’s life in constant jeopardy. Throughout the game, Lara faces various challenges and fights to survive, all while uncovering the island’s mysteries and discovering her own strength.

The narrative is engaging, focusing on Lara's personal journey and her development as a character. The story touches on themes of survival, trust, and the cost of discovery, with the stakes rising as Lara delves deeper into the island’s secrets. The characters are well-developed, though the focus is primarily on Lara, making her transformation and growth the heart of the plot.

Gameplay: Tomb Raider (2013) brings a mix of exploration, platforming, puzzle-solving, and combat. The controls are smooth and accessible, with an emphasis on both exploration and action. As Lara navigates the island, players engage in intense combat against various enemies, including mercenaries, wild animals, and the island’s cultists. The combat system is robust, offering a variety of weapons, from bow and arrows to firearms, as well as a range of stealth and melee attacks.

The game also features light RPG elements, allowing players to upgrade Lara’s weapons and abilities as they progress. This adds a layer of depth to the gameplay, encouraging players to explore the island thoroughly to collect resources and improve their equipment. There are also collectible items and hidden treasures scattered throughout the game, rewarding those who take the time to explore off the beaten path.

Graphics and Performance: The graphics in Tomb Raider (2013) are exceptional, with lush environments, stunning character models, and impressive lighting effects. The island of Yamatai is beautifully designed, ranging from treacherous cliffs to dense jungles, all rendered in high detail. The character animations, particularly Lara’s, are lifelike, and the facial expressions convey emotion and intensity. The cinematic cutscenes are integrated seamlessly into the gameplay, making the narrative feel fluid and immersive.

The game runs smoothly on most modern systems, with well-optimized performance. On higher settings, the visuals are breathtaking, but even at lower settings, the game still maintains a high level of quality.

Audio Design: The audio design in Tomb Raider is excellent, with a haunting and atmospheric soundtrack that complements the game’s tone. The sound effects are realistic, from the sounds of Lara’s footsteps on different surfaces to the crackling of fire and distant roars of danger. The voice acting, particularly from Camilla Luddington as Lara Croft, is solid, adding depth to the character’s emotions as she faces peril after peril.

Challenges: While the game is generally well-balanced, some sections can feel a bit repetitive, especially in terms of combat. Some of the puzzles are relatively simple, and while they provide a nice break from the action, they don’t challenge players too much. The difficulty ramps up during some of the more intense sequences, especially during the combat-heavy portions, but overall, the game provides an enjoyable experience without being overwhelmingly difficult.

Final Thoughts: Tomb Raider (2013) successfully reinvents the franchise, offering a modern and more personal take on Lara Croft’s origin story. The game blends action, exploration, and survival mechanics into a thrilling adventure, with a great narrative that makes you care about Lara’s journey. Its visuals, gameplay mechanics, and immersive world design make it a standout entry in the action-adventure genre.

Pros:

Engaging story with strong character development
Beautiful graphics and immersive world design
Satisfying combat mechanics with a variety of weapons
Excellent audio and voice acting
Exploration and collectibles add depth to gameplay
Cons:

Combat can become repetitive
Some puzzles are relatively easy
Certain sections of the game feel linear
Tomb Raider (2013) is a fantastic reboot that blends classic Tomb Raider elements with modern gameplay features. It offers an emotionally engaging and thrilling adventure for players who enjoy action, exploration, and survival mechanics. Highly recommended for fans of action-adventure games and those looking to experience Lara Croft's origin story in a fresh light. | Ben tomb raider cuk seviyorum ve en sevdiğim oyunu da bu ben cok keyif alarak oynadım erkek arkadaşıma da zorla oynattım benden başka kız görmekten hoşlanmadığı için biraz zorlandı fakat bitirince cok sevdi (sevmedi) gitsin o anca cs oynasın zaten ne anlar kaliteli oyundan hıh
