Genres: Action, Adventure, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play
Reviews:
I used to play this. A lot, as you can see from the playtime. Most of the time I spent in the game was in 2022-23. I had a good group of people I played with and the servers were full of great people. We didn't really know what we were getting into, however, and eventually we all started playing less and less. Mostly because we realized that this isn't really a game. It's a job that you can pay your employer for the privilege of playing. You either pay to skip the grind or you perform ridiculous amounts of fetch quests and spam the 'G' (interact) key. I'm not kidding when I'm saying there are things that you need to do hundreds to thousands and tens of thousand times. There is an 'island soul' that has a less than 1% chance to drop from a pouch that has a less than 1% chance to drop from a mob. I don't know what the math on that works out to exactly, but googling says in the thousands of hours.

Gear 'honing' has abysmal success rates and you lose materials on every attempt. The honing materials are tiered and each level requires a different material so all your old mats are virtually worthless when you move up a tier. Drop rates for 'collection' items are extremely low and many mobs, bosses, events, and/or islands only spawn once or twice a day/week, so collection can take hundreds of hours for a single item.

Every system in the game is designed to take as much time as possible, every single day, unless you pay. Even if you pay, the time gates and drop rates stay the same, so you still have to grind. Beyond the currency bloat, there are also 4+ XP systems you need to grind.

I stopped eventually because of the sheer grindiness and utterly ridiculous currency and loot box mechanics. I came back recently because I heard some of the newer updates reduced the grind and simplified the currency. I thought I'd take a look and see whether it was worth coming back to.

I should not have. The grind is all still there and, if anything, is worse. The currency has been simplified a bit but it is still ridiculous. There is still silver, gold, crystals, royal crystals, pirate coins, open seas coins, pheons, shards, fragments, and probably others that I've just forgotten. There are six different 'profession' currencies that you have to collect and each of them has multi tiered rarities. You can convert between all of these at awful (like 10 to 1) exchange rates. There are sinks for all of them everywhere.

Despite simplifying some things, they've added whole new systems to make things even more grindy and confusing. These systems have new fetch and farm quests and use different materials that you need to use that have low drop and conversion rates. It's just more of the same.

Trying to play content from before the endgame is hit or miss because people are simply not there and the content is not accessible by just one person. You can ask in chat and you might get lucky, but there is very little incentive for an end-game character to help out with content that they probably haven't touched in years. There is a 'solo' mode option for some pre-endgame content, which can be useful, but it's a little laughable having a 'solo' mode anything in an MMO.

I could try to find a guild and try out discord to get some older, wider content done, but that doesn't solve the grind and loot box issues this game has. I don't mind grinding for an item, but grinding for just a chance at an item is a special level of hell.

There are some nice people still playing and you might be able to connect with them in game or over discord and get some things done if you are new or returning, but if you value your time, money, and sanity, don't. Pick another MMO. | This game suffers a major struggle as one that is developed by a Korean development company and published by an American company who pushes the game updates from KR to the western version of the game. The publisher has no power or will to transform the new (or current) player experience in a meaningful, permanent way that will help them ascend to the relative power levels of veteran players.

One of the best examples: Gearing a character in this game requires collections of 'cards' for card sets which are a huge component of damage or support power for players. As such, it requires too much time commitment and/or money for new players to get to a point where they are comfortably playing endgame content with veteran players or normal consistent raid lobbies at all due to this huge missing chunk of damage or support power.

Due to the nature of raid leaders being able to inspect the full range of gear for applicants to raid lobbies, many players will be rejected because of their lack in raid power. Due to the difficulty and dps checks of some raids, the lower power players will have a hard time clearing raid content with each other at all even if they do make their own lobbies.

The developers did make content called 'solo raids' which can be completed for some of the relevant gear materials, but due to the content release schedule of the game, players are never quite able to catch up because their rate of growth is too slow.

By the time a newer player is ready to play a newer raid, most of the population will have moved on to a newer raid, and a fresh player will not have an easy time finding a raid group in the Lobby Finder that will help them learn an older raid. The older raids are referred to as 'homework', and players are often expected to already have played and farmed the raid enough by that time, so as not to hold back the players who want to complete this 'homework' raid for their needed gold.

Speaking of gold, the Western version of the game is suffering from very high economic inflation due to the rampant and seemingly unstoppable plague of gold farming bots. Korea doesn't suffer from this issue because their game client requires a Korean SSN to verify identity. Steam has no such requirements, so bot accounts can be made in mass volumes to this day.
It's against the terms of service for players to purchase gold from these bots, but they continue to do so and purchase (from the Auction House) either large volumes of honing materials or high value gear which also happens to be in high demand from the general population.

Lost Ark at its core was such a cool game and I'm happy to have played it since launch, but as of Feb2025 it's not hard to see that this game's publisher (Amazon Game Studios) and/or developers (Smilegate) continue to betray its audience at large by not acknowledging core issues at all or addressing them in a timely manner.

There are other issues I'm sure I forgot to mention, but needless to say I can't recommend this game for any new or current players at this time. | i love the game, but management is  the worst you can get in MMO. 
IF you looking for developer or publisher communications, feedback review and improvements, addressing community needs and adapting to changing economy, meaningful monetization and much more, this is not a game for you to play! 
The only way to play it is wait for progression event -> choose the class you like -> do some solo content (raids). Rest of the game is completely out of touch with reality and will never be improved no matter how hard you wanted it to, User can never be heard! | Quiero aclarar que el juego en si es muy bueno, el problema es que no recomendaría este juego a un jugador nuevo, ya que solo puedes jugar a este juego y disfrutarlo siendo nuevo jugador si tienes amigos que ya jueguen de antes y tengan personajes muy avanzados. Los jugadores nuevos son muy fácilmente identificables, siendo muy difícil que te inviten a grupos para poder realizar el contenido final del juego. Por otro lado, es un juego extremadamente exigente respecto a las horas necesarias dedicadas al día, por lo tanto, es necesaria una inversión de horas extremadamente elevada para que puedas jugar de manera autónoma, pudiendo ser frustrante para muchos jugadores nuevos. | Jogo excelente, com ótimas mecânicas, lore muito divertida e emocionante. Você não precisa ficar 24h por dia no jogo, os conteúdos são semanais. A menos que você tenha nascido de 7 meses, não é necessário criar alts. Apenas jogue, junte recursos e evolua seu personagem. Qual o motivo de tanta pressa? Pq ninguém joga hoje em dia para se divertir? Tudo se resume a excessos, a uma corrida que no fim não tem ganhadores, pois se trata de um jogo eletrônico, e não da vida real.

Genres: Adventure, Casual, Indie, Free To Play
Reviews:
Dear Esther - это не просто игра, а интерактивное произведение искусства, которое ставит перед собой цель вызвать у игрока глубокие эмоциональные и философские размышления. Игра наполнена элементами исследования, повествованием и размышлениями о жизни, смерти, утрате и идентичности. Возможно она не всем подойдет и многие не поймут ее.

Субъективность восприятия игры - в игре осуществляется глубокая связь между игроком и рассказчиком. Все переживания, образы и слова передаются через личный опыт протагониста, что подчеркивает субъективный характер восприятия реальности. Это заставляет задуматься о том, насколько наши переживания формируют наше восприятие мира. Каждый игрок может по-разному интерпретировать события, исходя из своего жизненного опыта. Эта индивидуальность делает переживания в Dear Esther уникальными. В зависимости от личных ассоциаций, кто-то может акцентировать внимание на теме одиночества, тогда как другой игрок увидит в ней размышления о любви и утрате.

Поиск смысла основная задача, которую ставит перед собой герой - это поиск ответа на вопросы о жизни и смерти. Пребывание на заброшенном острове становится символом изоляции и размышлений о смысле жизни, что отражает философские концепции экзистенциализма и поиска идентичности. Размышления о существовании
Игра ставит перед игроком фундаментальные вопросы о существовании: "Кто я?", "Почему я здесь?" и "Каковы мои связи с другими?" Эти экзистенциалистские идеи пронизывают всю игру, побуждая игрока задуматься о своей жизни и своих выборах.

Замкнутый круг - игра исследует темы памяти и утраты, заставляя игрока испытывать горечь и ностальгию. Постепенное раскрытие истории через фрагменты воспоминаний приводит к глубоким размышлениям о том, как прошедшие события формируют наше настоящее и будущее. Концовка игры вызывает множество вопросов, оставляя игрокам пространство для личных выводов. Возможно, это отражает философскую концепцию цикла жизни и смерти, где каждый конец является также началом чего-то нового. Это подчеркивает идею о том, что понимание и принятие собственной истории и что это процесс, который продолжается бесконечно.

Изоляция и человеческие связи - остров, на котором происходит действие, символизирует физическую и эмоциональную изоляцию. Это позволяет игроку задуматься о своих собственных взаимодействиях и связях с другими людьми, а также о том, как одиночество может повлиять на личность.

Заключение

Dear Esther становится площадкой для размышлений о человечности, существовании и смысле. Она подчеркивает, что игры могут быть не только развлекательными, но и глубокими философскими произведениями, способными вызывать у игроков значимые переживания и размышления. Это просто гениальное сочетание искусства и интерактивности, способное затронуть самые потаенные уголки человеческой души.

И наберитесь терпения, в игре нету клавиши шифт :) | Admittedly emotionally compromised by this game, so bear with. I think the British coastline is one of the most consistently beautiful places I can lay eyes on, and have dedicated hundreds of hours of my time to walking around as much of it as I can. After my granddad on my Scottish side passed away, I accompanied my grieving father down the plots of land that meant the world to the both of them, and extended as far beyond as we could. One of our trips took us to Gometra, a place of such beauty it finally broke his stoic ass into tears, despite it not being somewhere he'd ever visited before. It's just such a haunted place, the whole coast is. Freezing cold, battering you with constant gales and rain and seafoam and seagull shit - the same elements that carve the land itself. Jagged slippery rocks and mundane flora, the only specs of colour or sign of human life being litter or debris, broken glass or empty cans left god knows how long ago. On my solo walks, my mind would wander to morbid places, imagining what would happen should I trip and hurt myself; what kinds of infections I'd get, how long it'd be if at all before I would have any chance of help.

That same uneasy awareness, the pull of the beautiful and the morbid, defines my experience with Dear Esther. The game's Hebridean island is made to feel like a place out of time, a frozen echo of someone's grief. It makes use of randomised props and narration, one of the major points of contention way back at this game's release. What does it all mean? Do you really need to replay it to get the full story? Even back when this was just a simple free Source mod developed as a university project, I somehow just Got It. I didn’t need to know who Donnelly was or why the narrator was here. The weight of it was enough, the way the words hung in the air like mist over the cliffs. Some things you don’t need to piece together; you just need to let the words hang as you eavesdrop on the memories on the breeze. Maybe this all works for me because - - embarrassingly, I think anyone who knows me particularly well would attest to this - - I am very emotionally vulnerable, not only to art but so many facets of life. If I am interpreting this as an existentialist tale about grief, would I be so greedy as to also demand Answers when life itself rarely supplies them at times of struggle? Much of why I feel this game be more effective than some of its more better-regarded peers is that it invites me to sit in the loneliness of the space. Pained, empty, but full - full of all the things unsaid, all the memories tied to a place that can’t speak for itself.
And maybe that’s why it hit me so hard. The randomisation of narration and props isn’t a gimmick; it’s a reminder that stories are never static. The same place, the same words, can mean something different depending on where you are in your life when you encounter them. I’ve played Dear Esther's original form, and the remaster a great many times, but this replay was a good few years in the making - and the story I uncovered felt wonderfully evocative... not because the island has changed, but because I have.

On replay I was particularly taken to the work put into the sound design. This is such a rich soundscape... The whisper of the wind through the grass, the distant crash of waves against the cliffs, the faint echo of something that could be a voice. Doesn’t just set the mood; it deepen it, pulling me further into the island’s strange, mournful embrace. Jessica Curry’s score remains as achingly beautiful as it was I first heard it, swelling at just the right moments to catch my breath in my throat, and using elements of unusual distortion and industrial wailing to convey a real sense of sorrow. It harkens to whenever I visit the coast - there's never a moment of silence, even in relative stillness and isolation, it's this overwhelming cacophony of nature is trying to crush the ground I'm standing on. Can't praise it enough, man, entire characters in some of my favourite games don't have the presence of the wind in Dear Esther.

One unsung aspect of this game for me is the involvement of Robert Briscoe - the veteran level designer for Mirror's Edge. That being a game I adore for its incredibly well thought out world - not just gameplay-wise, but mostly by how it conveys a sense of place. Mirror's Edge thrives on its pristine, dystopian cityscapes, where every building and rooftop feels deliberately placed to tell a story about control, surveillance, and rebellion. Briscoe’s work there demonstrated an ability to create environments that are more than just backdrops, they’re active participants in the narrative, conveying meaning through their design - on top of just looking gorgeous. This same philosophy is palpable in Dear Esther. A broken fence, a rusted piece of machinery, or a strange marking on the wall - each detail feels like a breadcrumb leading me further into the island’s mysteries. It’s also worth noting how Briscoe leveraged the Source engine to its fullest potential. The lighting, in particular, plays a huge role in the game’s emotional resonance. The way the sun sets over the cliffs or how the glow of phosphorescent caves contrasts with the bleakness above ground is breathtaking. These moments aren’t just pretty, they’re deeply atmospheric to me. The final chapter's skybox? Abso sublime.

The game isn't for everyone, and I understand why. I also don't think any game worth playing would be. The only interaction function is a camera zoom, there is one walk speed, if you don't feel for it then there's nothing to latch on to. Still, the smear back at release does feel incredibly quaint now that you can hardly walk through Itch without tripping over a game like this. It doesn't feel that way now, but this was an incredibly risky game at the time, and one that has definitely helped blossom a subgenre of narrative adventure game. You have to forgive me for the glaze sesh, it never really sat right with me that this game has been forbidden from getting its flowers even now. | "Consigo ver daqui a minha armada. Todas as cartas que te quis mandar, se tivesse conseguido chegar ao continente, e que permaneciam no fundo da minha mochila, espalhei-as pela praia perdida. Depois, peguei em cada uma delas e dobrei-as em barcos de papel. Dobrei-te nos vincos e depois, quando o sol se punha, lancei a frota ao mar. Desfeita em vinte e um pedaços, confiei-te ao Atlântico, e aqui me sentei a ver cada pedaço de ti afundar." | a beautiful walk through an impossible island as a man descends into madness | This is far from being just a "walking simulator" - this beautiful emotionally game it's so rich in everything that makes it this unique.

Seraph’s Last Stand é um roguelike minimalista com gameplay simples, mas extremamente viciante. O desafio cresce com inimigos cada vez mais fortes a cada wave, exigindo estratégia na escolha de upgrades. O grande atrativo é a possibilidade de criar builds absurdas, tornando-se praticamente imortal com as combinações certas.

Apesar da simplicidade visual, a progressão e variedade mantêm o jogo envolvente. 
Salve para o youtuber Andrezito

Reviews:
方舟一直都是我心目中的生存游戏天花板，21年用着一台很破烂的手机接触方舟虽然只有是十几帧，但是很快乐，22年放暑假的时候用着姐姐核显笔记本玩，直接卡到爆炸闪退，但是体验到手游与端游的差距后，立志要买一台不卡电脑开最高画质玩，23年放暑假用自己凑了很久的钱在咸鱼上买二手零件组装了一台R5 5500cpu,显卡RX590玩，但还是很卡，低画质六十帧都没有，于是我开始慢慢节约开销，一点点省下来，25年1月份我用这些钱买了一台搭载I7 14650hx和4070显卡的笔记本，我开着最高画质玩，我完成了我儿时的心愿，没有遗憾，现在是我人生中最快乐的时候，不说了，方舟生存启动！ | 作为沙盒生存史上最伟大游戏之一的ARK，只能说喜欢的人玩几千个小时都不腻，玩不进去的基本很早就退坑了，其原因无非就是不喜欢恐龙元素或者是游戏难度问题，这款游戏给我个人的感觉就是前期坐牢，中期最好玩，后期爽，大后期就会非常腻，一般这种时候就该换地图了，或者是玩点别的游戏缓解一下，等过段时间再继续体验会更合适，本人1000小时+，大多数时间都是自己单机，偶尔多人联机，人多其实才更好玩，当然这也得分情况，pvp很容易让人红温是真事，但是比起单机更不容易玩腻，可操作性会多很多，pve会玩的更舒服一些，在此极力推荐刚入坑或者会坑的新人们先去单机玩孤岛（island）这张初始地图熟悉一下各类操作和恐龙，即时是玩最简单的这张地图，新手前期也是最难度过的时候，坚持下来了你就是下一位大佬，撑不住那我还是劝你换别的游戏，玩游戏还是开心最重要，没必要折磨自己，但是我当初前期的时候也非常享受，因为我觉得探索新事物是最有趣的，现在的我已经逐渐套路化，感觉再也没有当初一开始的那种感觉了，虽然说我不会退坑，但是基本上也没啥新的体验了，还是祝各位玩家玩的痛快吧，痛苦并快乐着，不说了继续刷材料 | This game is not perfect by any means. Programming wise, not particularly well omtimized. Bugs still happen, creatures do weird stuff etc. With that in mind, I fucking love this game. I have met so many great people and communities with this. Been with it since before breeding was a thing. I've had laughs, cries, love and heartbreak. And all the dinosaurs. All the adventures. The long nights fooling around in this world. Many hours, such worth, very good. Absolutely worth it. | ---{Gráficos}---

Game Name: ARK: The Survival Of The Fittest
Genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Strategy
Reviews:
It's criminal that this game is still being sold, considering that the servers are seemingly permanently down. | [h1] ARK: The Survival of the Fittest – мёртворождённый эксперимент [/h1]

Когда разработчики ARK: Survival Evolved решили вписаться в жанр королевских битв, казалось, что идея неплохая: битвы с динозаврами, приручение прямо в бою, выживание против других игроков – всё это могло бы стать чем-то уникальным. Но реальность оказалась печальнее.

[h2] ✅ Что в игре хорошего: [/h2]
✔ В теории – интересная концепция (если закрыть глаза на исполнение).
✔ Динозавры в королевской битве – звучит круто, но только звучит.

[h2] ❌ Почему в это никто не играет: [/h2]
✖ Мёртвая с момента выхода – онлайн просто нет, даже боты бы не стали заходить в эту игру.
✖ Кривой баланс – если ты не оседлал Т-Рекса в первые минуты, то готовься стать кормом для тех, кто успел.
✖ Отвратительная оптимизация – просадки FPS, лаги, баги, как будто движок и сам не хочет, чтобы эта игра существовала.
✖ Никому не нужна – на фоне других королевских битв вроде PUBG, Apex Legends или даже фанатских серверов в оригинальном ARK эта игра просто не имеет смысла.

Это не просто провал – это игра, которая умерла ещё до того, как кто-то всерьёз в неё поверил разработчик. С таким же успехом можно попробовать сыграть в PUBG на выключенном мониторе – хотя бы нервы целее будут.

2 из 10 покинутых серверов. | ARK: The Survival of the Fittest is the ultimate test of survival where it’s not just about fighting dinosaurs—it’s about surviving in a world where everything, from the weather to the creatures to your fellow players, is out to get you. Picture this: you’re dropped into an island with nothing but your wits, some rocks, and a stick, and you’ve got to figure out how to stay alive while dodging massive carnivores and attempting to avoid becoming someone else’s dinner. Add in some players who think they’re the island’s top predator (spoiler: they’re not), and suddenly, your quest to survive turns into an all-out, hilarious game of “who can mess with who first?” Trust me, it’s intense, but also surprisingly fun when you realize you’re a second away from being eaten by a T-Rex and you somehow make it out alive. That’s when the real fun begins!

At its heart, ARK: The Survival of the Fittest is a battle royale-style game set in a prehistoric world, filled with dangers both natural and player-made. The basic premise? You, along with other players, are dropped onto a hostile island where you must gather resources, craft weapons, tame dinosaurs, and try to survive long enough to become the last one standing. The twist? You’ll need to strategize, team up, or even betray others to outsmart and outlast the competition. It’s not just about surviving the creatures; it’s about surviving the players too. Tame some raptors, build traps, create defenses, and get ready for combat because the last survivor on the island wins. Oh, and don’t forget about the giant mutant spiders and those terrifying, unkillable bosses roaming around. In short, everything wants you dead, and you have to be smarter, stronger, and faster to avoid becoming dinner.

What really stands out about ARK: The Survival of the Fittest is the blend of survival mechanics, strategy, and chaotic multiplayer action. The vast array of creatures you can tame and use in combat adds layers of complexity to the gameplay. The game rewards strategic thinking, from deciding when to team up with others (and when to stab them in the back) to figuring out the best way to hunt or avoid the island’s mega-predators. The crafting system is deep, and the thrill of gathering materials to build your base and weapons while fending off enemy tribes is incredibly satisfying. If you’re into survival games with a high stakes, high tension environment where every decision counts—and where a single mistake could lead to an epic failure—ARK: The Survival of the Fittest is a must-try. It’s perfect for anyone who loves a challenge, epic dino battles, and the thrill of outlasting other players in a hostile environment. Trust me, it’s chaos—and it’s absolutely worth diving into! | sera que volverán los servidores alguna vez??? | Игра просто бомба от слова совсем! Если у вас кучу времени и нервов то эта игра вам подойдет.

Great idea, and great mechanics. It has really good/fitting graphics.
The soundtrack and writing both range from good to awesome.
But I think the design and balance are just not fun in the end, and that's not something you can avoid.

First of all, and most importantly: the amount of mindless clicking you have to do is ridiculous. And that's the overwhelming majority of your actual gameplay.
There's no automation or multiple selection; even when you have to manage hundreds of humans, you have to move them one by one. You also have to do this relatively fast, as you can't move humans while paused.
I wouldn't be surprised if this even made the game unplayable for some people, especially with CTS.

There's little to no meta progression in the game, which I didn't expect looking at the Steam page.

The default difficulty is just too high. I will personally do even Hardcore, to have the game 100%, but otherwise the game's difficulty is just not worth for what it offers.
Here I use difficulty for lack of a better word, I mainly mean low chance to win.
When difficulty is offset with progression and/or skill gain, then it can be satisfying. E.g. the overwhelming majority of people won't win Hades or Tainted Grail: Conquest on first try, but there's progression to motivate you. In hardcore games like the old Prince of Persia it feels great to win, because there's skill involved. But in Despotism 3K you rely on random events, and on knowing exactly how to react to those events (to be clear, your reaction is a few clicks at max).
I'm talking about events like ones that either do nothing, or disable one of your 3 crucial facilities for a significant amount of time. The only"skill" in this game is having already encountered a specific event and knowing exactly which option to choose, it's not exactly satisfying. Nor is the game hard to master, despite what the steam page says.

I don't think any of these issues by themselves would be a problem, but combined they seriously affect gameplay experience, constantly and unavoidably. | El juego tiene una premisa interesante, un pixel art bonito, una buena música y te reta, no es fácil al principio.

Si tu objetivo es completar los logros el problema que he notado ha sido que se hace tedioso, no difíciles, por ejemplo en el modo difícil dependes totalmente del RNG, no puedes pasarlo si X opciones no te salen desde el principio, y otros logros es de repetir y repetir y repetir...

Es un juego que te da algunas opciones de rejugabilidad, pero le veo un principio y un final pero por el precio que tiene ofrece bastante. | a perfect controlllllll, hehehehehe | Залипательная | Прикольная игра 🥴

Tyr in game. Find me, friend me, ask me questions <3. | [b]Скажу честно - впечатления очень смешанные. Даже с учетом того, что это был мой первый опыт в таких робо-арена-шутерах. Знаю, что в Стиме уже есть подобная игра про роботов и она, кстати, бесплатная. Давайте-ка расскажу о своих первых впечатлениях по-порядку.[/b]

При заходе в игру меня встретило обучение, которое вполне себе внятно объяснило что здесь к чему, как игра играется и как что управляется. Это большой плюс. Графически мне игра не понравилась вовсе.
После обучения я узнал, что в игре есть разные классы, разные роботы и пилоты со своими способностями. Роботов можно менять, кастомизировать - короче прелесть, всё как надо. 
Но вот начался первый матч. Игра тут устроена так, что ты можешь подсоединится у уже существующей партии. А там уже происходит лютая катавасия, играют какие-то профессионалы азиатского киберспорта, наигравшие уже 100+ матчей, хотя игра вышла час назад. А ты такой стоишь со своим роботом-пукалкой и нихрена не понимаешь. Я играл за разных персонажей, пробовал разные пушки, но это не останавливало местных пацанов - меня всё время уничтожали. 
Карт тоже, кстати, несколько. У каждой своя атмосфера, свой ландшафт и к ним нужно привыкать. 

Конечно, со всем этим можно разобраться, если захотеть, понять, какое оружие как действует, какого робота и где лучше использовать. Всё это придет с опытом и временем, как и в любой игре. Сам матч построен так - нам нужно забирать точки у врага, захватывать генераторы и ставить турели. Побеждает та команда, у которой останутся командные очки. Быть может существуют еще другие варианты матчей, но я пока их не встретил.  

Не знаю, ребята...400 с лишним рублей за этот проект? Сомнительно, по крайней мере для меня. Я фанат всяких роботов  с детства (привет Front Mission), поэтому и приобрел данный проект, но всё равно игра оставила очень смешанные чувства и желание сделать возврат средств, потому что я понимаю, что, скорее всего, никогда ее не запущу больше. 
Мыльная графика, вечная месиловка без продыху, цветастая, яркая, наляпистая картинка и интерфейс, отсутствие русского, что немного затрудняет знакомство с игрой (не для всех, но это факт), деревянные анимации...в общем игра на любителя.

Быть может я не прав, может она хороша, просто ей нужно дать время, разобраться, но что-то мне подсказывает, что это не так.

１：まずチュートリアルを開始。ここでロボの動きを学びます。

２：その後、チュートリアルエリアに入室。そこでは多数のBOTと少数のプレイヤーがいます。
　　そこで１勝、ないし複数回のゲームをプレイするまでチュートリアルエリアを抜けられません。

３：チュートリアルエリアではロボのカスタムが出来ません。
　　その代わりロールというのを選べます。そのロール毎に４種類のロボの装備が決まっています。
　　つまりはプリセットがロールの種類だけあるので、それでロボの操作に慣れる感じです。

４：チュートリアルワールドを出たら、メニュー画面に「ARMORY」というタブが解放されており
　　そこでロボの装備を変更可能になります。

５：また、ロボットの重量毎に研究ツリーがあり、戦闘リザルトで手に入る研究ポイントで
　　研究ツリーを解放してロボを強化出来ます。強化には一定の条件をクリアする必要があります。

６：また、武器につけるオプションにも研究ツリーがあります。それらのオプションはロボットの強化レベルで
　　つけられるオプションのレベル上限が決まっているので注意して下さい。


ひとまずわかっている内容は以上です！とても面白かったので、是非遊んでみて下さい！

I want to say that I enjoy "Survivor-Likes" a bit too much. I have played almost every version of them. (atleast it feels like it)

VS, HoT, Death Must Die, Deep Rock, Genesia, Army of Ruin and some more. Each 100 hours+.
Makes me want to believe, I can see the good and the ugly in these games.

Halls of Torment is in my opinion in the Top 3 of Survivor-Likes and even succeeds in almost every aspect of it's "father".

One of the major flaws (imo) I experienced in these types of games, is the end game. What happens if you unlocked everything. Upgraded everything to the max. 

Usually these games lose themselves in senselessness.



Halls of Torment has a very befitting name and for sure it reaches it's point of illogical endless progession too but they have found ways to make the gameplay, on the 1000x repeating maps, quite interesting. 

You have a good arrangement of characters, each (so they make it feel) with their handcrafted and thought-through designs. They feel very unique and you can experiment alot. 

On top of that add some Items, some of them are mandatory for specific builds but yet there's alot of freedom to experiment around because they managed to keep most of them very useful.

That alone already sold me for most of the time I enjoyed the game. 

If one goes further they have added a cute endless mode. Cute because I personally love endless modes but this one didn't hit me as hard as some other games. You can pay gold to get random debuffs on your next endless run. Which I think can be alot of fun but I enjoyed their "Artifacts" far more.

You can play the basic maps with a mutator but the good thing here is you can decide which ones and how many you take, though each artifact will buff enemies base-stats no matter which artifact you pick. (...and yourself by granting more xp.)

That is in which I have lost myself, enjoying this game just the last few weeks.

If you manage to debuff the hell out of your run and kill the bosses in the end you get a currency to endlessly upgrade your characters. 

Now the kicker: In other games you have 100 of the progression upgrade-thingies.
You apply it to one character. 
Now you have 0 upgrade-thingies. Here you can upgrade them all simultaneously.

Fcking broke my mind.

First I resetted all the stats before applying it to a different character, because I was so used to games robbing your time and making you upgrade all characters each on their own.

But in HoT even characters you "don't like" will become viable only by playing your favorite character.


Halls of Torment. A big YES!

Sadly, it's just not for me. | I have mixed feelings on this one. On one hand, it is only 6,66€, looks good and runs well. On the other hand, that is all it has going for it, yet it still sits at 95% positive reviews. This rating seems too far from what I think it deserves, so I want to shine some light on its weak points to help out those who got blinded by the visuals (you know who you are).

tl;dr: Game has no performance issues and looks like Diablo (which is 95% of its merit). Gameplay is unengaging and grindy and peaks at "not harsh anymore". Not good, far from fun, just "not as bad as it was starting out". 
If you REALLY need your survivor-like to look like Diablo, then go for it. Otherwise go for Holocure or Death Must Die (or Vampire Survivors) as they all outclass it in every aspect aside from maybe your personal preference in visual style.

Be warned that a long, rambling yap is following.
The game starts slow, as in "your character moves at a snail pace and barely clears the enemies" slow. Matches the visual style and the unforgiving gameplay of the era that its visuals draw from, but that's about as far as the compromise goes. Maps have a few different point of interests you can reach, but due to the movement speed you likely won't get to complete more than one set of them at a time during your first runs, if at all. Combat feels adequate, with some desperately needed stat increases on level up to make your first character not fall behind too far and maybe survive 10-15 minutes on your first try.
Go back to the camp and spend a few coins on meta upgrades to your stats. Rinse and repeat a few times until you get enough stats to have your character not feel crippled, but instead appropriate to have a chance at clearing the level. Repeat for 10 hours until you realize that the grind never stops and you have yet to reach the point where you feel strong instead of handicapped, and the game did not hit actual fun territory once during your playtime.

Sounds overly dramatic, but that is what my experience with the game was like. 
It is understandable for your power level to be too low for a chance to clear the first map on your first tries, but here it feels sadistic. You move slowly, barely get to pickup resources due to your tiny pickup range, and attack slowly. Once enemies start to come in at a faster pace it won't take long to die. It takes a few runs to grind enough stats to have enough power to clear, and even more if you want to get some QOL stats, such as movement speed and pickup range, just for gameplay to be less [i] tedious [/i]. The first map and its accompanying missions provide enough motivation and rewards to offer a quick increase in power level, but all that does is unveil the plethora of other systems the game has been graciously saving so you don't get swamped with too many grinds at once.
One at a time you get to unlock (and grind to upgrade) meta progression such as: more stats to upgrade, reroll and banish options on level up, items to equip, and also new classes. Just for those you will need to run maps plenty of times, not only do you collect currencies, the equipment you want to unlock only reaches your camp if you collect them during a run and then send it back, one at a time, during the level to save it, and thus have access to it in future runs. You need to sacrifice power during any given run in favor of meta progression since you lose a well needed upgrade to unlock it permanently. On its own that sounds fine, but it is so slow. You only get to do that for one item per run (at first? Could be upgradable, but who cares to play enough to find out), and with the amount and variety you want to build up for the roster of heroes, that is gonna take a LOT of runs you play just to collect items and send them back. And then do it again, but this time purposely pick an item that does not fit your class, but hasn't been unlocked. And then again. And there is no other option, such as playing well and getting to carry out all the items you carry. Only the one item you send back to camp, everything else collected is lost.

Is that bad? So bad that I would go out of my way to write a negative review?
No, but it's one of the more egregious systems that require running maps over and over. The real bad part is that running maps is not fun. The core gameplay that the meta systems loop you around is slow and unrewarding, and that is the actual sin.
I started out talking about the game feeling slow, which is due to the default movement speed, along with attack speed and no access to advanced skills. This gets better after all, since your gold goes into rectifying that. But then you complete dozens of runs and find out that the game is a different kind of slow aside from the meta grind: Actually clearing maps is an uninteractive waiting around until the time ticks down. Once you hit the desired power level to comfortably grind meta items, you get to enjoy not being threatened by mobs anymore. That is where you find out that leveling up is presenting you with a screen showing multiple rewards to pick from, yet there is no real decision to be made. It might have felt like it during the first map when every stat was lacking, and you had to assess which area was lacking most at any given moment, but later on those stat increases become less impactful. The real meat should be in the advanced skills you get to upgrade every few levels, yet there is not enough variety among their upgrade paths, or interactions between skills to force any actual decision making. Skills are just a different visual that enemies die to. No matter which one I committed to, the gameplay felt the same. The way you move and engage with enemies does not change depending on what you picked. It is easy to see the clear best option, and then it is back to waiting for another 5 level ups to pick another one. There is no crafting a build in this game, no theory crafting synergies, there is only choosing which skill you want to carry you through a level, and then investing in it once unlocked. 
And once you do, it doesn't even get fun. Even with a strong loadout and great items, you might be strong and delete enemies, yet not even this state is actually fun to be at. Enemies come at you too slow to make it satisfactory, so even the ideal endgame power level is just...not fun. After all the grinding to get past the painful early stats, and the grinding to unlock enough meta systems, and enough grind to earn meta currencies, you go into a run, auto pilot your "build", and the reward is watching enemies not kill you. You don't explode the screen, no shredding hordes of mobs that threatened you before. No happy brain chemicals. The game goes from "you feel slow and weak" to "you are not slow and not weak anymore". The best it gets is not being painful. Gameplay peaks at "not bad" instead of good, let alone actually fun. This is the real death sentence.

Torturous beginning that flows into a steady stream of meta systems that require grinding their currencies. A slog of repeating maps and doing runs that do not require actual decision making, and do not offer the depth to allow theory crafting build. All of that just to make a character reach a power level where you do not die, and do not even get any real satisfaction of looking at waves get annihilated, but instead just trickle in through the border of your screen before dying. A roster of characters that play too similar and not engage or synergize with skills either, so no real depth here either. Pick whoever has the best stats, and by the time you hit level 10 in the level, it's all the same.

This game encourages you to grind a boring repetition of levels and refuses to acknowledge good gameplay with meta rewards or even the basic satisfaction of "build goes brrrrrr". Painfully tedious at the beginning, slightly less tedious by the time you realize that is all it has, and drop it for a better game. But at least it looks like Diablo from 1997, right?

[h1]よいところ[/h1]
[h3]東方オールスター[/h3]
・新作出典のキャラも多い。
→地霊殿や神霊廟辺りで、知識が止まってると、知らないキャラの多さにビビる。
・割と序盤から、旧作キャラも出てくる。本当にオールスター。
→アリスの図鑑の番号の位置を見たら、どこまで網羅されてるかわかるはず。
・ありがちな「嫁キャラが弱くて辛い」問題は、自由なスキル編成でかなり緩和。
→ただし、ステータス傾向や防御耐性はキャラ固有なので、強弱はある。
→特に脳筋プレイする場合は、素早さがないと、戦闘で後手に回って辛くなる。

[h3]選べるプレイスタイル[/h3]
・メガテンプレイヤーのトラウマ要素を、ほぼほぼカットできるのでカジュアル。
→[b]即死魔法はそもそもなし。[/b]
→待ち伏せ(＝バックアタック＝不意打ち)は、オプションでなしにできる。
・ただし、弱点の攻撃は数発で死ねる上、ごく一部の手段でしか、戦闘中の味方復活はできない。
・不意打ちの有無で、サクサクプレイ～地獄まで、幅広いプレイングが可能。

[h1]わるいところ[/h1]
[h3]ダンジョン探索のリソース[/h3]
・パーティーの平均LVに応じて、リソース消費が高くなり、0になるとペナルティ。
→ミニマップ消滅。
→パーティー編成封印。
→戦闘中のコンタクト＆ゲージ消費の特殊コマンド封印。
・セーブポイントで無料で全回復できる。
・正直、プレイヤー側にできる工夫はないので、ただ遊びにくくなってるだけ。

[h3]後半ダンジョンがダルイ[/h3]
・特に落とし穴で、何度も同じ道を通るハメになるマップがダルい。
→マップコンプリートのボーナスがあるので、埋めようと思うと、なかなか作業的。
→幸い、マップを埋めるアイテム(非売品)があるので、辛いマップは使った方がいい。
・悪名が高すぎた、外れワープまみれ＆歩いて脱出不能というクソダンジョンは、アップデートで消滅。
→歩いて外に出られる一方通行ダンジョンに変更。それでもダンジョン探索のリソース消費速度アップ付きのマップなのでダルいが。

[h3]キャラの別スタイルがない[/h3]
・きもけーねや、妖々夢ドレスのゆかりん等はなし。
・ロリス、もんぺゆうかりん等の旧作の状態もなし。
・Cave制作のアーケード作品要素はなし。

[h3]総評[/h3]
筆者は正直、コマンドRPGが年々受け付けなくなり、リメイクFF3等を投げたような人間だが、今作は裏ボス撃破まで一気に遊べた。
サンプルムービーを見て、ピンと来たならオススメ。
 | 虽然他后来史低卖的超级便宜，但是我还是说这个价位买一个女神转生1+东方肯定是不亏的。想蹲史低也可以，原价买也不亏。就是这样的感觉。游戏整体系统按照女神转生1的来，把说得变成了弹幕，算是很用心的结合了两个游戏的特色了。不过主要还是推荐巫术类玩家，单纯冲着东方来的人不一定能玩的下去。 | Touhou: Artificial Dream in Arcadia is a very solid First-Person Dungeon-Crawler RPG with strong combat and a lot of versatility in character building. The additional bullet hell elements used for hijacking were very enjoyable and the presentation has a lot of charm. 

The game is a Dungeon Crawling RPG. A genre I am a big fan of although most of my appreciation comes from more “modern” entries such as later Etrian Odysseys and Labyrinth of Refrain/ Galleria, whereas this game aims more for old-school SMT. 

You play as Sumireko and amass a collection of clones of Touhou characters known as sleepers to explore dungeons and figure out why these clones are showing up in the first place.

[h2]Pros:[/h2]

- The core combat is very strong. Providing a strong selection of options while offering a good degree of challenge alongside it. Skills and equipment at your disposal have a good degree of variety from raw damage to more supportive or specialised ones that interact well with each other.

- The Presentation is great. The art is lovely and the soundtrack has a very healthy variety of music across the whole game. Special mention to the multiple standard battle themes that are personal favourites.

- The levels of customisation of both Sumireko and your individual sleepers was a lot of fun to work with. Sumireko can be built however you like as you have full control over her stats and she only learns new skills by taking them from other sleepers (personal recommendation: take mimic). The same applies to sleepers themselves who can transfer any non SP skills to each-other. SP skills can be transferred via fusion so with a bit of legwork you can bring any skill you want with you for as long as you like (Spiritual healing being a personal favourite for the entire game)

[strike] I took Cirno through the whole game and gave her the infallible ice fairy technique of setting herself on fire to make herself stronger. [/strike]

- Hijacking is a fun twist on the usual talk option of SMT that rewards skill in micro bullet hell sections. Even allowing you to punch up a good deal above your level if you are good enough at them. For those who don’t like the system there is an option to replace it with a stat dependent random chance.

[h2]Cons:[/h2]

- Dungeon design and navigation is mostly solid but could be better. Gimmicks aren’t all that interesting if there even are any and the later you get there are more that are just mazes with more dead rooms than ones that do anything. The full discovery bonus is a great idea, rewarding thorough exploration but it gets more tiresome as dungeons get more bloated or require multiple reruns to get the full discovery.

- The Mechanics of fusion itself are also rather odd. With how the grouping appears to work, there are a decent chunk of fusions that you will never come across until you are significantly past the point where that sleeper would be useful in combat. [Spoiler] Lily White comes to mind as a mid game encounter that you can’t hijack but you don’t get the sleepers needed to fuse until near enough the end of the game; sadly this applies to most of the fusions that you never encounter in the wild otherwise. [/Spoiler]

- A relatively minor but constant issue: The Terminal Interface is far more inconvenient than it should be for fusion. You can’t check stats/ moves of the sleepers you want to fuse directly from the fusion menu and unlike the interface for sacrifice or skill transfer, there is no image of the selected sleepers. Only the end result. To check the stats of your party you have to back out of the fusion menu and head to the specific menu just for your stats. 

Despite a few minor hiccups I had a great time playing this one. Would recommend it to anyone who is a fan of the genre or wants to give it a try. The game is also very approachable to those not really that familiar with touhou so don’t let that deter you.
总体玩下来比较一般；符文卡设计了不少，但是掉落的就那么几张，给人一种没内容的感觉；玩多了就发现重复感较强； | One of my favorite Deck Builder Rougelikes. I would absolutely recommend this game to anyone who likes this genre of games.

I absolutely fell in love with this little gem of a game the moment it booted up. There is so much style, from the art direction to the sound design to the characters and world. It may be short, but the time you enjoy spending in the world is worth the price of admission, especially on sale. The gameplay is pretty basic, exploration and platforming, finding secrets and upgrades while tagging up the place with spray-paint. It's the funny quips of dialogue from odd characters, the cartoonish vhs aesthetic, and the outrageous world itself that keeps you coming back for more.

side note*

The amount of horrified looks I've gotten from the friends I've dragged into playing this with me fills me with great joy. 

I bought CHKN while it still cost money in Early Access, and I don't regret it even now it's free. For how unsettling the creatures can be, it's charming in it's own way and the creativity with the creature-building is limitless! 

I would've loved to see this game developed further, but even as it is, especially now that it's free, I'd highly encourage you to give it a go if you enjoy open-world survival games, don't mind not having a strong directive while running around a sandbox-style world, and want to mess around with beautiful abominations of creatures (that you can also pet!)

The legacy version is also available to play if you change it in the game's properties within your library; I found this one a lot smoother in terms of gameplay and also features some more animals that didn't make it to the current version such as giraffes! 

And the best part? It's got great multiplayer support, so you too can drag your friends into surviving in this weird and wonderful world! | SO COOL the old one is good i wished you stayed with the old one | soon

Neat little game, marred by some pretty annoying design decisions.

Gold doesn't need to despawn. It forces the player to play a certain way, which is never a good idea in my book, at least.

Having mobs spawn behind you when you're backed into a corner of the map feels very cheap. Happens quite often.

Final bosses come off as pretty lazy. Both Countess and Cursed King spam huge AoE's that hit for most of your HP bar. | 寝れなくなるかと思った！
EAということで他の方のレビューも参考にしつつ、自分の好みのジャンル要素の集合体だったので購入。

ガンシューティングFPS、ローグライク、ハクスラ。実際に購入してプレイしてみると、思った通り何度死んでも周回スタートしてしまいます。何度も死ぬのがデフォで、持ち越し強化要素を積み重ねて、進行度を進めていきます。このあたりがストレス少なく進められるのが良し。

スキルなどについての細かな部分への説明が少々少なく、また少し言葉足らず感があり理解が薄くなってしまうが、やっているうちに理解してきます。日本語ローカライズは他のレビューにあるようにわかりにくいが、これも特段問題ではないです。

個人的な要望を挙げると
・プレイ難易度を上げたり、ゲーム進行に伴う難易度アップをどのように具体化してあるかというと「エネミーの出現数とそのHP」を増やしてあるのですが、一気にその二軸ともが極端に上がる感じがあり、もうすこしシームレスにしてほしい。
・FPSを多くプレイする自身として少し寂しいのが、ヘッドショットと距離減衰の概念がないところ。特にヘッショが無いのが残念。これらの概念を搭載してもらって、その上で武器構成やスキル構成などを構築してもらえれば、もっと奥深く楽しめそうに思い要望としたいところ。

ただこれらはあくまで要望で、きっちりと死んでも周回ループにさせてくれるので、私と同じような感覚の持ち主にはおススメなので、ぜひプレイを。 | needs a lot of work like better sensitivity settings and to make curtain abilities more less over powered and weaker abilities more worth it. and make very thing more smother like the enemies are very jumpy and like shooting big rats in a small maze.

Genres: Action, Adventure, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play
Reviews:
Jogo se torna repetitivo, sistema de runas veio pra desmotivar os jogadores casuais, publico toxico. | Oyunu biraz oynadım ve sanırım artık incelemeye başlayabilirim.

Oyunu öncelikle pvp amacıyla oynamak için gelen arkadaşlara tavsiyem direk, uzak durun. oyunda sadece zerg savaşı ve tecavüz var. solo oyuncunun bu oyunda yeri yok.

Oyunda grind bitmiyor malesef, evet biliyorum kore yapımı oyun grind üzerinedir ancak bu oyunda grind'dan pvp'ye yönelemiyorsunuz.

Oyunda optimizasyona gelirsek patatesten hallice, optimizasyon denen birşeyin varlığından haberleri bile yok.

Exploit, bug kısmında allaha emanet takılıyorlar, oyun başından beri hala düzeltilmeyen buglar mevcut ve işin komik kısmı bunları düzeltmek yerine sansürlüyorlar.

Oyunda akıcı bir pvp malesef yok, pvp yapmak istiyorsanız 2 saatte bir gece olmasını bekleyeceksiniz, smalLscale oynayarak pvp'den zevk alıyorsanızda, gittiğiniz yerleri zerglememeleri için dua edeceksiniz.

Oyunun kesinlikle ödüllendirici bir reward sistemi bulunmuyor, tamamen rng ve item için her oyuncu guild liderine muhtaçtır. Oyunda bundan kaynaklı malesef drama hiç bitmiyor, resmen game of thrones'u bu oyunun drop sisteminde dibine kadar yaşayacaksınız, ihanetler, yolsuzluklar, hainlikler...

Oyunda içerik var diyen arkadaşlara buradan sesleniyorum nerede içerik var? oyuna gir dungeonları bitir, adaya git kutu farmla tekrar git dungeonları bitir oyun tamamen bir kısır döngü içerisinde. oyunda ne pve, ne pvp namına bir content malesef yok. rezalet durumda.

Oyuna gelen güncellemelere gelecek olursak tam bir hayal kırıklığı, Oyun aldığı her güncelleme ile malesef dahada boka sarıyor. Güncelleme yapmasalar oyun daha iyi bir halde olacak diyebilirim. Oyuna gelen content tamamen oyuncuyu oyunda tutabilmek adına grind içeriğinden başka birşey değil. Eğlence namına bir tane güzel gelen content yok.

Oyunda p2w kısmına gelecek olursak, oyundaki bu sistemi yumuşatmaya çalışan arkadaşlara gülüyorum. oyunda parayla satılmayan hiç birşey yok. evet arkadaşım gerçekten oyunda parayla herşeyi alabilirsin. DİBİNE KADAR P2W. Balina sömürmek üzerine kurulu bir amazon için resmen darphane.

Oyunda benim için eğlence açısından tek içerik saurodoma'da ara ara yakaladığım smallscale pvp'den başka hiç bir şey kalmadı malesef, Getirdikleri T2 güncellemesiyle ben çok yakında patlayacaklarına inanıyorum, bakalım bekleyip göreceğiz.

Neyse dostlar çok kinlenmişim içimi döküp biraz rahatladım, şimdi saurodoma'da o chestlerimi çalmaya çalışan itlerle savaşmaya gidiyorum. ara ara gelir tekrar burada nefretimi kusarım. | BOT、グリッチ、RMTは基本的に放置で将来性も期待ができません
熟練度やルーンに数ヶ月費やすくらいであれば他をやったほうが良いです
期待外れのアップデートが続き24年末くらいから急に首都やフィールドボスも目に見えて人が減って過疎化を感じます
ギルドレイドも人が居なくて満足に出来ない状況ですが移籍しても続けようというほどのモチベーションすら確保が難しいです | muy buen juego, a los que dicen que es pay to win literal no les gusta farmear con mas de 600 hrs puedo decir que puedes conseguir todo solo jugando haciendo trades por monedas de paga 10/10 | 当たり前のようにランキング上位の外国のギルドがメインキャラでBOT行為をしているのに一切お咎め無し。

BOTやチートがBANされずに放置されているのが抵抗ある人はおすすめしません。

[b]Ich habe soeben "Metro: Last Light" das erste Mal abgeschlossen. Moment, was war das Letzte? Richtig gelesen, mit dem Spiel habe ich auf jeden Fall noch nicht abgeschlossen. Für alle die mit dem Titel überhaupt nichts anzufangen wissen: Es basiert auf dem fiktionalen, postapokalyptischen Metro-2033-Universum des russischen Autors Dmitri Alexejewitsch Gluchowski. Wie schon im vorangegangenen Teil "Metro 2033" schlüpft man in die Rolle von Artjom, einem Bewohner der "Metro". Viel mehr möchte ich eigentlich gar nicht vorweg nehmen, denn man kann sich getrost von der Geschichte einsaugen lassen. Es gibt jedoch, wie bei jedem Spiel das mir persönlich gefällt, auch Skeptiker und Zweifler. 

[b]Für wen ist "Metro: Last Light" eher nichts?[/b]

[i]1) Für Leute, die keine postapokalyptische Stimmung mögen.[/i]
Das ganze Metro-Universum beschäftigt sich mit den Menschen nach einem Atomkrieg, die sich ein Leben in dem Moskauer U-Bahn-System aufgebaut hat. Das ist nicht für jeden etwas. Es gibt Mutanten, wenig Freude und mit der Zeit wirklich beklemmende Momente. Die Stationen, quasi Knotenpunkte und Städte im Untergrund, wirken jedoch wirklich belebt, überall hört man Gespräche (oft mir russischem Akzent) und Musik bzw. sieht den Alltag der Bewohner. Die Umgebung wirkt stets mit Liebe zum Detail gestaltet, es gibt auch beispielsweise nicht (wie bei so vielen anderen Spielen *hust skyrim hust tomb raider hust*) einfach überall Feuerstellen, bei denen man sich fragt, wie sie da hin kamen. Insgesamt spinnt sich eine wirklich dichte Atmosphäre aus Angst und Trauer, aber auch Überlebenswillen zusammen - das schaffen so wirklich wenige Spiele!

[i]2) Für Menschen, die keinen Wert auf Handlung legen und nur durchrennen möchten. [/i]
Wer Metro spielt, sollte Zeit mitbringen. Es ist kein Game für nur mal eine halbe Stunde. Hier werden Geschichten erzählt. Ich habe mich selbst wirklich oft dabei ertappt, einfach nur neben Personen zu stehen und ihren Unterhaltungen zuzuhören. Gelegentlich erhält man so auch nützliche Informationen und kleine Nebenquests. 
Nicht zu vergessen sind die politischen Lager der Faschisten und Kommunisten, welche maßgeblich in der Haupthandlung eine Rolle spielen, die wirklich bedrohlich wirkende Grundstimmung, die brutalen Vorgehensweisen der Extremen und die schonungslose Gewalt. Metro: Last Light zeigt mitunter wirklich Dinge, die man vielleicht nicht sehen möchte und kann so auch als kleines Mahnmal in der Spielelandschaft stehen. Man muss darüber nachdenken und reflektiert spielen, wer von einem Abschnitt zum nächsten rennt, wird nicht viel "mitnehmen".

[i]3) Für Singleplayer-Hasser.[/i]
Capture-the-Flag in U-Bahn-Schächten? Nein danke. Ich bin wirklich froh, dass 4A Games und Deep Silver konsequent einen reinen Singleplayer-Titel produziert haben. Ja, es soll noch ein Multiplayer-Part in DLC-Form nachgeliefert werden, aber bei der Geschichte stand ein Glück das Einzelspieler-Erlebnis im Vordergrund. Wer nur Kämpfe gegen andere Personen will, kann sich also Last Light klemmen und getrost zu anderen Genre-Vertretern greifen.

[i]4) Für "Hobby-Rambos".[/i]
Wie so oft steht man bei Metro vor der Wahl: Ja man kann alles niedermetzeln, durchrennen und pure Zerstörungswut walten lassen. Es wird bloß wie so oft wirklich schnell langweilig. Ein Glück hat man noch andere Möglichkeiten: Ich habe in alter Sam-Fisher-Manier meine Schleichskills ausgepackt, Lampen ausgeschossen (oder natürlich herausgedreht...), Gegner abgelenkt und... ach man es ist oft so verdammt schwer! Leider haben bei mir in echt stets einige Personen das Zeitliche segnen "müssen". Es ist jedoch auch anders möglich (und verändert sogar maßgeblich das Ende) und wie gesagt: Mein nächster Durchgang kommt demnächst, schließlich will ich da noch ein Achievement haben!:

[i]5) Für Charakter-Skiller und Hoch-Levler.[/i]
Nope, hier ist man verkehrt. Keine Skilltrees, kein "Level Up". Das ist aber wirklich gut so, es würde einfach die Stimmung kaputt machen.

[i]6) Für Leute, die keine Shooter mögen.[/i]
An sich hätte ich gedacht, dass man es nicht genauer erläutern müsste, aber man kann wie gesagt Last Light spielen, ohne Leute (bis auf ein paar Ausnahmen) töten zu müssen. Ebenfalls ist es möglich, Gegner durch  einen Hinterhalt zu betäuben oder zur Not Wurfmesser zu verwenden. Konflikte mit Schusswaffengebrauch lassen sich dennoch nicht ausnahmslos vermeiden, spätestens die NPCs werden darauf nämlich keine Rücksicht nehmen.
Übrigens: Es gibt vergleichsweise wenige Waffen, aber die vorhandenen spielen sich alle wirklich unterschiedlich - auch meiner Meinung nach ganz anders als bei einem Battlefield oder Call of Duty.

[i]7) Für Leute, die gerne Screenshots machen.[/i]
Naja.. okay der Punkt stimmt einfach gar nicht. Das Problem ist nur, dass Metro einfach von einem Foto-Moment zum nächsten eilt. Die Entwickler haben mit der Welt wirklich ganze Arbeit geleistet, was zur Folge hatte, dass ich die ganze Zeit herumging und Screenshots machte. | 這遊戲是我之前貼吧被ROLL中的一個禮物，無聊下載下來玩兒玩兒。
聽說這遊戲很燒顯卡  我電腦780M顯卡開最高效除了在營救俄羅斯基友那一章的一段劇情噸卡了下 其他都很流暢
故事設定在被核戰摧毀的世界中，原本以為這是一款純突突突變種怪物的 玩兒下來才發現還包含還有很棒的潛入劇情
遊戲充斥著著人與人之間背叛 殘暴 冷酷的一面
畫面一直比較陰暗 所以讓人覺得略壓抑 不過畫面的精細讓人能夠感受到開發商的誠意 
有人說这游戏恐怖 但是我覺得完全不呢 噁心是有點兒但不覺得恐怖 
BTW 我喜歡用噴子爆怪物的頭 嘻嘻~~ | [b]Metro: Last Light is a light that burns twice as bright but does not burns half as long[/b]
 
	4 years ago, Ukraine based developer [i]4A Games[/i] released [i]Metro 2033[/i], pleasantly surprising many gamers and critics with the richly eloquent and immersive ambience of the [i]Metro[/i] experience. While the game was far from perfect, the community nonetheless basked in the distinct Russian flavour of the setting, characters, and outlook represented in its post-apocalyptic world, passionately adapted from [i]Dmitry Glukhovsky’s[/i] novel of the same title.

	In [i]Metro[/i], the metaphorical strife of humanity against its darker, self-destructive nature were often presented in true, unyielding gritty terms. Depictions of huddled humanity striving against the desolation of the new world, not for survival but for the basic sense of normality and security were disturbingly overlaid with images of violent fanaticism and unforgiving death. Death by the creatures of the new world and by left and right winged fanatics.

	As a highly cinematic game, based on a series of novels, [i]Metro: Last Light's[/i] meat is in the story. Almost the entirety of my commendation for this franchise originates from the story-driven experience, so discussing the way in which the story is told seems like the most appropriate place to start. The game prioritizes on the human experience as the lead method of story telling, making it a unique and enriching experience. From the very beginning in which the series’ protagonist, Artyom, awakens to his call to adventure, it is abundantly clear that an intricate level of attention has been dedicated to detail that could only hope to be achieved by a group of developers with a genuine love for their subject matter. Extremely excessive yet altogether human interactions, like the ability to play your musical instruments, or turn off the room lights before moving out, build a sense of empathy by allowing the player to project very normal impulses onto the first person perspective. Every time you find yourself in a surviving human settlement, there are a myriad of opportunity to take a break from the violent chaos of the unforgiving new world and listen to the personal stories and woes of the Metro survivors; All told in richly voiced and detailed animated discussions. These little things add depth and immersion to [i]Metro: Last Light[/i], all the while giving an insight of the life in the Metro. Even when you are out on your own traversing the wastelands, the bulk of the game’s survival mechanics are built around an immersive sense of physicality. For example, players will need to manually replace their gas mask filters, charging their kinetic powered torch light by using a pump and wipe dirt and mud from their visor.

	The rich and detailed story is well accompanied by the breathtaking beauty of the game's graphics engine and art. The level of gaming design provides an ultra-realistic environment gives the player the added advantage of situational awareness. For example, tracking enemy numbers and movement by merely observing the shadows cast on the walls. Players will be able to traverse the underground Metro stations, both surviving human settlements and settlements which did not survive an attack by the creatures of the new world. Players will also be able to witness the quaint, post-apocalyptic beauty of the nuclear wasteland of what once was Moscow, the Red Square and Saint Basil's Cathedral.

	The gameplay is fairly straight forward and linear. The linearity of the game is well executed as it stays focussed on the story and tasks at hand, not deviating too much from the imperative nature of Artyom's mission. However, the game does allow room for exploration and rewards you for doing so. Such rewards include ammo, gas mask filters, and even new weapons. The combat system is very interesting because you are given a choice in play style. One way to play it is like a typical modern shooter with guns blazing. A ton of arsenal is still at your disposal. From the pre-apocalypse Kalashnikov rifles, to Metro engineered shotguns and submachine guns. The game also allows weapons customization like adding silencers, laser sights and weapons optics. However, it should be noted that ammo is very scarce in the Metro, so tactical approaches to any combat situations are a must, adding another level of realism into the game. Another way to play it is by sticking to the shadows like a ghost as you pass through enemy settlements. This is the way I recommend playing the game because it will grant you more instances to stop and listen to the characters' stories and gain further insights to life in the Metro. It will grant you a heightened sense of satisfaction and accomplishment at the end of your journey, should you choose to play it this way. However, there will be instances where you cannot sneak past the enemies, but this is where it gets interesting, because you are given to choice to either slit the enemy's throat or just knock him out. Do you think there is already enough death and suffering in the Metro? Or do you think the wicked should be cleansed from the new world? The choice is entirely up to the player.

	[i]Metro: Last Light[/i] possesses a wealth of passion for its subject matter that is promising for the future of [i]4A Games[/i]. Playing it is like reading a book, written in the first person, where the author uses incredible and poetic descriptive language for every little thing that the protagonist encounters. In a world that is filled with misery and death, it is up to the player to decide if Artyom should add more misery and death to the world, or to salvage the last remnants of good in the wreckage of humanity. [i]Metro: Last Light[/i] does not want players to just enjoy the combat (or stealth), but also to learn something, to feel something out of it. What you ask? I think it wants us to question the human condition and ponder about the value and meaning of our lives before we inevitably succumb to our destructive nature. | Хорошая игра с хорошей графикой и интересным сюжетом. Конец игры полностью зависит от ваших действий в игре и рассчитывается из совокупности плохих и хороших поступков. Прошел оба раза, посмотрел обе концовке, советую всем пройти.

A good game with good graphics and interesting story. The end game is totally dependent on your actions in the game, and is calculated from the set of good and bad actions. Passed both times, looked both end, advise everyone to play. | Metro Last Light is often overlooked but it’s definitely one of the best games of the year.
 
Set in a post-apocalyptic Moscow which was destroyed by nuclear war. A small handful of the population managed to seek shelter in the subway tunnels beneath the city. Twenty years have passed, the world has become inhabited with mutants and the surviving population has broken up into various factions.
 
Featuring a strong narrative and great pacing, Metro will keep you immersed the entire time. The story is told through eyes of a ranger named Artyom and not through irritating and pacing-breaking cutscenes like a lot of other games. Journal entries can also be found and Artyom serves as a narrator who often talks about the events unfolding around him.
 
It’s the direct sequel to Metro 2033 but playing the first title isn’t required to enjoying the game.
 
Metro Last Light tries to do a bit of everything, it’s primarily a first person shooter but it incorporates stealth elements very well. It also feels like a survival horror at points and can be quite tense when you venture out onto the irradiated surface with a gas mask. The audio is great and the screams of mutants in the distance will always keep you on the edge of your seat. There is a fairly large variety of enemies which are all hideous, unique and well done.
 
The atmosphere is amazing, same with the graphics. It’s worth noting that a somewhat powerful computer is required to running Metro Last Light. I was able to run the game at 1920 x 1080 on Very High at around 70FPS average with an Intel i5 3470K Processor, 16gbs of RAM, and an Nvidia GTX 560TI. I have heard that the game does have some issues with certain ATI cards though which can be fixed by turning off Physx in the settings.
 
Metro Last Light also has multiple endings and plenty of re-playability. It may appear linear early on but it quickly branches out later allowing plenty of room for exploration.
 
For a more detailed review, here’s a video my friend and fellow reviewer Trent uploaded:
 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XsPrciV5i2U
 
Metro Last Light also managed to make our Top 35 List for the best games of the generation. If you’re interested in seeing how it measures up, check out:
 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=196432004


If you enjoyed this review, feel free to follow me as a Steam Curator: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/4886473/

Genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Strategy, Free To Play, Early Access
Reviews:
[b]Como o jogo vai entrar em estado de beta aberto amanhã decidi escrever essa análise para esclarecer algumas coisas para players antigos que estão receosos de voltar, e também para players novos não caírem nas desinformações que muitas pessoas estão contando por aqui. Eu amo esse jogo e quero que ele dê certo. ESSA ANALISE SERÁ LONGA kkkkk[/b]

Primeiramente queria dizer que tenho muitas horas no Smite 1. Juntando o tempo de Level UP, launcher original e Steam devo ter umas 7k horas de Smite. Então acho que tenho propriedade para escrever o que estou escrevendo aqui. 

O jogo está em um estado muito bom apesar de estar em alfa. Está com qualidade de game beta há uns meses, já. Em todos os aspectos: gameplay, balanceamento, gráficos, etc. Creio que eles ainda não haviam declarado beta por conta da falta de personagens e de cosméticos no jogo, que apesar de ser um problema, eles resolveram BEM rápido e com muita qualidade. Quem jogou Smite 1 sabe que nos últimos anos toda atualização que lançava, o servidor tinha que cair mais mas 5 vezes para eles conseguirem arrumar todos os bugs horrendos que vinham junto. As atualizações de Smite 2 chegam e simplesmente funcionam, mesmo o jogo estando em alfa. E isso é o motivo de um Smite 2: a engine. Smite 1 era programado na Unreal Engine 3, que é uma engine de 2004. Na época que Smite 1 começou a ser desenvolvido, ainda era a "engine do momento". Porém com o passar dos anos, a engine já não suportava as mecanicas e funcionalidades novas que o jogo precisava, então os desenvolvedores de Smite precisavam cada vez mais fazer "gambiarras" no código do jogo para que ele fosse evoluindo. Algo que não é nada saudável pro jogo. Por esse motivo o jogo foi ficando cada vez mais bugado e cada vez que uma atualização lançava o jogo todo quebrava. Resumindo, refazer o jogo em uma engine nova foi completamente necessário para que o jogo continuasse a evoluir. 

Falando dos pontos positivos do jogo até agora:

[list]
 [*]Eles estão trazendo 50 deuses já pro beta aberto, contando com 3 deuses completamente novos para o Smite 2, e todos funcionam MUITO bem e estão bem balanceados. Isso é um ponto super positivo levando em consideração o tempo em que o jogo está sendo desenvolvido. 
 [*]Os gráficos do jogo evoluíram muito desde o primeiro alfa fechado. E já mostram uma boa evolução do Smite 1.
 [*]A otimização também está em um estágio aceitável, e a cada patch eles melhoram ainda mais.
 [*]A gameplay está bem fluída, você não se sente mais "preso ao chão" ao fazer ações e os novos itens ativos trazem grande parte dessa leveza. O jogo está bem divertido
 [*]Os deuses estão ainda mais versáteis com o novo sistema de Aspectos, que modifica uma ou mais habilidades dos deuses para fazer eles jogarem de uma forma completamente diferente.
 [*]O mapa de conquista conta com objetivos mais preciso em relação ao 1, os junglers sempre têm algo pra fazer no mapa e as teamfights são mais localizadas. Nada de ficar buscando TF no mid só porque não tem objetivos pra disputar kkkk
[/list]

Pontos para se melhorar:

[list]
 [*]A otimização do jogo ainda precisa de melhorias
 [*]Alguns deuses ainda não possuem Aspecto, mas isso já está sendo trabalhado
 [*]Precisamos de itens mais generalistas ou híbridos para acompanhar a versatilidade que o jogo está propondo


Falando agora sobre as gemas. Fui roubado? Perdi tudo que eu tinha no Smite 1? NÃO! Cada gema que você gastou no primeiro jogo, sendo gema paga ou gema adquirida de graça, virá para sua conta do Smite 2 em forma de "gemas legado". Quem comprar o pacote de fundador receberá o dobro dessa gemas. Qualquer skin que existia no Smite 1 e for portada para o Smite 2 pode ser comprada usando gemas legado. A empresa já confirmou que trará mais e mais skins legado para o Smite 2. Além disso, você pode usar as gemas legado para pagar 50% do valor de praticamente qualquer coisa do jogo, como novas skins e passes de ascensão (que são os passes de maestria dos personagens). 

O jogo ainda tem muito o que melhorar mas já está muito divertido de jogar e as mudanças foram necessárias para que o jogo que a gente ama continuasse a existir e crescer. Então pare de ficar espalhando desinformação pela internet, isso só afasta novos e antigos jogadores.

 | CEO of the studio that is developing SMITE2 killed it off. Cancelled the future of E-sports after an incredible launch tournament, layed off 50+ developers who were all large parts of the community, and furthermore deleted their twitter so they dont see any backlash. Unfortunatley SMITE 2 will be dead for the forseeable future unless it gets bought out by a passionate studio that actually loves the game, or if the current CEO steps down and is replaced by someone who is able to recover the dumpster fire. Unfortunatley it doesnt seem likely that it can be recovered at this point. Makes no sense to develop and play a competitive online game without anywhere to compete. I have loved SMITE as a franchise since I was 12, and have been playing it for over half of my life at this point, but it seems like this is the end. If you havent played and are wondering if you should give it a shot, maybe try another game with a better studio behind it. | Game is in a much better state then it was when they horrifically rushed it out the door in August. Played it off and on since then and it's slowly getting to the point it feels like an actual successor to Smite 1. They still have a good bit of work to do, fixing bugs/jank, balancing in general, but its mostly refining core concepts they have mostly got locked in by now. Most negative complaints are people complaining they don't get every single cosmetic they had in Smite 1, but they're actively trying to make up for it while still making enough money to stay afloat, so it's something. My most major complaint is the total lack of in-game moderation recently, hopefully it picks up soon. Otherwise, I'd say it's worth just to mess around with and try to have fun. | Giving Bungie a run for their money when it comes to crappy executive leadership. Great job laying off your most vital team members 👍 | The game isn't finished or perfect but it is heading to the right place and the developers care and are listening.

Everything else requires DLC that cost almost as much as the base game . | 剧情：约等于无

Если ищете Цивилизацию но по вархаммеру -  проходите мимо. Здесь все-все-все заточено только на войну(и это плюс игры, как игры по wh40k). Но сама война не очень то и интересна. Не хватает динамики, хотя на промо материалах кажется что прям ВАУ! А на деле бесконечный неспешный гринд нейтралов. Убрать из этой игры вселенную вархаммера и получится... ZEPHON

За 150р по скидке - отличная игра и даже могу рекомендовать. За фуллп-прайс еще и со всеми ДЛС - ну такое себе удовольствие. | Каждая компьютерная игра существует только для того, что бы украсть твоё время — самый ценный ресурс, который есть у каждого человека. Вместо самореализации тратить своё драгоценное время на жизнь в вымышленных мирах, не имеющих к нашей жизни никакого отношения — это достойно звания «Человека». Подобно наркоману, гоняющимся за выработкой мозгом гормонов. Безусловно это внесёт несоизмеримый вклад в развитие научных направлений и самого человеческого вида. Поэтому да — это игра стоит того,  проебать своё время и выбросить на помойку свою жизнь, став пылью на дороге истории, по которой пройдут более достойные потомки человечества нежели ты. Подобно рабу, прикованному цепями к своему месту, ты привязан к событиям, миссиям, «достижениям», и стал придатком своего компьютера (большой палец вверх) | I recommend this solely cause it was free at the time I got it.

I like both, Warhammer and 4x games. However, the depth isnt there anywhere near the level I expect from a 4X game, while on the other hand, the action isnt as high paced, as I would want it from a Warhammer game.

Aside from that, its not terrible. Just not good either. Which sadly already puts it in the top 10% of Warhammer games I guess.
I payed for this piece of shit only for them to fuck up the code and make another game...

Genres: Action, Adventure, RPG, Strategy, Free To Play, Early Access
Reviews:
I'm leaving this review as somebody who hopes this game makes a comeback after fixing it's flaws.

What I liked:

-PVE is great, it feels rewarding in higher tiers and helps you escalate in lower ones
-Melee combat is fantastic, it feels fluid and has enough fexibility during the first stages

What they must improve:

(also add infinite ritual levels) | +Cool aesthetics and idea
+SFXs are pretty neat

-Feels extremely unfair; e.g. you might get a wave with an armored enemy that you cannot damage -> not enjoyable
-Music | I respect the vision (and love Buggos), so I'm giving this a tentative "recommend". It's a simple yet somewhat engrossing management game with some unique flavour (hearts, lungs, livers, intestines.. oh my!). That said if there's one unforgivable sin in this game it's not amassing an army of undead, or supporting the friendly neighbourhood demonologist, or casual kidnap, or even condoning (extremely lucrative) grave-robbing -- it's UI.


## Gameplay

What you're essentially doing is going through the menu same screens over and over in order to manage your town. Each day consists of three phases -- Town (spend resources), World (gather resources), Battle (mainly watching zombies & demons flail for a bit). Each day takes a minute or so to get through, less as you get experienced I'm sure.

In the town there are various vendors to talk to, mainly the friendly priest who will help you source superior zombie parts. You can also arm your zombies, and there's a relic system for global upgrades. Click - click - click.

To gather resources, you assign zombies to roles: Worship for energy, dig for iron, kidnap for peasants, etc. Each activity is influenced by a zombie stat -- iron = luck * multiplier. Multipliers are randomised so some strategy and opportunism is present, not a bad little system for keeping you on your toes. Unfortunately, while you can sort zombies by stats they all look the same so it's a little bland.

The battle portion is OK. As soon as you start gearing zombies you'll really wish you could permanently rearrange them so that the crossbow is in the back, tank is in the front, etc. It doesn't seem to matter if they die here, you'll still get loot. Just so long as they don't all die. Die? Anyways it's fairly boring. Given the previous entry in the developer's history, the RTS-lite Buggos, I had hoped for a more engaging battle system. Instead of a top-down zombie horde (which would have really facilitated scale), you have a 2D (think Darkest Dungeon, but auto-battler) conga line of zombies where only the front-most melee toon attacks each other. So everyone is kinda just piled up behind one another watching a zombie smack a demon and vice versa. Gear changes this a little, but the formula is overall bland imo. Woe betide your first encounter with a regenerating demon.

Also worth mentioning that progression is of the rogue-lite flavour so you are expected to play through repeatedly from scratch with some meta-progression. Increasingly powerful enemy waves will decide if you've managed your resources effectively enough to survive.


## UI Gripes

There's a lot of manual interaction going on where ideally it would be automated. After the first couple of zombs which were crafted with much consideration, I realise I more or less just want to pump a specific stat for each to maximise resource multipliers. This really exacerbated the sense of tedium and lack of impactful gear & item choices. My suggestions:

* There should be filters and sorts for body parts in the shop and inventory.
* The browse zombie screen needs to be fleshed out for easier (and ideally prettier) viewing & stat breakdown.
* Everything should be 1-click -- add & remove parts with 1 click. Making and managing zombies should have their own UI instead of being glommed together. It's quite rare to create new zombies compared to upgrading existing ones, so prioritise that please.
* For the sake of all that is unholy please remember what position in the conga line my zombies were placed in yesterday!


## Conclusion

For the most part, I like the vision. If I could whiz through the UI with minimal fuss this would be a pretty good chill game, however as is the fiddlesome menus bring down the whole experience. In my opinion the auto-battler phase needs the most love, and I know the dev is capable of making great simple combat systems. I have a lot of trust in the dev to keep improving the game, which factors significantly in my positive recommendation. Go you Intrepid Marmot, go!

It's a very repetitive gameplay loop but if you have any friends or like to be competitive it just  might click with you. It's kind of addicting trying to get a new highschore or even just push the bounds of what is possible. You get to select the difficulty as you play - Want it harder? Buy more snakes! The only gripe I have is the continued play after the final day, it doesn't really become "difficult", your upgrades are locked and you fright just one of every snake in the game, continually adding more speed, more health, and more projectiles until you die. However at that point you are usually way overpowered that it doesn't make much of a difference, it quickly turns into just spamming debuffs and then going afk for 5 minutes to the next day completed. It's a fun game mode the first few times but the base game is much more balance as it should be
