One of the (if not THE) original clicker/achievement spam games that began a tidal wave of shovelware games for prospective achievement/trophy hunters. While this is clearly a bad legacy, the good news is that My Name is Mayo is actually not like its progenies, but rather has plenty of inside jokes, self-depredation, and avant-garde aspects that make it - in some infelicitous sense - a "must-play" for most gamers. So in the end while this was the inspiration for a metric tonne of hot garbage (i.e. click the banana once for a billion achievements), the real villains are achievements hunters everywhere, and not this quirky little nut of a game that should be cherished like the little Oppenheimer it is. | I passed My Name is Mayo for 100 percent of achievements in 30 minutes, and the rest of the time I knocked out cards to sell.I recommend it to those who want an inexpensive game for themselves to complete all the achievements. | My Name is Mayo, ist eine Achterbahn der Gefühle, von Fröhlichkeit bis zur Trauer, ich habe alles beim spielen durchlebt.
Das Spiel, spielt man in einer halben Stunde durch. | şöyle oyunlar nasıl olumlu puanlar alıyor şaşıyorum, sol tuş clicker oyunu başka bişey yok | When the gorgeous mayo showed me what was underneath that leopard bikini, gosh damn

You know what ? I was looking for Mahjong, and here I found something to make me glu at the screen even longer. It's Mahjong, but with a story. Lances, caves, boars and mighty elven town guards, with sexy armored bikini. Well, don't get too cocky, here you're doing slooooooow pace story, looooong lasting quests. But remember : it's a Mahjong game, where no frantic nords are running half-naked in snowy mountains and slashing dragons every now and then, hum ? Mahjong. With a story. That's enough for sparing a lot of coffee cups. | Простенькая ненавязчивая игрушка, развивающая внимание.
Но минусы затмевают положительный эффект: слишком мало энергии и монет за выполненные задания = минут на 15-20 в день поиграть без доната, далее надоедает заниматься накопительством. Открыть выпавший сундучок с заработанными бонусами - опять трата энергии, которую, кроме как из доната, взять неоткуда. В итоге, это уже не маджонг, а мазохизм. | It's basically a Mahjong game with an adventure plot attached to it. As you win games, you progress thru the story. It's fun as a time-killer.

Downside is the xp required between levels is pretty big (progress in the game requires a certain level to go further), so you'll be grinding for a while. Unless...which brings me to the next point. It's a pay-to-win game so it's engineered to get you to go to the cash shop. I'd with these FTP developers would try to strike a balance between a  the cash grind and a fun game. Maybe charge a small fee up front then have the gash shop less annoying.

Overall, it's an OK game. I'd recommend it if you only play a few hours a day. | Pelin tarkotus on vain rahastaa, energia tms latautuu liian hitaasti että vois pelata huoletta. Tarkotus on että pelaajalla menee hermo ja ostas sitätätäjatuota. Myöskään "alkuinfon"päällesyöksystä ei tule pisteiä, aivan liianpitkä että pääsee käsiksi optionseihin ja saa äänet pois. Ei jatkoon | Занятное сочетание головоломок с условно-бесплатной игрой, которых много создано для смартфонов. 
Из плюсов: 1) Хорошее исполнение игры, качественные головоломки.
2) Сюжет, хоть и не представляет что-то совершенно новое, интересен.

Минусы: 1) Для совсем комфортной игры требуются денежные вливания.
2) Головоломки однообразны, и не всегда видно усложнение их.
3) Пасьянс раскладывается в локациях, в каждой локации 10 "уровней", в которых меняется фигура, выкладываемая костями. Такое ощущение, что фигура выкладывается каждый раз одинаковым образом, в результате есть уровни, которые можно пройти только используя перемешивание, которое требует игровую валюту или деньги.

То, что на действия расходуется энергия, можно отнести как к плюсам (нельзя просидеть за игрой слишком долго, выпав из жизни), так и к минусам (иногда этого так хочется).

I hate timer routines in games!  If I wanted to watch a clock I'd stare at that for non-enjoyment.  Games with clocking down routine are not fun.  Whomever included that in the development of this clearly had Grey Goo on the mind its annoyingly frustrating.  If there were the option to remove it from the game I'd be welcome to come back to play it but count down timers just don't do it for me.  Also need to clarify what the goal is in confrontations I had to guess whenever coming across an enemy that was a non-kill routine with no clue how to get rid of it so after several attempts I gave up!  Its a fine looking game but the frustration clearly would have wanted a refund REGRETFULLY I CAN'T DO THAT!  I don't know maybe it was that particular level in the game but I'm not trying to put the effort into anymore. | Una lastima que no haya tenido exito.

Lo estoy rejugando ahora y a pesar de sus muchos problemas la diversidad y diferencia entre facciones es muy buena, cada una funciona muy diferente.

Pero las unidades de por si y la estetica (de las unidades, las estructuras estan bien) se siente muy generica.

Ahora por fin tras 15 años, voy a probar la expansion, y justo me di cuenta de que la expansion da totalmente una nueva faccion, aun no la he probado pero por lo que he leido es otro estilo completamente original.

Otra parte quizas buena quizas mala dependiendo de tus gustos, es el hecho de que al parecer gastaron mucho presupuesto en los graficos cgi y escenas de dialogo entre misiones. A mi personalmente me hubiese gustado mas menos dinero ahi pero mas original.

En resumen: Juego genial, que quizas te tienen que forzar en las primeras misiones dado que el argumento parece generico pero hay un twist y mejora muchisimo personalmente.

PROS:
-Gran variedad entre facciones (Cada una funciona completamente distinta)
-Graficos (Para tener 10años el juego aun luce muy bien)
-Originalidad en la idea de la historia

Cons:
-Casi todas las unidades se ven aburridas y/o muy pequeñas para el detalle.
-Historia empieza muy floja, realmente muy floja.
-Comunidad para partidas online inexistente (aunque la campaña da mucho contenido que disfrutar)

Para mi el juego ha valido la pena, y ojala hubiese tenido exito, me gustaria RTS mas parecidos con mas diferencia entre facciones. | Unresponsive, slow and unnecessarily complicated gameplay. Doesn't really feel like a RTS | story gut, UI bisl arg groß ^^ | was pretty fun

Game Name: Learn Japanese To Survive! Hiragana Battle
Reviews:
基本就无理硬记平假名和罗马字…虽然很多视频是这么教…记不住。需要正经的教材为主，组词并且反复听和读。
配乐还是太干扰了（建议关掉），且没有足够的听的部分作为补充。适合看到罗马字能正确发音的人。否则口音会太重了。
没有专门去辨析长得像的。おねれわ、ぬめ、たなを、さち、はほ。

优点是，想要打通关！所以我已经背下来了（大概……） | Good game on the whole but best used with a base knowledge of Hiragana and Katakana already and use the game as a break from the books ( James Heisig remembering the Kana is highly recommended )  like i did otherwise it's a slow and quite difficult way to learn from scratch. Wish the devs had not used the Manga style font for the letters as that's not the easiest way to draw them so adds unnecessary confusion there tbh. | Easy game to pick up to learn Hiragana. Two things I didn't like about this was Leon's character and how some areas had seemingly pointless mazes to pad out the area.

Despite this and the simple story, I had fun learning Hiragana from this and look forward to playing Katakana War next! | I'd say it is a really good game to "gameify" learning Hiragana, but should not be the only method to learn. This should be used while also learning via other methods. 
While great for memorization because you get punished for getting it wrong, mnemonics is usually the favored method. The game does a decent onboarding for learning, but becomes repetitive early on. Players will need to grind out exp on hiragana characters, but the game uses this as a method to continually learn the characters.

I didn't finish the game as it really became pointless once I got the memorization down from other studies. 
The game is also limited by the RPGmaker as some aspects become clunky and lacks QoL features such as a decent UI when fighting.

Definitely use this as a tool to learn along side other methods, but not as the sole tool. It does a good job for early learning, but that's about it. | After finishing the game after 12 hours i am very pleased.

pro:
1. The goal of teaching Hirgana-symbols is achieved.
2. The story is well enough writen to get me motivated to go on until the end. Nothing super creative, but engaging enough.
3. The "beat the symbols"-system made me much fun: If you know the symbols, it's very easy to win - if you don't know the symbols it's very pleasing to "punch the s** symbol into the abyss after trying 5 times, what ist correkt" ;-).
4. The game is charming.
5. The japanese explanation a not that deep. Wich is good, because i found learning the symbols hard enough.
6. The Endboos was well crafted.
7. The soundtrack ist nice.

Con:
1. There are 1-2 mayor bug, thats need a relaod to go on. (Elevator-door). The game seems not to get updates anymore, so you should look in the discussions-section.
2. It's a realy simple game. The explanation of japanese do not go in the deep.

Overall ist a "ok" game, wich gets the job done. For the very low price i can recomment it with a smile. :-)

(with translator helps)
[h1]Negative:[/h1]
Controls and how the character responds to my inputs suck. Sometimes he can't start running on the first try or does it with a delay if he's close to an interactive object. Why? I don't know.
During battles, it literally kills me (but just in the game). The target-assist system always sucks, but if you get punished for targeting the wrong enemy, it makes you suffer because you might not even do it, but you still get punished just because that's how the game works.
The time stop after every hit is... I don't find this a good idea, but okay. The worst part is that you get a longer time stop if you land a "perfect" hit. And that just breaks the whole process. I wanna f**king SCREAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAM how bad it is. Sometimes my character just stands still, literally, while I spam my buttons, even when not in time stop. Maybe it's some "interesting mechanic," I don't know, but it makes everything worse. I wanna cry in that moment, literally.
And I have a problem with grabs, the most powerful action in this game. Just when I want to grab, my character goes into this "AFK" state. Maybe I just can't get used to it, and it's my skill issue, but it's still not intuitive and not friendly.
Narrator is boring.

[b]Spoiler:[/b]
[spoiler]In one scenario, the protagonist was kissed by a cat, but after he was killed, before he died completely, he realized that she loves him. So, okay, what truth did I get? I got the truth that the bunny is a traitor, of course he is, but why did they add the part where she kisses him and confesses her feelings? Just for what? I still need to figure out the truth about her feelings. That's frustrating. This sucks.[/spoiler]
[h1]General things / Neutral:[/h1]
Choices without choices: the problem with every game that claims to have "choices." They never give you real freedom, not even within the "game borders." Thankfully, we have fixed 4 choices for each ending (I don't know about the "truth"), because I don't need to predict my last choice. But still, I can't relate to what it is MY choice and not the protagonist's, because sometimes he does something I don't want him to do. That gives such a frustrating experience. But this is a story about someone else, not me, right? It's up to you, but I don't like it. Honestly, when he does what I want without additional choices, it feels really good. Thanks that this exists, not too often, but still.
Battles aren't hard; they made them similar to a beat 'em up, with the main focus on crowd control.
I didn't find this story is interesting. Like. So-so or even a little worse.
[h1]Positive:[/h1]
Thanks that I don't need to find every chest in the game to get my max-level swords and stones. Thanks that I don't need to grind for them. Interesting implementation of mouse controls where you need to click on the enemy. Lol, it's like playing a point-and-click action game, ha-ha.
And it's so cool that they even added a feature where, if you drop an enemy's shield while flying, it can stagger other enemies. That's awesome! And you can grab an enemy and use them as a live shield. | Não diria que eu aprovo nem reprovo esse jogo. Monótono demais, sem sal. Pra um jogo de escolhas ele é extremamente linear e o fator replay é quase nulo. No entanto, a história é bem feita, os personagens tem carisma e é uma experiência casual divertida. Minha principal reclamação é que não exista um botão de pular diálogos. Eu me apliquei a pegar todos os achievements, mas pra fazer isso é um grind desgraçado, você tem que fazer todos os finais e ver os mesmos diálogos de novo e de novo toda vez, além de matar uma quantidade interminável de inimigos em batalhas exatamente iguais toda vez. Combat could be a little better, but honestly enjoyed tracking down the solution to the problems the characters are facing. | хотелось бы поиграть в продолжение..
т.е. да, эта игра норм)

Would recommend if you got it on sale. It is very much a 'create your own fun' sort of game, rather than having definite goal. However, it feels more like a well polished demo than a full release, and seems to completely overestimate its depth (particularly in Story Mode). The genetics system is quite basic, and you can see every gene your creatures have (unless you're in sandbox and disable it). Mutations are based solely on player input rather than occurring naturally. For a game in which the physical traits of the creatures is the main focus, the creature models are quite underwhelming, even considering the graphical style of the game. If this game had mod support or still received updates I think it would be much easier to recommend it at full price, but it has neither of those things.

Story Mode
Story mode is intended to be a sort of tutorial for new players. The (unskippable) tutorial does a good job of explaining the game, but really didn't need a whole game mode for it. This game mode has several genetic mutations unique to it (I *think* you can get the same genes in sandbox, just not as mutations). Which is a bit of an issue if you want to complete everything in a sandbox world. There are two main goals: get home, and keep a certain gene in your creatures the whole while. The game does not explain how to get home, and it does not point out the unique gene or its significance. I believe the intended way to play is to move to each new island, completely conquer it while adapting your creatures to it, and then move on to do the same to the next island (which you've probably chosen at random). If you choose to play that way, even if you know the fastest path home, don't die and restart, don't lose the special gene and restart - you're going to be spending many hours playing this way. Far too many for what this game has to offer. And you *are* going to die, and you *are* going to lose the gene, potentially *many* hours in to a run. And once you 'win', you get to keep doing what you've been doing this entire time, minus the stress of the special gene. There is also zero customization to this game mode's settings unless you want to use console commands.

Sandbox Mode
Sandbox Mode really illustrates the lack of features and depth of the features the game does have. You can customize what type of island you start on, the genes of your starting creatures, their lifespans, and the resources/animals that spawn. Most of these are an on/off switch, or a slider with a too limited range. A win condition can be set, but your options are very limited. Despite being the 'main' game mode, you are unable to get several mutations (locked behind story mode). Meaning you need to find outsider creatures that have those genes (if that is possible, I'm not sure), and invite them to your tribe. If you wanted to 100% the mutations menu, you're going to have to play Story Mode. I mentioned above that this is a 'make your own fun' game, but Sandbox really doesn't give you the options to make your world just as you want it.

Applying to both of the gamemodes 
It just gets repetitive and boring. Pick food, cut grass, breed, maybe move to another island that may or may not be mostly indistinguishable, die, repeat. And very little other than the breeding is interesting. Even that is shallow - choose two creatures with the traits you want, and if you don't want the baby, drown it. The genetics and mutation menus look a lot more complicated that they really are. As for food: gathering from anything is about the same. It's all about what your creature can gather, not its diet. Hunting is time-consuming and just not worth it unless you have extra creatures with good attack. Predators are dangerous, but you can just run away (or hide, if you clicked the appropriate colors and patterns in the mutation menu and got it to pass down). Moving to another island is risky, and often leads to undesirable creatures staying by berry bushing and harvesting them while everyone else travels. This gets old very quickly. The islands are also pretty bland. Other than a few different creatures and plants, they're mostly the same. Sometimes almost identical. 

Another review said this as well, but: Look at the screenshots. That's what you're playing. That's not a part of the game, that's pretty much all of it. What you see is what you get.

Despite all I've said above, I had some fun with it. I might go back to it in the future, but I doubt my thoughts will change on it. The creatures are interesting and cute, and while the gameplay isn't too complex, it can be punishing if you are unaware of the dangers, take too many risks, or are just unprepared. I haven't run into any bugs, and the game runs smoothly. Once you've figured out the interface, it's quite easy to use. Just get it on sale if you can wait. | Jogo ótimo para passar o tempo.  Mecânica simples e decisões que podem se tornar complexas.
Recomendo. | O jogo é maravilhoso, gostaria houvessem mais atualizações e novidades no futuro, mas o que existe já é mais que suficiente para render mais de 100 horas de jogo. | Cute game idea marred by bad UI.  Multiple tries needed just to move one animal to another spot because it's so hard for clicks to register.  Plus, I don't get the quest interface.  The quests just pile up and I have no idea what's completed or not. | 买雨世界送的，垃圾

Game Name: Destiny's Princess: A War Story, A Love Story
Reviews:
拿到全成就后才来写的测评，看到有伪骨科就进来尝尝咸淡了没想到意外的牛掰，不愧是大名鼎鼎的剧本娘剧情雀氏没的说，cg的古早画风很合我胃口，五个男主人设各有特色，小太郎线有点甜度超标了，个别结局也很有意思，对没错说的就是你脑洞大开的信长be线，魔王与魔女分明才是真正的he吧！但是he线的女主天下也很喜欢，砍死俩家臣那里帅到我了，信长线是自我认为最带感最跳脱，也是女主成长变化最大的一条，女主人设饱满集美貌坚韧有勇有谋于一体，会反思自己会因为把无辜之人牵扯进来而自责，作为公主对百姓也有责任心，在家国大恨面前用自己的方式守护着城池与子民，通篇玩下来最喜欢的居然是女主。。这么清醒的女主真的好棒！ | 这个游戏相当有水准的——虽然是手游+商业化产品。

这个剧本作者功底非常扎实，可以在这种商业化的打发时间的游戏的框架下，展现自己的写作功底——包括但不限于角色塑造、情节的起承转合、故事的节奏感。

有汉化还带肉的神作！
CG也不少，亲亲抱抱果体什么的都有CG。
剧情快进的话正好适合我这种喜欢快速阅读的人，
画面也很清晰( •̀ ω •́ )y | ~自带官中的女性向GAL~

剧情算是我拥有的这个开发商的GAL里最好的吧
另外3部（My Butler、Dangerous Relationship、Office lovers）玩着犯困！！

本作剧情倒是不错，奇幻风格，谜题一个接着一个！
需要攻略所有男主才能揭示全部细节。

这个开发商的几个女性向GAL套路都一样。

序章介绍背景，主线故事选择角色攻略。
每个角色都有正篇 ->后话 -> 约会剧本。
正篇8个章节+两个结局，若干CG。
看完全剧情就全成就。

本作可攻略男主（宠物）5名！！！

趁现在看这模糊胡的文字还能勉强看的清赶紧玩了~
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3373300125
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3373300176
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3373300322

剧情流水账：
主角名字 山田·花子，可修改。
[spoiler] 
序幕：奇迹的开始
开场主角就被男友玲人甩了，说最近要分开冷静一段时间又不给缘由，回到家发现家里的4只宠物全变成人了！唯独乔治没有，宠物们开始争夺主角！

一共5名宠物
阿萨姆（猪猪）：
1、变成人的理由
夜深了，宠物变人开心，被甩难受。
阿萨姆非常人性化地为主角泡茶排解忧愁。
吵闹的早餐时间，阿萨姆、里泽、拉明各种家务，卢哈纳特立独行出门玩，主角本打算帮忙却被阻止最后摸鱼了。
午后带着乔治和阿萨姆散步时阿萨姆说他变成人的原因是想成为主角的恋人。

2、乔治的秘密
主角们都乔治为何没变成人？
学校里告诉沙智主角和玲人分手了，而撮合主角和玲人的结花学姐有种在嘲笑她的表情经过！？

3、疑雾重重
放学路上，阿萨姆和里泽来接主角让沙智很羡慕。
里泽要求选一个人陪主角回家，主角选不出后气愤离去。
路过公园时偶遇神秘男子史哉说主角的“宠物真不错，好好享受吧”的话让阿萨姆脸色铁青表情僵硬！
次日早餐，里泽和阿萨姆吵了起来！依旧是里泽输了···

4、前男友的存在
去补习班打工的回去路上偶遇玲人，对方送主角回去，在公寓门口希望和好却被阿萨姆阻止了。

5、被解放的欲望
主角被阿萨姆强硬地带回房间，因为情绪激动他居然长出耳朵和尾巴了，并想把和玲人有关的东西都丢掉！后来他再也忍不住和主角H了···
次日打工回去的时候和卢哈纳在门口等着主角，并用气场驱离玲人。
回到家时里泽指责阿萨姆昨晚上了主角的情况，他们准备在主角忘记玲人后公平竞争，结果他居然先上了！！
最后里泽说出契约的秘密！

6、契约的秘密
当大家变成人开心得像个傻子一样时，里泽从把他们变成人的史哉那得知一周内没和主角结合的人就会消失···
现在主角选择了阿萨姆，但一定有解决办法的。

7、可疑的男人
主角打算去找史哉询问解决办法，但被宠物们阻止。
但主角刚出门主角就遇到了史哉，对方说出主角的近况并指出错误都在玲人后消失了。
放学阿萨姆和乔治来接主角放学，宠物们都没找到史哉，明天主角也打算帮忙找，毕竟就剩最后一天了。

8、想守护的家人
乔治吃了阿萨姆变成人的最后一刻圣兽丸后不见了！大伙分头去找乔治。
在凉亭中找到和史哉对质的乔治，此时主角们才知晓从一开始乔治就被史哉排除在外，史哉希望乔治好好活下去，可他们是乔治的家人啊。
乔治打算单独解决契约问题并和史哉单独聊聊，大伙回家等乔治的好消息···

奇迹结局：热闹的下午茶时间
乔治回来了，他认为有些事情还是不要知道的太多为好，消失契约解除了。阿萨姆变成人类陪着主角，其他宠物会变回宠物···不过他们每周会有1天变成人形！

喜剧结局：甜蜜的誓言
和奇迹结局差异就是其他宠物变不回人形了。

后话：男友的风度和任性
阿萨姆把主角当公主照顾着，但阿萨姆是情侣耶，是平等的，所以主角不希望他啥都做···
之后就是和阿萨姆约会，逛街，逛公园一起H。

特别剧本：比点心还甜
和沙智一起在外面吃饭得知下周体检要称体重！！
肥家发现自己胖了2kg！开始减肥计划，并在阿萨姆的开导下放下了减肥负担，顺利减肥！！！

卢哈纳（猫猫）：
1、笨拙的温柔
夜深了，宠物变人开心，被甩难受。卢哈纳找排解忧愁。顺带吻了主角。
周一，大家吵吵闹闹地想帮主角排忧解难。
卢哈纳则悄悄拉着主角到达可以一览街区的长椅让主角放松一下，主角想到了玲人没说保持距离的原因且表情比主角还痛苦！！卢哈纳打算帮主角知晓原因。

2、分手的理由
周二，依旧热闹的早餐时间，上学路上偶遇玲人，他依旧不愿意说出原因，但询问了有木有受到恐吓以及似乎是卢哈纳让玲人在这里等主角···

3、幽灵的嫉妒
放学路上卢哈纳和拉明当保镖陪主角回家，原来家里收到了恐吓！
偶遇结花学姐得知玲人前女友小瞳因交通事故狗带了，难道分手原因是这个？
卢哈纳再次将主角带到长椅那确认主角是否从玲人那得知原因，虽然没有知晓原因，但大家陪伴主角也乐观很多。
回到家似乎大伙们都把恶作剧痕迹清理了。

4、真相所在
次日，恶作剧继续，大伙闹哄哄地清理。
这天去打工，回去路上偶遇玲人，对方询问下主角说出了从学姐那得知的情况，玲人激动地认为不是小瞳的原因，主角被说后直接伤心地逃了···

5、第二次亲吻
主角逃到了公园偶遇神秘男子史哉，对方忠告主角不要和玲人纠缠不清···
主角暂时不想回去于是在卢哈纳的长椅那，卢哈纳找到主角得知此事后说会教训他的，并对主角表白并接吻。
次日主角的宠物们找到了恶作剧的凶手结花学姐！

6、犯人的意图
史哉拜托结花拆散主角和玲人，这样结花就能和玲人交往了。主角和小瞳很相像，一开始结花撮合主角和玲人就是希望让玲人意识到小瞳早已不在。
可结果主角关系反而变好了！
后来她看着史哉把宠物变成人！
主角放过结花但心里依旧好奇史哉的做法，于是卢哈纳告诉主角。
史哉把宠物们变成人后告诉宠物主角今天会失恋，这是宠物和主角结合的机会，史哉似乎也希望主角和玲人分开。
但即使如此主角和卢哈纳的关系是真心的···
此时卢哈纳突然变出耳朵和尾巴，并和主角H···

7、决堤的眼泪
这天玲人来主角家道歉，他从结花那知晓了真相。
结花说的都是真的，后来玲人收到小瞳的信感觉自己背叛了小瞳而自责，因此和主角分手，但他对主角是真心的。
卢哈纳激动地赶走了玲人而主角抱住卢哈纳秀恩爱，这下宠物们都知晓主角选谁了，
除了卢哈纳外而其他宠物会重新变回动物，为此他们要制造些快乐的回忆。

8、制造回忆
大伙们做了便当去公园制造快乐的回忆。
此时史哉出现在门口，史哉和乔治似乎很熟悉。
将客人迎进房间才知晓契约即将结束。

奇迹结局：再在这里多一会儿
史哉说让主角们受罪了，为此奉上歉礼。
卢哈纳可以一直变成人，其他宠物包括乔治只有周末才能变成人。后面每个周末都是卢哈纳吃醋时间了。

喜剧结局：睡梦中的恋人
除了卢哈纳外其他都变回了动物。还有卢哈纳日常睡懒觉···

后话：睡眠不足的男朋友
周六，卢哈纳大清早带着主角出门约会，逛街、买东东。不过卢哈纳却犯困，这时候主角想起了猫是夜行动物，晚上H很精神，白天睡觉···
为此主角想要让卢哈纳调整一下慢慢适应。为此在长椅那卢哈纳枕在主角大腿上睡着了···他们都为了彼此做出改变···

特别剧本：专用大腿枕头
从沙智那得知体检称体重，肥家发现自己胖了！开始节食减肥最后在房间门口晕倒了，卢哈纳开导主角后不太纠结体重···

拉明（鹦鹉）：
1、温暖的手
宠物变人让主角感觉很混乱，拉明在大伙们都休息后来主角这安慰主角并亲吻额头。
次日大清早开着宠物们吵闹想起了玲人后很是伤心，拉明看出了主角的情况让大伙都消停一下···
并告诉主角他们放心不下主角于是和史哉签订契约在1周时间内变成人。
拉明陪着主角上学，当主角看到玲人后突然纠结地迈不开步子，于是拉明拉着主角逃课了。

2、作战开始
拉明拉着主角去了公园，为了安慰主角，他想出了做些让玲人吃醋的行为，让主角假装是他女友。
次日拉明说服其他宠物开始主角和玲人的破镜重圆行动。
次日偶遇沙智和阳亮，主角和他们分享了分手、宠物变人、男友作战。

3、真实的心意
这天放学玲人急冲冲询问主角是否有意外并拉着主角想去啥地方时候被主角挣脱了，恰好拉明过来接主角时秀了玲人一脸！
晚上拉明和大伙说计划很成功，此时阿萨姆找了个借口拉着主角去了公园，确认主角对拉明的心意。

4、残酷的忠告
玲人发邮件希望和主角单独聊聊，此时阿萨姆配合主角确认拉明心意，拉明强笑道你看主角还是个孩纸！
在公园玲人和拉明对峙，玲人虽然依旧喜欢主角但却不得不分开，拉明劝说回心转意无效，玲人还从阳亮那得知拉明时宠物的情况并要求拉明消失！
此时伤心又愤怒的主角狠狠地给了玲人一巴掌后哭着逃了···
最终还是拉明追上了主角并给她拥抱。

5、想听到的话语
经过这些后拉明终于意识到主角需要的时他，虽然他也不清楚能维持人类多久···
于是主角和拉明H了，拉明激动地长出了翅膀！

6、死神的诅咒
次日早，拉明公开了和主角的关系，玲人让人失望。
这天玲人让大嘴巴阳亮来主角家告诉主角们宠物时死神，玲人认识的人遇见变成人的宠物狗带的情况！
但主角认为大家都在身边不会是死神！
补习班下班后玲人再次劝说主角，但主角听不下去并希望别再打扰她了···

7、变成人的魔法
这天沙智来支持主角并对阳亮的事情道歉了，还遇到介绍玲人给主角的结花，结花猜测是不是玲人嫉妒才瞎扯什么死神的事情···
为澄清误会拉明打算见见将他们变成人的史哉询问，而史哉立马就出现了并解释了宠物都是爱主人的，不会是主人的死神！
次日里泽不见了，此时史哉来电得知里泽在他那！

8、魔法师的真实身份
史哉要求主角带着大家包括乔治一起去公园。原来里泽跟踪史哉，为此史哉大发慈悲告诉大伙他隐瞒的一些事。
原来史哉之前是叫沙姆的宠物，是乔治的双胞胎哥哥，他被另外位女生领养了。
可惜后来那位女生出了意外，史哉似乎也打算去陪她···
而里泽和史哉似乎有什么特殊的约定，但在里泽的追问下史哉让那个契约失效了！
并询问拉明真正的心意后释放魔法···

奇迹结局：真正的家人
后来除了拉明外的宠物只能在周天变成人。拉明则永久变人了。对，乔治也能变人了。这样每周天都能非常吵闹非常欢乐，拉明也开始准备造人了。

喜剧结局：保护过度的恋人
除了拉明外宠物都恢复原样，然后就是拉明在大街上抱着主角接吻。

后话：无论心灵还是身体
拉明依旧每天送主角出门并接主角肥家，某天看到沙智和拉明一起快乐聊天吃醋了！结果居然是他拿阳亮小时候的事情和她交换主角的情况···于是和好并H了。

特别剧本：恋爱的效果
主角和沙智相约吃饭是得知体检，肥家发现自己胖了要减肥，拉明开始监督主角减肥以及各种锻炼并按摩···

里泽（兔兔）：
1、疗伤的药
这晚宠物变人高兴，分手伤心，里泽过来安慰主角并说一定会让主角忘掉玲人并吻了主角。
次日大清早就吵吵闹闹的，每只宠物都到主角房间看望主角，趁大伙都出去买东西时里泽说忘掉伤痛的办法就是开始一段新恋情。

2、两个花冠
里泽留下纸条拉着主角去公园野餐并睡了一觉，给主角编花环。

3、药的作用
次日早上闹哄哄，主角要上学宠物们不方便去，里泽悄悄跟着主角去学校，卢哈纳和拉明去学校拉着里泽肥家。为此主角破例今天让里泽在校园玩一天。
回去路上偶遇阳亮和沙智，谎称里泽是远房亲戚，这天主角很开心。

4、湿透的里泽
这天早上里泽被大伙嫌弃犯规，虽然主角很开心，但宠物们都是家人不能只为里泽搞特殊。
里泽说了过分的话被主角扇了一巴掌后跑了出去，大伙只好出去找，主角还得去补习班打工只好靠其他宠物。
下课后不管玲人去公园找到了投河失败浑身湿透的里泽，并得到大伙的谅解，毕竟是一家人。

5、冰冷的微笑
次日早上主角梦见里泽离开了，醒来果然里泽不见了！不过乔治似乎知道里泽在哪，大伙跟着乔治找到了希望解除契约的里泽和被请求一脸冷笑的史哉。
原来他们的契约是变成人1周内得到主角，失败的都会消失。
史哉过去悄悄和里泽说了这个，但现在里泽才醒悟大家要在一起作为家人才是最好的，而不是只顾自己···
史哉无奈解除了其他宠物的契约，但里泽的无法解除，不过主角早已爱上了里泽···
当看到主角拥抱里泽时史哉说原来你让其他宠物变回去就可以独占主角了！但未来依旧残酷。

6、无法逃脱的命运
史哉说里泽只有不断吸收主角的生命才能维持人形，一切肢体接触都会导致生命流失。
史哉说出乔治哥哥沙姆和他主人瞳的故事，史哉就是沙姆，瞳没了，为了赎罪他让主角背负起同样的命运。
回家，其他宠物没法变成人形让主角和里泽都觉得寂寞了。次日主角找结花学姐确认了小瞳的情况属实。

7、两人的距离
主角相信一定有解决办法的，里泽一直和主角保持距离，哪怕他已经苍白无力也不愿碰主角，又希望主角陪在身边。

8、奇迹的结局
看着里泽身体慢慢变差主角吻了里泽，果然情况好转了。主角想再找沙姆寻找解决办法，乔治立马汪汪叫着带着主角到达公园，有颗树上长者圣兽丸能让宠物变成人形！
里泽要毁了那树防止其他宠物被影响，烧毁树后史哉出现，随着树木烧毁史哉也逐渐消失，契约也解除了，史哉要去见小瞳了···最后一刻史哉说只要里泽对主人的爱无论怎么接吻寿命都不会减少，因为爱是无穷无尽的···

奇迹结局：不让谁来捣乱
其他宠物包括乔治周天会变成人，里泽永久成人。
每个周天都会很吵闹。

喜剧结局：比甜品更甜的恋爱
里泽恢复了，不过也成了里泽撒娇索吻的新武器！

后话：爱撒娇的小恶魔
里泽发烧主角帮他做饭并喂他吃，各种撒娇。
晚上H后次日主角发烧里泽好了···

特别剧本：爱的回报
和之前一样沙智体检减肥，里泽开始准备减肥餐，各种按摩···体检结果居然轻了！

玲人（前男友）：
1、难以忘怀的人
里泽希望主角忘了玲人和他一起，可主角做不到，于是拉明想帮主角破镜重圆并得到大伙的支持。
次日早上主角去玲人家依旧没要到原因，回家后宠物们都在出谋划策，主角希望忘记玲人却又做不到。

2、不安与期待
这天主角将被甩了的事情告诉偶遇的阳亮和沙智这对情侣，从阳亮那得知他从一周前突然变得怪怪的。
回去路上偶遇拉明，这时候又偶遇似乎在找什么的玲人。
上前打招呼后玲人就开始吃醋了，拉明的吃醋大作战成功！

3、距离的真相
玲人拉着主角到他家指责主角这么快就有男人了！不过最终还是和主角坦白他其实还爱着主角，但一周前他收到了恐吓信说如果不分手珍贵的东东就会消失···
主角告诉玲人宠物变人的情况，当知晓彼此还相爱的情况下他们H了···

4、玲人的决心
次日从玲人家醒来，玲人做饭，取恐吓信，无视恐吓电话，还有门口那···
玲人似乎知道是谁做的，他当心主角那也会有这种情况，不过主角那有宠物们所以不当心，现在玲人打算好好珍惜主角了。

5、不可暴露的秘密
玲人上课主角回家，发现自家门也被恶作剧！
大伙都为主角和玲人和好而好高兴，里泽得知玲人知晓犯人还不给主角看信有蹊跷，他打算去调查。
培训班下班后主角找到玲人希望看信，但他依旧不愿意给主角看信让主角很失望，玲人认为现在不安去希望主角去他家被拒，路上拉扯时候遇到调查出结果的里泽以及后续赶来的其他宠物。
最终玲人说出了实情，

6、来自天堂的信
寄信人是在天堂的玲人前女友小瞳，特意模仿小瞳的笔记做恶作剧，总之玲人不会放弃主角的。
次日恶作剧依旧，于是玲人拉着大伙在校园内联系了犯人结花学姐！
原来小瞳写玲人的名字和叫的名字是不同的！
最终结花说她对不住主角，后面不会出现在主角面前了···

7、圣兽丸
主角和玲人恢复往日情谊，玲人去了主角家，里泽做饭时放了史哉给的额外的1颗圣兽丸···
吃了饭的玲人差点变成野兽，但现在玲人很痛苦！
里泽只放了一颗，对此也非常抱歉并说出了实情。
是幕后主使史哉告诉里泽恐吓信的内情，他一开始就知道主角会分手，里泽只想和主角在一起不惜利用史哉和玲人···
现在后悔了，玲人情况也不妙，大伙准备次日去找史哉。
次日乔治吃了额外的圣兽丸也变成人了，准备一起去找史哉。

8、相联系的秘密
乔治找到了史哉，真相大白了。
史哉是乔治的哥哥沙姆，玲人前女友小瞳的宠物。
契约奇迹只有当宠物完全成为主人的爱人才能完全成为人类，如果一周都没能如愿以偿宠物会消失！
这秘密只和里泽说了。
他也非常爱小瞳，但他输给了玲人，为此他打算自杀却被小瞳救下导致他和小瞳都走了！
现在变成灵魂体被束缚在此，虽然史哉害死了小瞳，但小瞳喜欢的是玲人，为此他不允许玲人开始新生活···
在史哉打算给玲人吃下圣兽丸让其变成动物时候奇迹出现了，小瞳突然出现劝服史哉并带它走了···离开前说玲人要幸福的话···

奇迹结局：最棒的宝物
宠物们都变成人了，玲人也恢复了，这似乎是小瞳和沙姆的礼物。每天都很吵闹，但主角和玲人很幸福。

喜剧结局：向前迈进的两人
宠物恢复成宠物，玲人和主角也更进一步了。

后话：恋人的印证
主角和玲人同居了，早餐，选衣服，约会。
偶遇沙智和阳亮，买戒指，戴戒指，接吻。

特别剧本：两人可以做到的事
一样从沙智那得知体检，体重，开始减肥，大晚上的去公园一个人锻炼，被放心不下的玲人找到了。
成功瘦了2斤···之后被玲人拉着做床上运动来减肥···

 [/spoiler] | Bad writing, music, and flat characters. 
Also to me it feels so wrong to fall in love with your pets....

THIS IS NOT A CORN GAME.

Sweet, simple, cheesy read and I'm eating it all up. Considerably more polished than Kikuya as to the writing & dialogue. However, [b] THE LACK OF CGs ARE A CRIME [/b] (Only 3 to 4...? per route).

I love that the MC is not a doormat, she's considerably bratty at times [spoiler] &  i love the business minded aspect though shallowly put at times [/spoiler]  and her personality differs with each route as opposed to Kikuya's Mary Sue MC that just drives the immersion away.

Anyways, for route recommendations:

Asagiri's route tackles the dynamics of Yoshiwara and the Mc's feelings quite well 

[spoiler] as he basically whores himself out to help MC's family, and MC struggles with seeing her beloved be pimped out [/spoiler].

Props to Asagiri for knowing what he wants, who he is, and being more of a fleshed out character tbh, very refreshing. Also, [spoiler] very steamy route [/spoiler]


Moving forward, Ageha's route is absolutely adorable first romance type of stuff, it felt pure despite the suggestive CGs, which by the way are top tier, Ageha's CGs beat Asagiri's imho. Felt like watching a cute puppy love turned into more.

To end though, one last complaint, or two: IT IS A CRIME THAT MUSASHI DOESNT HAVE A ROUTE, I HAVE A BONE TO PICK WITH WHOEVER MADE THAT DECISION, also, maybe just me idk, but Utsusemi's sprite could have been improved upon :/ . | In 2024, understanding men feels harder than ever. Their tangled emotions and confusing thoughts make it exhausting to respond in a meaningful way. My mind wich is constantly overthinking and trying to make sense of everything, is just burned out.

That’s why I’ve decided to simplify things. Like in technical drawing, I’ll start with the basics—studying “2D men” to figure out how their minds work. Once I’ve got that down, I think I’ll be able to understand “3D men.” more better.

Отличный выбор для любителей головоломок и тренировки мозга 🧠✨. Игра предлагает разнообразные задачи, развивающие внимательность и логику 🔍🤔. Однако 200 уровней могут утомить 🥱, задания начинают повторяться, превращая игру в монотонный процесс 😵‍💫.

史低入还行，游戏时长大概六个小时，互动性几乎没有，主要就是看。背景音乐很丰富，而且与剧情融合的不错，英配非常优秀，感情到位音色贴脸，角色立绘也不错，场景图也很多，吃饭食物甚至有单独的图，这点比较用心，CG水平时高时低，个别崩的厉害，自带的中文翻译感觉有点奇怪，文本字体也好难受，时而斜体时而字间距缩放，[strike]至于补丁……我反正没有打成功，好像看漏了点什么但不是特别影响剧情。 [/strike]

整体来说是轻松无脑的公路片，[spoiler]淘金的部分写的很浅，所以显得很容易，故事主要还是以两位女主的感情发展为主，于是可以看到经典的天降女友+同居的元素，还可以看到玛丽娜卖蠢、安柏咆哮、路人神助攻和爱情保安玛利亚（）。[/spoiler]不可否认作品中对安柏的内心活动描写非常细致，[spoiler]真姬崽在路边捡到傻白甜直女，被其无意的肢体接触撩拨到内心动摇，那种纠结很写实，并且做到了层层递进，[/spoiler]相对而言，玛丽娜的变化就有些无迹可寻。[spoiler]但安柏的精神状态简直演发病时的我，一会儿抑郁一会儿躁狂，剧情的唯一高潮点和冲突也是在两人关系有了实质性突破后她莫名其妙地凶人开始。好拧巴一孩子，能看得出来爷爷在她心目中的重要性了，但这整的像亡爷回忆录一样看得我很累。安柏缺乏安全感，不敢计划和玛丽娜的未来，不认为自己这样的人值得被爱值得拥有幸福，被玛利亚骂醒后终于决定向前拥抱自己的未来，纠结了一路的事情突然一下就想开了（？）[/spoiler]安柏的人设不算讨喜，虽然独立聪明，但情绪不稳定还时而自卑时而自恋，不过比起玛丽娜的人设还是丰满多了，玛丽娜的形象还是没有脱离刻板印象。隔壁三人组也很有意思，每次画面转到他们我都很想笑，安柏与玛利亚之间针锋相对又有点惺惺相惜的感觉。
如果能忍受前半部分的枯燥乏味，那么后面开始就能吃到点甜头了，很喜欢玛丽娜每次喊“安柏”的语调，安柏对玛丽娜的称呼也从“小家伙”——“孩子”——“笨蛋”——“宝贝儿”，从打趣到柔情，看来确实是在玛丽娜毫不吝啬的夸赞和毫不害羞的肢体接触中逐渐沦陷了。借用苔丝的话：“金子总会发光，发光的不一定是金子。”这趟寻金之旅比隔壁黄金百合更黄金百合，如黄金般闪耀的是少女间的情感。 | Новелла отличная. Интересно было читать с первых минут, персонажи веселые и по своему притягательны. Цг и спрайты персов очень хорошо проработаны и красиво нарисованы. Всем советую, кто любит такой жанр | 《Highway Blossoms》是一款别具一格的百合向视觉小说游戏，由 Studio Élan 开发并发行，自 2016 年 6 月 18 日在 Steam 平台发售以来，便吸引了众多玩家的目光。
一、剧情：公路与梦想交织的故事
游戏设定在美国西南部，故事围绕着主角 Amber 展开。Amber 在继承了祖父的房车后，独自在沙漠中徘徊，沉浸在失去祖父的悲痛中，对周围的一切都漠不关心。直到她遇到了在新墨西哥州迷路的年轻搭便车者 Marina，两人的命运从此交织在一起。 一本老淘金者的日记掀起了全国范围的寻宝热潮，Amber 和 Marina 也被卷入其中。在寻宝的旅途中，她们不仅要解开日记中的谜题，还要面对彼此内心的情感纠葛。她们的性格截然不同，Amber 起初较为冷漠、自我，而 Marina 热情开朗，两人在相处过程中不断碰撞出火花，从陌生到熟悉，从相互猜疑到彼此信任，感情逐渐升温。这种细腻的情感刻画，让玩家仿佛置身于她们的世界，感同身受。 游戏中还穿插了许多有趣的支线情节和丰富的角色设定。比如，她们会遇到各种各样的人物，每个人都有自己独特的故事和性格，这些支线情节不仅丰富了游戏的世界观，也让主线故事更加立体。
二、画面：细腻笔触描绘西部风光
游戏画面采用了精美的日式立绘风格，人物形象鲜明，表情和动作都十分生动。特别是角色的服装细节，展现出了制作团队的用心。而游戏中对于美国西部实际地标的宏大手绘场景，更是令人赞叹。以 1080p 的高清细节呈现出沙漠、公路、小镇等景色，仿佛将玩家带入了那个充满神秘色彩的美国西南部。 游戏中的 CG 画面同样华丽细腻，在关键剧情节点，这些精美的 CG 恰到好处地展现出角色的情感和故事的氛围，增强了玩家的沉浸感。比如 Amber 和 Marina 在沙漠中看日落的场景，暖色调的画面搭配角色温柔的表情，将浪漫的氛围烘托得淋漓尽致。
三、玩法：视觉小说的独特体验
作为一款视觉小说游戏，《Highway Blossoms》舍弃了传统游戏复杂的操作玩法，几乎完全以文字叙事和对话选择来推动游戏进程。玩家通过点击屏幕来阅读剧情，在关键节点做出选择，这些选择会影响角色之间的关系以及故事的发展方向 。 游戏还设置了 Easy 和 Extreme 等不同模式，增加了游戏的趣味性和挑战性。例如，在 Extreme 模式中，一些任务和剧情需要玩家花费更多的时间和精力去完成，像 “沙漠巴士成就” 就需要玩家有足够的耐心和毅力，这种独特的设计为游戏增添了别样的乐趣。
四、音乐：为游戏注入灵魂
游戏的音乐也是一大亮点，由众多知名音乐人创作，如 Smoke Thief、Jake A Bernathie、Able Kirby 等。音乐风格多样，完美贴合游戏中不同的场景和氛围。在公路行驶时，播放的是充满节奏感的音乐，让人感受到旅途的自由与畅快；而在情感细腻的场景中，舒缓的音乐又能很好地烘托出角色的内心世界。 音效方面同样出色，无论是沙漠中的风声、车辆的行驶声，还是角色的对话声和情感表达时的音效，都十分逼真，使得每个动情时刻都显得格外真实，增强了玩家在互动体验中的投入感。
五、不足之处
尽管《Highway Blossoms》有诸多亮点，但也存在一些不足之处。部分玩家认为剧情存在一些瑕疵，比如情节走向有些俗套，最后的感情爆发部分由于文化差异，让人不太容易理解。游戏的整体流程相对较短，对于一些追求长时间游戏体验的玩家来说，可能会觉得不够尽兴。此外，游戏性的缺失也是一些玩家诟病的地方，对于喜欢动作、策略等类型游戏的玩家，这款游戏可能无法满足他们的需求。
六、总结
《Highway Blossoms》以其独特的公路百合题材、细腻的剧情、精美的画面和动人的音乐，为玩家带来了一场别具一格的游戏体验。它更像是一部互动式的小说，让玩家在阅读故事的同时，也能参与到角色的成长和情感发展中。虽然存在一些不足，但对于喜欢视觉小说和百合题材的玩家来说，仍然是一款值得一玩的游戏。如果你渴望在游戏中体验一段浪漫的公路之旅，感受细腻的百合情感，那么《Highway Blossoms》绝对不会让你失望。 | I played this game while going through a really dark time in my life.

Ironically enough a girl I have a crush on suggested I play this and between my own relationship troubles and bouts of depression this game really spoke to me, this story is truly beautiful and made me cry multiple times.

I'm not a big visual novel girl but this game touched something in me and it changed my perspective on things, it helped me find beauty in a world that seems so meaningless and through my sadness this silly little game about two idiots falling in love just spoke to me on a level that very few stories have ever done before.

Even while typing this i'm crying, it's such a dumb silly little thing but I found this story at the exact time I needed to find it.

This is probably my favorite visual novel I've ever read :) | 非常有趣和甜甜的公路片

以前玩无敌版的，现在捡回来玩玩，感觉体验比第一部差，好多情况不像一代有固定战法黄绿蓝，那些远程怪都是初生，一个个全都要把射程里的兵杀完再走，然后地面部队畅通无阻地冲刺！冲刺！实在糟心。个人没追求全三星，也全通关了，钢铁英雄没咋碰，除了远程初生外，还是那股味 | Игра очень интересная.В ней очень много пасхалок и отсылок, главный минус уровни ОЧЕНЬ растянутые как и локации. | игра хороша не хуже первой части но и не лучше зато тут лучники не такие бесячий но есть ебаные черви они в два раз хуже заебался и за них проёбывать | Pour un jeu casu, je le trouve équilibré de façon très précise.
Et cela me plait autant que cela me déplait.
Je m'explique.

En difficulté vétéran, et sans utiliser les consommables.

Dès le milieu de carte, le jeu nous fournit des ressources au compte goutte.
Les ressources que l'on obtient au début d'une vague, on en a besoin pour la fin de la vague.
Ce qui est très bien, d'un point de vue tactique, il faut bien gérer ses ressources.
Le problème étant que, sur les derniers niveaux, ça en fait un jeu d'apm.

Notamment sur le tout dernier, la composition, je l'ai trouvée, arrivant vague 15 sans perdre de vie..
Et je perds parceque j'ai pas été assez réactif.
Je recommence.
Et en faisant le même build order, pareil, je perds une vie parceque j'ai des apm de boomer.
Donc mon build, je sais qu'il fonctionne, mais à chaque fois je perds une vie bêtement, de façon aléatoire, parceque j'ai pas les apm.
Et j'ai recommencé 20 fois .. pour des raisons d'apm.

Le truc, c'est que j'ai acheté kingdom rush, et pas starcraft.
J'suis pas venu là pour les apm, j'suis venu là pour résoudre des puzzles.
Je suis pas venu là pour tout micro-manage, je suis venu là pour poser des bâtiments qui me donnent du temps.
Et donc, le fait que ce jeu soit si bien équilibré.... bah ça change sa nature, il a transmuté le truc.
Un tower defense devient un jeu en temps réel.

Alors que si le jeu se contentait de te filer les ressources d'une vague pour la prochaine, bah y'aurait pas du tout besoin d'apm.
Ce qui aurait permit de mettre un peu plus l'accent et la difficulté sur les aspects techniques et stratégiques.
Or, ils ont mit toute la difficulté sur le coté tactique, la gestion des ressources en temps réel.
Ce qui est dommage, de mon point de vue.
J'aurais aimé théoriser un peu plus, en vrai ça vole pas très haut.
Et j'aurais aimé ne pas avoir à spam mes raccourcis clavier.
Un tower defense qui te demande de bien réfléchir où tu mets tes tours... c'est suffisant, on lui en demande pas plus.


Tout cela dit, le jeu est bien, je l'aime bien.
Je le recommande.
J'ai pas fait le dernier, mais je pense c'est le meilleur de la franchise.
Evidemment, c'est un jeu casu, c'est pas là dessus qu'on va se péter le cerveau.
Mais c'est pas vide non plus, ça reste stimulant.
C'est kingdom rush quoi.
J'aurais juste souhaité qu'il reste à sa place et qu'il se prenne pas pour starcraft.

This was a very surprising VN. “Love in the Glen” is about an interior designer called “Zoe Richardson”, who the player controls. Like most visual novels, you go through the story making choices and decisions for her and then watch her destiny unfold in front of your very eyes. In that sense there is nothing new and it’s what you’d expect from a Visual Novel. Not that that’s a bad thing, if you buy a chocolate cake you do expect it to taste like chocolate, do you not?

The surprising thing about it is the storyline. It really doesn’t feel very anime at all. Which does come as a surprise as one does expect a VN to somewhat have an anime feel (remember my chocolate cake reference? Well that applies here too). That being said, it’s not a bad story, the writing is actually pretty damn good. Granted there are some odd moments where you get a surprisingly short storyline, if you embark on one of the long ones you’ll definitely get your money’s worth. Especially if you’re like me and have already read many VN’s and are looking for something different. If you haven’t ever played a VN before then I wouldn’t recommend this game as it is in so many ways not like other VN’s and you might get the wrong impression of the genre.

Other aspects of the VN were rather good too. I liked the cute little mini game and the music was always very nice and fitted the mood really well. Of course it had it’s weak points too, there are no game settings and there are some bits in the story that felt a bit odd.

All in all a good VN with an entertaining story! Chocolate cake!

TL;DR A good all-round VN but rather different to most. I wouldn’t recommend this to someone as his or her first Visual Novel, but for anyone who happens to like them, this is a must-have. | + Liked the inclusion of the match 3 mini-game (though what it has to do with interior design really is a mystery)
+ Unusual setting for a VN
+ I liked the inclusion of a f/f route
+ Variety of characters with unique backgrounds

- Very short (I completed all endings in 57 minutes and the rest of the playtime is idling for cards)
- Boring story (you don't really do much aside from go out to eat and go to work)
- Characters don't really seem different to each other voice-wise and you don't actually get to interact with them much
- There's one part that plays a lengthy audio clip of spoken dialogue with no subtitles | Pros:

- Good writing

- Great music

Cons:

- Styling could be better.

- A bit short (but then again you do get 7 endings)

- Some of the button placements are a bit weird. | I've bought this game based solely on the reviews and oh boy I believe it's worth it only if one buys it on like 50% sale. It starts really nice and the quality of writing is pretty great and it was really interesting up till the endings. Those are too abrupt. This game feels like it should be at least twice the current size. I hit 100% completion in just 3 hours.

Overall I liked the writing but I really didn't like how half-baked the story felt. However it's an indie game and the base price is not too steep and I believe I shouldn't judge it too harshly. So it's a recommendation bearing in mind its shortness. Buy it on sale. | A good improvement compared to the previous titles released by these developers. The art style is simple, and the only thing that bothered me was the lack of expressions on the characters (they usually have all the same face, sometimes it might change just a bit). But that’s a pet peeve of mine, maybe other people won’t see this as a flaw. 

The soundtrack is really good. It was what made me buy this game at first!

Also, this is probably the longest game by these devs. It didn’t felt rushed, the routes were more elaborated and the characters were more likable. Get it on a good sale!

This is the sequel to AdVenture Capitalist, but with a communist twist and completely different interface. The game is a clickcer resource collection game with a nice retro 1950s era look to it. All tho the game is in early access it still plays well and has balanced resources. There are in game purchases to move along quicker but they are not compulsary and you can still advance without them. The dev's seem to take note of the feedback they are given and do regular updates.

Overall an enjoyable game for the clicker genre. | O irmão russo mais novo do AdVenture Capitalist que não deu muito certo!!
Esse jogo tem os mesmo sistemas do AdVenture Capitalist, só com uma dificuldade maior que meio que te obrigado a por dinheiro no jogo pra poder evoluir mais rapido seus fundos, pois se não, fica igual uma lesma...
Outro ponto negativo é por não ter conquistas, que tira a motivação de jogar o jogo...

Então adeus AdVenture Communist :v | As of 1/24/17, this game has become MUCH more playable. Comrades are still a part of the game, but they don't accumulate NEARLY as slow as before. There have been numerous, helpful research trial and experiment improvements added, which aid progression even further. The only downside I can think of is that scientists may be a little too easy to stockpile. You only need to 5 to activate the Comrade x7777 trial, which is one of the main reasons why progression has improved. I would either slim down a few achievement scientist awards, or make the x7777 trial a bit more costly. Aside from that, it's gotten a lot better.

Reviews: Abandoned

祝诸君情人节快乐！

——顺便安利一部非常契合情人节基调的视觉小说游戏，我是说，如果你同我一样没有更加刺激的活动的话，为什么不尝试一点浪漫又谐趣的故事呢（惨兮兮的眼神望着你）。

免费视觉小说中往往有一些非常与众不同的作品，他们或表现着与众不同的题材，或有着深刻的思辨，或者传达着作者本人的心声——比如科幻-犯罪题材的Lucid 9，比如我即将试试的Sepia Tears，比如这部One Thousand Lies。或许在不必顾虑各种功利因素的同时，这些作者也得以摒弃所有俗套的故事和空洞的福利内容（当然客观上也没有这样的条件），而放手写自己想写的东西。作者想得到的也不是盈利，而是大家的正向反馈吧有兴趣的同学可以看看itch上连篇累牍的玩后感，以及作者本人同样长篇大论的回复。

虽说是免费的，但这完全不是粗制滥造的作品，几十首配乐（包含一些不错的钢琴曲），意外养眼的立绘和背景（第一眼就喜欢上了Luce！）以及最重要的，又流畅又幽默的校园生活段落，深刻而内省式的心理描写，以及动人的人物刻画（Luce真是越看越爱啊！）都是明证。我本来只是下下来想稍微看眼这是个怎样的游戏就作罢——但是却鬼使神差的看了十几个小时，忍不住为之而怦然心动（哦，Luce，这个名字虽然像月亮，但其实是太阳！）。

这是一个欧洲小镇青年和他的伙伴们甜蜜中带着点苦涩的成长与情感故事——这么说起来一点感觉都没有，想看更有趣的说明的话不妨看看商店页面上的简介与角色自述（天哪我真希望每个galgame的人设介绍都能是这个风格的），一眼就能看出游戏的与众不同。语言障碍可能是个问题，尤其是开场几个段落的内容比较复杂，不过只要过了这点，就会变成通俗口语的（虽然可能还是夹杂了些心理学术语吧）。我不知道故事里面带有多少自传体色彩，不过记住作者是个安达卢西亚人，他以一己之力把自己的作品从西班牙语翻成了英文，不会很难的。

当然，如果只是为全成就而来的话，这也是个全程ctrl一刻钟就能拿走唯一一个成就的游戏···不过你会错过更重要的东西的，嗯。

最后，Only the truth and nothing else but the truth，如果你还在想是不是该玩下此游戏的话，就试试吧，不会后悔的。
 | Un roman intéractif de très bonne facture, qui, de plus, a le bon goût d'être gratuit.
Graphismes et bande sonore soignés, écriture parfois trop bavarde mais le scénario est bien maîtrisé et original dans sa construction.
L'auteur n'hésite pas à creuser la psychologie des différents personnages, à prendre son temps pour développer leurs relations. 

J'encourage le développeur Keinart Lobre à poursuivre dans cette voie. 
Votre équipe à du talent. | One Thousand lies es una VN F2p en de duración mediana-corta que esta completamente en español.

En esta novela seguimos a un chaval de instituto con sus movidas, sus romances y sus mierdas. Esas cosas que no se describen en análisis por miedo al spoiler.
La historia y trama, aunque bastante buena, esta llena de diálogos de relleno, algunos son bonitos, divertidos  e incluso interesantes, pero que al final no dejan de ser un relleno que te puedes saltar.

El apartado visual es soberbio, de lo mejor que te puedes encontrar en una NV indie, a mi este apartado me ha gustado y resaltado mucho, pues es normal encontrar novelas amateur con dibujos robados de algún software  o con un nivel deplorable, y sin embargo, aquí esta muy bien llevado, e incluso en algo como los fondos lo cual es también bastante complicado lo han sabido llevar.

Los personajes son hermosos [spoiler]¡¡¡Claire best girl!![/spoiler] llenos de vida y carismáticos. ademas hablan un español al que estoy acostumbrado, no tan bestia como el mio en el que 5 de cada 4  palabras son insultos <===== aunque se agradece que se salte este pequeño detalle de la forma de ser aquí, y se agradece.

Y la música es de notable, en mi perfil a día de hoy veis 6 horas jugadas, una parte de esas 6 horas es que me he parado a momentos para escuchar ciertas melodías que me gustaban.


Para acabar, Keinart es uno de los creadores de esta novela, y gracias al maravilloso internet y a que él suele usar el mismo Nick ya me he encontrado bastante de sus perfiles. He pensado seriamente en agregarlo por los jajas, pero no quiero parecer un acosador [spoiler] Vaya, un poco tarde para eso[/spoiler], así que dejare este mensaje aquí para él: Buena Nv, espero la siguiente historia con ganas | "The most sincere person is the greatest liar of all" From soundtracks that fits the ambiance of this skeptic yet profound tale, to characters who you will love and miss and to the plot that binds everything as the package to this feeladelphia comes a game you'll think like its any other. 

Honestly I expected hentai and atleast fanservices but instead its a lot more better (NO HENTAI). Its like the life you never had (have' because you never will). I dont want to spoil anything to you bud but the game really beats the cliches we all hear from highschool love stories. It shows how a boy live the last of his highschool days as steady as he can until the plot happens! He gets to choose for himself... The true lie or the false truth. Well atleast in my perspective thats what it looks like. Oopsie? Spoiled? Ruined? you think you wont play it because i blurted out the truth? well.. Its One Thousand lies. | [h1] One Thousand Lies [/h1]

[b]Оценка: 
   7/10 [/b]

Before I get in to this review as I'm well aware that I am needlessly wordy when writing reviews I'll give you the tl;dr here. I do like this game but it ultimately falls short due to feeling unfair at times. I'm still counting it as recommended as It's no real strain on your wallet and is really fun in small doses, but it's very repetitive and may be annoying. 

Okay now I yap. 

As someone who is fairly unfamiliar with the roguelike genre as a whole, I'm not going to sit here and pretend like I know anything about game balance or really any of the kind of things that make this sort of game tick, but I *will* bounce off of what I have seen other people say as it does line up with my personal experience. 

This game has a lot of good things going for it. The art style is cute and cartoony, the music (what little of it there is) is pleasant, the small animations look nice, the little blurbs of banjo kazooie style speech from the enemies isn't too insufferable and the game as a whole is very easy to pick up and get in to without too much of a learning curve, if any at all. If you're familiar with how to play solitaire in any capacity, you'll understand how this game works. 

The problems start arising with the balance of the encounters. Now, as I said, I know little to nothing about what makes these sort of games work in terms or really anything, but I do have vague ideas about it and I know how the fights feel to me; and that is incredibly unbalanced most of the time. Even on the standard difficulty i find myself getting stuck 3 or 4 fights in most of the time due to not having enough resources to defend myself with. 

Now, I am very aware that perhaps that's just me, maybe I'm just bad at the game, but again, using the insight other reviews have provided I'm inclined to think that at least partially it is not me and that there are some issues with encounter balance. 

I do really love this game, but I find myself either getting sucked in to a loop of getting a few fights in and continually trying with no real progress made or I just end up getting frustrated and quitting out, and honestly that isn't a really pleasant experience. I don't regret purchasing this game, as I do play it frequently, but I am still a little disappointed by it.

I'm a big, big fan of tower defense games and well, it's not always easy to make new games in this genres for many reasons; the most common ones are that virtually all the tower defense games available from Flash websites and all over the stores are made by indie developer studios or single developers, and many of them (like the Kingdom Rush series, Incursion, Gemcraft, Curse Treasure, Protector.. it's full of awesome series :P) deal with similar mechanisms and settings. 
Of course, this is a little bit "forced"; what I'm trying to say is that these games have to follow a precise scheme made up by one or more paths that the enemies will walk on (there can be multiple paths, or different layers so that enemies can climb ladders, or even circular paths like in Protector where before hitting your health points the enemies will "circle" for some rounds over the same path), there are somehow fixed spots for towers (some games give you more freedom of choice, but generally speaking you'd want to put the most effective towers obviously in the places that are more effective against the most enemies) and of course speaking of the towers (or, like in Incursion and Kingdom Rush, towers that spawn 3 different warriors, mages, archers etc.) we're almost every time revolving around similar concepts: archers, magical towers, warrior/tank towers, cannon towers all of them upgradable.
What a developer can do is to polish the graphics, to invent some kind of plot and to put all of his efforts on creating different, entertaining and new upgrades to the towers themselves, so that they will Idk, transform into mecha robots or that the warriors will become paladins or that towers can be built for 5 or 6 floors like in the awesome Giant and Dwarves game by the Labugames studio.
So, when you go outside lines traced by your ancestors (xD) you assume all the risks of creating something unenjoyable. I played dozens of tower defense games which tried to create new systems, like 3D sci-fi games or such, but they ultimately ended to be difficult to enjoy and very repetitive, like the developers had played all the classic games before and wanted at all costs to create a totally different game. Unfortunately, tower defense games are most effective when they're placed into a medieval/fantasy setting - of course speaking of fantasy you can add all the mages and the mech things you want, but my idea is that the simple "protect your kingdom" idea is the best one, or "protect your gems" if you look to Cursed Treasure or similar series, always set in a medieval fantasy setting.
This game, as the title says, makes use of a traditional medieval setting with a glimpse of charm by creating a 3D world - something that it's impossible to have on a Flash website, hence I sincerely recommend you to play this game full-screen 'cos even on a wide monitor it's difficult to see everything properly, trust me xD I always try everything windowed but this game needs to be played fullscreen and has no problems at all of crashing or freezing.
Three champaigns are available, and three difficulty settings too - starting from normal and not easy unfortunately, but it's ok ahah xD; every champaign (only the first will be available at the beginning) consists of 20 different levels set in a similar world.
Ok, sometimes you'll get hints of a storyline but yeah, I appreciate that the developers tried to give to the game a less casual outfit but it's nothing remarkable xD Anyways, you'll be always in a 3D setting which can be zoomed in and out and moved by dragging the mouse cursor and well, everything works pretty much as every other medieval-settled tower defense game.. and to me, for only 0,99€, it works greatly.
You have a fundamental fast forward button, your health points that get damaged if the enemies make to your base castle, the amount of money you can spend and on the upper right side the number of waves - nothing new, everything good :)
With hotkeys automatically assigned to numbers from 1 onwards, you'll have to put your selected towers on fixed squares all over the map; here you don't have fighters but just towers that of course will launch different projectiles - bolts, arrows, cannonballs, bullets and so on (overall, six different towers) - and you'll be able to upgrade them in order to increase range, damage, fire speed rate and so on. The WASD keys will prove to be extremely useful to navigate the maps, but the fast forward/pause system works nice and you have all your time to plan everything. And of course you'll have the usual spells: meteors, hammers from the sky, paralyzing roots and so on.
Plus, every tower is upgradable to different levels (some towers cap at 3, others at 5 and so on) and many levels will require some strategy and not putting the same tower everywhere and let the enemies come to you xD
Of course, you will have the chance to buy upgrades between levels: mainly spells as I said, but also upgrades for your in-game towers; you'll be able to carry on only four different magics on the playground :)
The game lacks something; hotkeys for spells, a button to send waves earlier, easier system to upgrade your towers, some more work in order to place better buttons like Start and so on, but really for an indie tower defense game coming out at 0,99€ I don't really get what we could expect more.
I get an objection I read somewhere: this games seems to be available for free on smartphones. Admitting that I don't play that much on phones, on one hand I don't really understand how such a 3D broad game like this can be correctly played on such a little screen but on the other hand I think that 1€, 0,5€ as it's now on sale or even less if you've got a coupon is not a big expense at all, considered that there are no DLCs or microtransactions in game - by buying the game you'll have everything and you'll just have to play, grind get money, upgrade your towers and face the difficult levels and bosses and so on.
Yes, it's a classic tower defense games and yes, it doesn't offer anything new but it's great to have games like this on Steam and even for a (very old and) long-time tower defense player like me it proved to be a solid title in its genre, not boring at all and worth to be played. Graphics are very nice, the gameplay offers a great difficulty curve and the six towers and all the other upgrades and magics you can buy make this title, in my opinion, a nice one in its genre. 
Of course I have always to add my two cents in the end: you need to like tower defense games, and you also have to know that there are dozens of better tower defense games than this one, sometimes much better. But this doesn't subtract anything to the value of this game - and I'm always the first to downvote a game not worth to be bought and played.
So, for a 1€ (at its highest non-sales price) game, this has lots of longevity and although it doesn't offer anything new, it's enjoyable for what concerns both gameplay, upgrading system and graphics; it's difficult but it's also very fast. I get the "boring"/"grindy" objections but well.. are there tower defense games that don't require grinding? Ahah :)
This is why I said that I'd not suggest this one for a tower defense beginner.. I'd rather suggest them to go on Kongregate or ArmorGames and try some tower defense games on Flash; this one is super enjoyable and funny but not for a beginner who doesn't like grinding or is new to these games' mechanics, even 'cos this games doesn't offer an extensive tutorial at all - you won't need any tutorial for a classid TD game, but if you're new to the genre maybe it could have been useful.
Overall, don't buy this only for the trading cards if you like the genre.. it may not be in the top-10 of the tower defense/strategy games ever published, but it's still a good title :) | Genel anlamda tower defense oyunları her zaman hoşuma gitmiştir ama bu oyunda ısınamadığım bir olay var o da gerçekten düzensiz savaşların gerçekleştiği gerçeği, sürekli olarak düz bir taktik kurmak yerine ihtiyaca göre şekillendirmeye çalışmışlar ama o kadar fazla karışık mob türü geliyor ki bir süre sonra insanın uğraşası gelmiyor.

Yine de vakit geçirebilir gibimsi.
yada vazgeçtim yok öyle bir şey. | Ein schönes und gutes kleines klassisches Tower Defense Spiel.
Das Spiel existiert bereits für mobile. Es gibt 3 Kampangen und die ersten beiden Kampangen enthalten je 20 Missionen, für die zweite muß man die erste durch haben.
Die Grafik der Türme, Gegner und Map ist knuddelig.
Die Maps sind klein und man bebaut fast immer alle freien Bauplätze. In späteren Wellen ist man dann nur noch mit Upgrades und Sonderattacken beschäftigt.
Schon in der ersten Kampange sind sich einige Maps sehr ähnlich, aber rmit unterschiedlichen Gegnerwellen.
Auf einigen Karten taucht in der letzten Welle ein Boss auf, dann muß man schnell Türme abreissen und die passenden Türme bauen, falls man die Resourcen hat. Es gibt keine Vorschau über die Gegner der nächsten Welle und man kann keine Wellen zurückspulen.
Die 6 Türme haben keine einstellbaren Zielprioritäten. 

[u]Schwierigkeitsgrad/Grinding/Belohnungssystem[/u]
Neben [i]Normal[/i] gibt es noch 2 weitere Schwierigkeitsgrade, die aber auch nach der zweiten Kampange nicht freigeschaltet sind, für sie wird man wohl beste Ausrüstung brauchen.
Für gewonnene Maps erhält man einen zufälligen Ausrüstungsgegenstand und eine kleine Menge Kristalle mit denen man im internen Shop bessere Ausrüstungsgegenstände einkaufen kann.
Für gescheiterte Missionen gibt es gar nichts, aber sie zählen für Achivements, die auch mit Kristallen belohnt werden. Die erste Kampange konnte ich mit den zufälligen Ausrüstungsgegenständen abschliessen, aber um in der zweiten Kampange Erfolg zu haben, braucht man entweder sehr viel Glück bei den Drops oder muß Achivements grinden. Die vernünftigen Dinge im Shop sind teuer. 

[u]Nervig[/u]
Beim Plazieren von Türmen oder Sonderattacken kann einem der Infotext im Weg sein, dann vermisst man auch die Möglichkeit die Karte zu drehen.

[u]Fazit[/u]
1. Kampange (20 Maps): Ich habe für das Spiel 1,94€ bezahlt und hatte meinen Spass, manch andere Spiele in dieser Preisklasse sind kleiner als die erste Kampange.
2. Kampange (20 Maps): Nach den ersten Missionen dieser Kampange fiel ich in ein Grindingsloch, um mir ein dringend benötigtes Ausrüstungsteil zu kaufen. Auf Dauer fehlt die spieleriche Abwechslung, wenn die meisten Maps gerade mal 6 bis 8 Bauplätze haben und der Schwierigkeitsgrad nach dem Grindingsloch stagniert. 
3. Kampange (12 Maps): Wie in Kampange zwei gibt es keine neuen Türme, sondern nur optisch neue Gegner, hier die Drachen. Die Maps enthalten ein paar Turmbauplätze mehr, aber auch hier läuft man wieder in ein Grindingsloch.

Mehr Empfehlungen (hauptsächlich Tower Defense Spiele):
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/8896126-Gametests-and-Videos | Just... don't get this, it's visuals are janky, the gameplay is boring, it just kind of exists. Seriously, if you want a good tower defense game, go play kingdom rush, if you don't own a tablet go download bluestacks and get kingdom rush. If you finish all the kingdom rush games go download empire warriors TD, it's free. Just don't waste 3$, not worth it, just a heap of pixels. | Nette und günstige Unterhaltung für Zwischendurch.

Habe das Spiel für 49 Cent im Angebot gekauft und habe mir nicht viel erhofft.
Es sieht zwar aus wie eine billige, etwas kindhafte Warcraft 3 Tower Defense Modifikation, aber es spielt sich dennoch unerwartet unterhaltsam.

Es gibt 3x 20 Missionen, 6 Türme mit Upgrades, etliche Gegner, ein Bonusitemsystem, Achievements und 3 Schwierigkeitsgrade, also eigentlich alles was man erwarten dürfte.
Vermutlich wird man später ein wenig grinden müssen, um die besten Items zu bekommen/sich kaufen zu können, aber was soll's.

Was mich noch ein wenig stört sind die fehlenden Gegner Stats im Spiel.
Ich klicke immer gerne auf Monster um zu sehen, wie stark die sind und was die evtl. können.
Auch würde ich mir wünschen Gegner anzuklicken, damit alle Türme darauf schießen.
Die Musik ist ähnlich der Grafik nicht so pralle.

Preis-Leistung ist jedenfalls super und daher gehört dieses Spiel auf jeden Fall in die Spielesammlung.


Update:

Bin nun durch. Hat sehr viel Spaß gemacht. Man benötigt das Gold Item für 10K und den Schadensbonus für 30K. Alles mit Kanonentürme, Ballisten und Eistürme vollpflastern und ihr schafft es komplett ohne grinden zu müssen in einem Durchgang.
Das Balancing ist gut. Da quasi nur eine Taktik mit den wichtigen Türmen funktioniert und der Rest eher unnütz ist und die oben angesprochenen kleinen Abzüge bei Grafik, Sound und Spielkomfort ergeben am Ende eine

	Очень простая идея игры, что игрок в роли короля старается править своим государством в максимально упрощённом стиле. Перед вами буквально меняются карты с людьми и их просьбами, которые можно только сбрасывать вправо или влево. От чего меняются параметры королевства. Всего их доступно 4: церковь, народ, армия и казна. При достижении одного в пороге максимум или минимум король умирает или изгоняется. Мда, правь хорошо и всё равно убьют! Задумано, что требуется держать все параметры приблизительно посередине. 

	Кроме правления есть мини игра по фехтованию в которой местами победить легко или сложно. Атака/защита продвигает персонажей вперед/назад от чего происходит движение по полю с клетками. Оказавшийся за краем погибает. Да, все действия принимаются исходя из выбранного ответа, который вы дадите карточке.

	Самое интересное происходит, когда удаётся вмешаться в конфликт, что слегка изменит местоположение игры и добавит новых карт болтунов. Изредка можно нарваться и на мощные бонусы. Например, высокая стена, что не позволит вашей армии опуститься ниже 0 или центральный банк, что возьмёт на себя часть трат из казны. Таких при себе возможно иметь только 4 штуки.

	К сожалению после часа игры вы столкнётесь с постоянными одинаковыми диалогами, ответы на которые уже известны. Да, в игре есть часть диалогов, где будет по факту один ответ. До конца доживут не многие, ведь предстоит дожить до 2000 года, когда и возможно получить 2 из 3 концовок в зависимости от ответа. Для достижения такого момента предстоит играть ну часа 4 наверное. Игра на первом получасе показывает всё что может предложить.

	Графика у игры простая, что и на первых смартфонах бы работало. Музыка достаточно приятная и простая.

I'm going to write a review about this game looking at it more as a F2P FPS than a Ghost in the Shell game. Yes its in the title. Yes the character models and things are there and people are getting annoyed because its missing some key aspects of the series. 

But im going to cut that out and focus on the gameplay, mechanics and the pros and cons of it being currently in its Early Access state. Ive played going on 5 hours straight of matches while taking in the things I saw to help clear up any uncertainties people may have. (Be gentle its my first review and it's long)

Lets begin with the PROS that I found were good.

+Movement. It responds well. Decent running and movement animation. Even the action animations are solid. No bugs personally seen yet there

+Firefights are tricky in a good way since you cannot shoot through your own teammates and friendly grenades can kill you

+The look and feel of the game is pleasant and easy on the eyes. Yes people complain about the engine its on but its really quite decent. 

+There is a market where you can spend in game currency (not NXcoins) to buy attachments, guns and other things. But so far, the things I can unlock through play are equal if not better than the things I can buy. Not to mention a laser accessory that I could unlock is 9900 GP to buy compared to a 44000 market one.

+As for weapons, each one has its prime situation. Yes the sniper is OP in damage. Yes the AR is better at medium range. Yes the SMG is lighter and allows you to be more agile. Every weapon has a field it excels in and overall its balanced decently well. "Oh man this is so stupid. To get a better weapon I need to spend 200k GP. What a piece of BS". Again, no you dont. You -can- buy it if you want to but the first weapon you unlock is a MP5 or whatever and its pretty decent boosting pretty much all stats less some damage(barely) and effective range from the starter. Pfff, who needs range on a high ROF close range SMG.

+Community. So far every room I have had the pleasure of joining has been nice, friendly and all around enjoyable. Well except for the one guy who apparently was getting away with his bad internet and one guy always seemed to be on the receiving end aha. 

+Leveling and Currency. Now I'm not sure if it will stay like this but currently, as you level you get 50k GP to spend on things. "Wow! Thats a lot!” Why yes little Timmy it is. Seeing as you can get 500GP per loss up to 1000 on a win. Not that slow I'll say that much. You can level pretty fast as well. Of course getting more wins than losses speeds it up but I like to think with my current play time and level, I managed to average a little over a level in about an hour

 PRO/CON
 
+-I personally like the skill system. But I’ll put this as a PRO/CON since it comes up a lot in other discussions. At the beginning of a match you automatically start with your tier 1 skill (200points). As you get kills/assists/do game mode objectives, you get points that refill that gauge to a max of 400 points for the tier 2 level of the skill 

There are added benefits to saving up to tier 2 and not using your skill every time you can. FYI your skill has a cooldown meter to limit fast consecutive uses if you are on a bloody, messy, mass murdering killing spree. But during that time you may obtain points towards your next skill use. So its not all that bad. Even more reason to save up those precious points

I can see how people dislike it if your team is getting completely steam rolled and its hard to fill. But you automatically regen skill points until your skill bar reaches tier 1. Albeit slow, but its something. 

+-Hitboxes. Ah yes, the double edged sword. I like to think that its both, in its current state, helpful and frustrating. I also believe its not just the hitbox but the weapon firing as well that is also a contributing factor. More so the former though. Many times have I tried to gun down someone running up some stairs at me to have him take 25%-50% damage to only knife me in the animated melee kill. But also to run down a hallway away from 3 enemies firing auto weapons at me to get away and lead them unsuspectingly into a pod of my own team for the assists. As I said, it works both ways. Hoping it will get tweaked soon

+-Mobile Agility AKA "Parkour". A little rough around the edges. You cant jump very high so you cant climb on top to many things to either get a vantage spot or cut corners. Granted at this stage its both good and bad. It currently in a way levels the field so everyone is even. There are prompts to press W+Space to "vault" over/up small ledges but some things I hoped were climbable were unfortunately not  

+- Healing. Now some people are unhappy that you can't regenerate or heal completely. Cough Cough CoD Players Cough Cough. Well they are right up to a certain point. Now this game is listed as a Tactical Shooter if im not mistaken. So if you were able to just wait for your wounds to heal (looks at certain types of players) then get right back at it, where's the tactics? The stress of not taking damage? The thrill when you kill 3 people alone and survive with 3 hp left to only to feel useless afterwards because you will die to a flesh wound or graze of a bullet. Well fear not. 

Remember how earlier above I mentioned Tier 2 abilities? Well some of those are shareable. "Shareable? How does that work?' Play the game yourself and figure it out. KIDDING. Some abilities once you reach tier 2 are able to be "Downloaded" by up to 3 other operatives. But how does this relate to healing you ask? Well one operatives has Nano Armor I believe its called or whatever. In short, it allows the user and 3 other operatives to gain increased armor and health regen during its duration at tier 2 or just the user at tier 1. I like to think of these operative as either support or tactical roles. Look, there's that word again, tactical. Tactics. Strategy.

Now for the more unhappy part

CONS

- Matchmaking Balancing. I have gone into a match or two where it started as 5v2 and was really one sided. Granted players were matched onto the other team to balance it out, but not until the game was half over with a 20 kill lead. Thats something else I would hope gets fixed pretty soon.

- Glitches(not in game). Some people, myself including, who got one of the early access packs with a character unlock have not/ did not get our free character unlocks at lvl 3 and lvl 5. Currently I have a ticket with this problem sent and am waiting for a response, but will update this if possible with an answer to it. (Edit - Recieved)

-Only a few map types. In Team Deathmatch at least, there are only 3 maps. With the right strategy and team cooperation, either side of a maps starting point can be a winner. Some are less advantaged as others but can be sorted out if you push far enough to rotate the respawn points of the enemy team around. Which also brings me to another CON

-Spawning. I wont lie, I have taken advantage of this. Every once and a while ill go off out of a firefight to flank in from behind the enemy to only end up at their current respawn spot to get a few easy respawn kills before they realize it. Im not proud of it, just extorting this unfortunate algorithm of respawning in an area with enemies around. As I mentioned above the respawn point will move once too many get too close. But one, maybe even two people get there, then they get a few free kills before it realizes and moves. 

Honestly, I really do enjoy playing this game and I really like the concept, structure and form this game has. Sure its still a bit bare bones and what not. Its early access, give it a bit of a break. Things will be worked on, added, fixed, adjusted and tinkered with as it grows. 

But if you read all of this or even just took the time to skim it and pick out the certain things you wanted to know, thank you for your time.
